Overall-good

500ml bottle into weizen glass. Toasty wheat nose, a little pepper. Cloudy dark bronze beer with a tower of white foam. Fruity and light on tasting, finish is subtly malty. A gentle peppery fruitiness becomes apparent late on. Very pleasant & easy to drink.
Butelka. Barwa ciemno miedziana, mętne. Piana ecrue, drobna, obfita, utrzymuje się. Aromat słodowy. W smaku kwaskowate, lekko kwaskowate, z wyczuwalnym karmelem. Piwo średnio nasycone.
Nice eheat beer, with some smoked aroma and bready taste. Bit watery but easy drinking.

Color ámbar oscuro, con media cabeza de espuma y buena retención, buenos aromas a malta tostada, fruta ácida y galleta, en boca entrada fácil y refrescante con notas a manzana ácida, cuerpo y carbónico medios, fácil de beber al ser baja en alcohol, notas ligeramente picantes y maltosas.
Cor marrom clara, turva. Espuma boa e de média persistência, bege e cremosa. No aroma toffee e cereais. Paladar frutado. Retrogosto suave.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2015 0,5l bottle. Ah, thats the way I love my Weizenbier. Tasty, refreshing and very drinkable. Prost!
Edit: This beer deserves a 5. Excellent, delicious Weissbier!
Fémes, édes, banános. Gyümölcsössége és pörkölt kávéssága alacsony. Érdekes... felejthethető. Nem rossz.
500cc bottle. Pours ruby with thick creamy head. Wheat and fruity. It is sweet and with some roastyness, finishes slightly bitter.
No jest ok. Fajny aromat, bardzo dobry wygląd i bardzo pijalne. Kolejny udany Franziskaner...

Piwo bardzo delikatne, ladny i czysty aromat. Wyczuwalne banany. Jak dla mnie troche za delikatny smak i zapach. Piwo dosc wodniste. Lekkie szczypanie w jezyk. Piana obfita ale szybko degraduje do kozuszka. Przyjemne piwo ale troszke za wodniste. Trafilem bardzo swiezy rozlew bo sprzed 3 miesiecy. Fajne na upal.
Dark purple colour with white creamy head. Aroma of plums, wheat, little metall notice. Similar are flavours, taste is sweet with little hoppy - iron finish. carbonation is low. Good beer.
Bottle at Hotel Residence in Sandnes with KL 17.04.15. Very dark orange. Small off-white head. Aroma of unfresh, tropical fruits, green apples and toffee. Fruity taste, with.dry, red berries.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2016 Great looking pour, rich brown, thick/tan head. Aroma of malt, yeast, bread, grass. Taste is well balanced, with hints of chocolate, nuts, citrus ... creamy maltiness. A bit watery on the palate, with some oiliness, good follow-thru, moderate bitterness. Overall: one of my favorite dark weissbiers.
on tap awhile ago...amber color with a fluffy white head..aroma of malted barley,bread,hops..dry,malty..not impressed.

This beer pours an opaque brown with a large off-white head that fades somewhat quickly. The aroma blends banana with somewhat nutty malts and wheat, and the taste is mildly sweet and a touch umami with a hearty wheat yet sweet banana flavor in the aftertaste. The palate fuses a soft carbonation, slick texture, and a medium body.
Bottle. Pours a hazy brown colour, aroma has roasted malts, the taste is sweet with a short bitter finish.
home dark brown colored body with a white head and a fruity malt hops yeast aroma a spicy fruity malt hops bitter chocolate taste with a bitter finish

500ml bottle into mug. Minneapolis. 

Pours deep brown with amber tint. Quite cloudy. Generous off white head.

Aroma is really nice. Yeasty, plum, roasted malts. 

Taste is sweet, but less so than other dunkels (comparing next to ayinger and weihenstephaner). Still pretty well balanced. 

Body is medium-light. Actually a little thin for a weissbier. Average carbonation. Medium finish. 

Aroma is good on this beer, but the body is lacking relative to peers. I prefer Weihenstephaner.
This is classic and I love weizens, dunkels even more. A rock steady German masterpiece. You pick it and you are sure it is good.

Bottle from de Albert Heijn. The beer is dark amber colored, a little hazy and pours a large cream colored head. The aroma is fresh and fruity, with tones of bananas and citrus, roasted malts, a hint of caramel and spices. The taste is malty, fruity and medium bodied, a little watery also but not disturbing. The finish is fresh and light bitter and is long noticable.

Bottle. Hazy brown, medium beige head. Aroma malts, over-ripe bananas. Sweet malty taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The best dunkel of the evening! Hazy brown with a thin head. Caramel and banana with a bit of roast.
Pours brown with a light head. Smells smoothly of malts biscuit and caramel. Smooth and easy drinking on the palate. Good

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2015 Big off-white head with good retention. Cloudy dark amber with reddish hues. Aroma is citric with banana, some caramel and spicy notes. Taste is ripe fruit, banana and clove hues and citric-sweet aftertaste. Ligth body with medium carbonation.
the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of vanilla and toffee... the taste is caramel with notes of resin, banana, toffee, dry fruits and some spices... sweet and dry aftertaste...

500 ml bottle. Very sweet smell, felt banana, caramel, cereal. Brown color with big white head. Soft carbonatation flavour, sweet. The taste doesnt full the entire mouth though. Fantastic beer! If youre between this one and the weissen, go for this one a million times!

Bottle at Fiddler. Pours hazy amber brown with an off white head. Aroma of yeast, caramel, toffee, butterscotch. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter. Light medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Trübes, fruchtiges, malzig-frisches Bier. Hefig, fruchtig mit leicht dunklen Einschlägen. Hefe, Röstmalz, nett.

Kicsit áttetsző, ködös barna sok sárgás habbal. Illata édes tejkaramella, kukoricás élesztős, vaniliás. Édes de nem testes, enyhe pörkölt maláta és pirítós aroma. Visszafogott savanykás íz és sok szénsav. Itatja magát.
Marrom, turva e com média formação de espuma. Notas mais tostadas, algo de café com leve frutado. Corpo leve pra médio com final curto e suave

This was my absolute favorite beer during the time I spent in Germany. It went well with any meal in any weather. I enjoyed it!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottiglia 50 CL, colore ambrato scuro con una schiuma fine e poco persistente, aroma e sapore sono essenzialmente uguali alla weiss classica della franziskaner, mi sarei aspettato un maggiore sapore tostato e maltato.
Brood, bloemig, graan, kruiden een lekker bier om te drinken aan het eind van een zomerse dag of op wintersport

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Bottle from El Corte Inglés (Barcelona, Spain). Appearance: Brown color. Hazy body. High carbonation. Large, rocky, light, intense white and lingering head. Aroma: Wheat roasted malts. Bread, cereals, caramel and fruits. Taste: Medium sweetness. Palate: Medium and lightly creamy body. Bittersweet aftertaste.
banana, cereal, floral, golden, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, lively,

Za dawnych czasów studeckich piwo, które kosztowało dwa razy tyle co Lech Premium, było pozycją zakazaną i co z tym idzie - bardzo kuszącą. Franziskaner od bardzo dawna gościł na półkach polskich marketów, długo zanim zaczęła się piwna rewolucja. Wygląda też na produkt ekskluzywny, a w swojej ciemnej wersji nie miał jeszcze okazji u mnie gościć. Miałem nadzieję na dość dobrego Dunkelweizena, ale niestety się zawiodłem. Piwo miało dość ładną, brązową barwę, było mętne i wieńczyła je niewielka piana, która szybko pozostała wspomnieniem. Aromaty weizena były wyczuwalne, ale niezbyt intensywne. Przeniosło się to także na smak. Dodatkowo piwo było wodniste i mało pijalne jak na styl... Średnio, bardzo średnio!

Pours a brown color, topped with a frothy tan colored head. Lasts for some time. Malty aroma, notes of caramel and banana. Slight sweetness and caramel taste in the beginning, some yeasty notes and medium bitterness in the finish. Not my favourite.

Pours mahogany color with a fantastic pillowy, lasting off-white head. The banana ester is at a minimum, which is nice, the phenolic spices are faint, mostly sarsaparilla and licorice flavors. Overall, a nice Dunkelweizen.

Bottle. Brown color with medium fluffy disappearing head. Aroma of yeast, banana, flowery hops and caramel. Taste is medium sweet. Texture is watery. Finish is sweet and rather short. Good dunkelweizen.

La Dunkel presenta un cuerpo medio-alto algo más amarga que su hermana, aunque bien balanceado con el dulzor de la malta. Posee notas de trigo tostado que recuerdan al pan recién hecho, ciertos aromas a fruta madura y un ligero toque de regaliz. El final es medio, predominando notas dulces de malta con un leve amargor.
http://www.estucerveza.com/franziskaner- 1,60
sweet malt aroma. dark red/brown in color with a fast fading head. flavor is malty with a faint cherry flavor then finishes with a faint banana/ clove, light on body
Flasche. Gießt dunkel rubinrot mit neiget Schaumkrone ein. Aromen von dunklen Malzen, Orangenschale und Banane. Malzig-süß im Geschmack mit einem herberen Abgang. Gute Menge an CO2. Genießbar.

As far as wheat beers go, this one is really, really good! I enjoyed several of these over the holidays at my folks house, in bottles. The pour is a light brown color with an off-white head. The head doesnt leave a whole lot of lacing around the glass, though. The nose is full of banana, clove, yeast, bread and some light hops. The flavors are very well-balanced, with more notes of banana, clove, flowery hops, yeast and a bit of toasted malt and caramel. Very delicious wheat beer!

50cl bottle at a german bar, poured a murky brown colour with a tanned head. aroma of malts, dark caramel malts, caramel, roast, some coffee and banana hints, orange, yeast, figs, overall a nice beer with some dark taste

Bottle, 500ml. Pours dark brown, mostly clear, tall foamy light head. Aroma is fruity, wineous, wheat, corn, banana, light vanilla and malt. Mouth feel is light and watery to oily. Carbonation is very soft, almost flat. Taste is quite sweet and somewhat sour, not bitter at all. Flavor is wineous, fruity, wheat, malt, noticeable hop flavors. OK, but simple, slightly boring and very very light.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 0,5 l bottle. Really hazy, brown with a thick, foamy, tan head. Weak aroma of banana, cloves, nuts, dates and caramel. Sweetish taste of banana, cloves, nuts and caramel. Slightly bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel, medium to full body, average carbonation. Decent Dunkelweizen that is highly quaffable but also lacking excitement.

Ah, une blanche allemande (style, au froment) de couleur brune, je mattendais à pas grand chose et finalement elle est très sympa. Manque un poil de caractère. Bouteille offerte (provenance inconnue) bue le 03/09/2014.

Really good--zesty wheatiness and other hefe notes as expected. The malt addition is more notable in this ones appearance than its taste, but subtlety isnt a bad thing (couldve easily ruined the whole thing) even if means that the beer doesnt stand out as much as it could have.
Dark pour, white head. Fruit, wheat, toast and clove aroma. Flavor follows aroma. Medium body with a nice creamy feel.
Nevelig bruin bier met bescheiden, crèmewitte kraag. Aroma van mouten, banaan, koffie. Licht zuur, medium bitter. Wel wat waterig, verder prima bier.

Copper color. Very cloudy. Weak head.
Banana and other fruits in aroma. Light wet cardboard. Light yeasts hints.
Somewhere in the middle there are roasted notes.
Rather sweet with slight bitterness. Quite pleasant.
Average carbonation, thin texture and light body.

Refreshing as befits wheat beer, but aromas are weak. Its quite ok I guess.
Bottle. Pours muddy Brown with an off-White head. Banana and a bit of coffee/chocolate. YEasty, sweet and a bit bitter. Pretty good.

Munichoise de 5 % abv, avec levure, en bouteille de 50 cl.
Couleur brun roux foncé. Clarté nette. Bulles fines en colonne centrale.
Mousse qui est un nappage beige tendre correct à 1 mm.
Arômes assez métalliques, mais avec un peu de figue, du parchemin et de la mélasse de betterave.
1ère bouche douce sur du malt brun, quelques épluchures de fruits et de pomme de terre.
Arrière-bouche sans ampleur, un peu fade.
2ème sur un mélange malt/houblon dun goût douteux.
Arrière-bouche très courte, et beaucoup moins sympa, avec des relents de caoutchouc.
3ème assez indéfinie, malt et houblon quelconque.
Arrière-bouche sans tenue, plate.
La longueur ne redresse rien.
Les jambes sont groupées, un peu marquées.
La levure est douce, correcte.
Lalcool ne peut aider dans pareil cas : 1. il est trop faible 2. il y a trop à corriger.
La finale est banale.
CONCLUSION : bière très décevante, absolument surcotée sur le site.
Excelente cerveja, forte nas notas mas suave ao mesmo tempo, se isso é possível. Caramel, basement aromas
Truly delicious! Unexpectedly extremely malty yet had a nice yeasty wheaty backbone as well. Not entirely caramel/chocolate malt either.... Very good brew.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2014 (Bottle) Nice spicy aroma. Dang, this tastes good. Its quite dry and theres some astringency which detracts, especially because there isnt much in the way of lingering flavors. Great dark fruitiness in this one.

Bottle. Dark brown colour, frothy head, lasts long, no lacing. Aroma is white bread, dough, banana, figs, a bit of citrus. Light sweetness, slightly bitter and sour. Creamy texture, medium body, lively carbonation. Very good!
Dégustée à Hannover dans un pub près de la red line. Première expérience d?une dunkel. Me fait pensé à une bière de blé, mais de couleure foncée.
Pours a dark roasted brown with vanilla head. Smells nutty and sweet. Medium/full body with tastes of malt and hay. Nice dunkel.
Dark brown hazy color with high head. Aroma of banana. Taste is lightly sweet with some bitterness. A bit oily feeling, soft carbonation. Ok weissbeer.
Malt herbal hop flavour. Murky brown colour great head and lacing. Malt Hop herbal flavour. Fizzy lingering palate.

Là voilà ma Dunkel-Weizen favorite. Elle contient tout ce que lon demande au genre.Robe brune et extrêmement trouble.Corps velouté.Arômes de bananes mûres et de malt discrètement torréfiés, levures épicées : cannelle, girofle.Belle douceur (jamais liquoreuse) englobant le tout.

Dark and malty, this is a nice beer to pair with meats, but also a nice beer to end the evening. Not too heavy, with a yeasty aroma and thick taste. I keep this beer year-round...it's a solid go-to beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle from a beer store that I used to live near. Unfortunately the best before date is Jan 2015. Pours cloudy brown with a small beige head with low retention. Aroma of caramel, biscuit and banana. Taste is caramel and banana. Its an enjoyable beer. Shame my bottle wasnt very fresh.

In short: cereal malty beer.
Aroma: weak malt aroma.
Taste: sweet, kind of watery.
Palate: too soft, kind of thick.
Couleur brune, bonne mousse beige qui disparait. Nez leger banane et caramel. Gout veille banane assez rapide puis caramel, levures. Corps assez leger. Fin un peu caramel grillé.

Bottle poured into weizen glass. Dark brown colour with thin beige head. Medium carbonation. Yeasty aroma. Taste is fruity, sweet with low bitterness. Sweet/sour aftertaste. Overall great example of the style. Great refreshing beer for hot summer days.

Bottle poured into a tall weissbier glass. Eyes closed, this shouldnt taste like a pale weissbier, and it doesnt quite. The dark grains add a very light touch. But its supposed to be subtle. Some banana. Maybe it wasnt its freshest.

"a textbook example of the style, though not my favorite style. Within the styles limits, though, it cant get much better than this. good balance in the nose and flavor between fruity/yeasty notes (and later slight spice) and the wheat and hops, which come out just enough in the finish. pours a deep brown with off white-tan head that lasts. good beer."

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 0.5l bottle served in my Weihenstephaner Weizen glass.
Enjoyed in ServiÃ¨se - Switzerland, its Christmas time!
A: Pors a dark beige nutty color. Hazy. Forms a small beige head with low retention and practically no lacings left. However, a very thin layer remains for long
S: Bananas and cloves in upfront, followed by the sweet malts, honey, wheat and bready yeasts. Quite a good perfume
T: Taste is less impressive than the smell. Again, the banana-cloves combination in upfront. A bit bubblegum too. Strong notes of caramel malts and wheat. In overall, smooth and dry in the mouth, and quite bready. Very low bitterness. German Weissbier style
M: Light smooth body. Medium carbonation. Bready grainy and slightly sweet aftertaste
O: Good drinkability. Easydrinking. Not as good as the Hefe-Weizen version but still a nice and pleasant German "to the bone" beer
[ BA Review @ 2/10/2010 ]

Cor ambar, transparente, de espuma bege e persistente.
Aroma de trigo torrado e malte.
Sabor leve, torrado e um pouco adocicado.

Poured from bottle to glass. Amber hue with wite head that lingered. Aroma is clove, banana, straw, yeast. Mouthfeel is nice with medium light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness followed by a slight sulphur finish. Overall this is a decent brew.

Bottle 0.5l. Cloudy brownish with medium off-white head. Yeasty aroma, sweet banana, date honey, malty. Sweetish banana flavor, yeasty, light bitterness. Smooth texture, medium carbonation, light to medium body. Sweetish aftertaste. Very good.

Significant Spicy coriander wheat aroma with some dark fruitiness. Delicious aroma. Very subtly reddish brown with a fast dissipating but active head. Flavour is rich, spiced fruity, with a clear mouthfeel and a slight metallic flavour. Not quite as full s the aroma suggested might be but still got some nice stuff going on.
A Cola of the beer world!

Amber-brown near-clear body with some red tones, light tan creamy and bumby head, not much lacings. Aroma; caramel malts, cocoa, milk, floral hops, dust and grass. Taste; caramel malts, grassy hops, cocoa milk, ripe banana. Nice and clean on palate. Milky finish with notes of cocoa and caramel. Sweet, clean-feeling and nice after dinner, or with fruit dish. [50cl brown bottle, abv5%, BB23-01-2015, Getränktemarkt]

Aroma: banana, yeast, wheat, grain malts. Appearance: hazy, dark brown, massive, frothy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: sweets coming up, very malty, cereal, yeast, cereals, relatively short sweet finish. Overall: nice Dunkelweizen, prefer the regular one. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.
Good looking beer that is too low on flavor and too heavily carbonated to be really pleasant.
Noe dunkel mørkebrun farve med minimalt beige skum. Lukt av mørk malt, banan og krydder. Smak av mørk malt, karamell, banan og krydder. Vinmonopolet.
50cl @ bottle. Non amo le birre tedesche in generale, ma questa va giù che è un piacere. Ottima birra per bevute abbondanti.

500ml bottle. Hazy brown colour, copper glimmer, average, frothy, off-white head. Sweet-ish wheaty aroma, notes of banana, a bready touch, yeasty overtones. Taste is minimally to moderately sweet dark malty, wheaty, notes of banana, a bready touch, yeasty overtones, fruity hints of red berries. Franziskaner yeast is still the best compared to all other widely distributed German Weissbiers.
Brun med høyt og tett skum. Fin aroma av malt, gjær, banan og tørket frukt. I smaken finner jeg malt, karamell, litt metall og noe fruktig. Tynn/medium konsistens. Litt tørr.
Bottle 50cl. Pours a medium.brown with a beige head. Malty aroma with some caramell.

Cloudy, dirty dark brown body with a large, tan head that laces the glass pretty well. Strong, fruity and sweet aroma of overripe banana, brown sugar, dark dried fruits and vague metallic hints. Strong flavour of slightly overripe banana, caramel and dark dried fruits. Light sweet and light bitter taste. Medium to light body, dry texture, quite lively carbonation. A solid dunkelweizen.
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 2 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Dark and cloudy with a nice big head. Aromas of banana and roasted malts. Flavor is light bodied with loads of effervescent carbonation. Some chocolate, dark fruits and coffee with a big banana flavor. Nicely balanced but not too much flavor compared to other weissbiers in this category.
500ml bottle from Vanuxeem. Pours hazy chestnut brown with thin white head. Aroma of currants and dark fruits. Taste is smooth caramel malts, brown bread and a subtle sweetness. Very drinkable.
Not as total classic as its brother, but still one reliable and tasty choice no matter when or where you drink it!

500ml bottle served in a lager glass. Two finger creamy tan head. Medium brown body with high carbonation. Aroma is malt dominated, some light yeast and pear. On the tongue its a little fruity. Banana and apricot. Not terrible, neither interesting.

Bottle. Big head, brown, hazy body.
Aroma: Bananas, bread, clove, spicy, some sulfur.
Taste: Medium sweet. Flavor of bread, caramel, grain with wheaty harshness. Nice drinkability. Pretty good beer.

Had a couple of these in Augsburg after our car broke down, it helped. Cloudy brown orange with a good-sized diminishing white head, dark banana bread in the aroma, dry ending, starts and ends lightly sweet, medium bodied with a touch of sharp carbonation.

Botella 0.5L. Cerveza oscura con buena espuma que no se hace pesada. Aromas dulzones y afrutados que se traducen en el sabor con un liquido algo denso pero que no empalaga. Pasa muy bien. El final dejando sabores algo dulces, a chocolate quizás. Muy buena cerveza.
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 Very rich dunkelweizen that does what it should, and it does so quite well.
Dark amber colour with big creamy head. Aroma of bananas, malts, bread. Sour taste with bananas and phenols.

Bottle 0,50L. Hazy, dark amber colour with huge, creamy, light brown head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malts and banana. Taste starts slightly sour with plenty of banana mouthfeel. Finish is moderate bitter followed by dried plum and figs note, also some chocolate. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Really good German brew.
Mørk brun farge med et hvit skum. Aroma av røstet malt, hvete, karamell og banan. Smaken følger aroma, fin fylde og smaken sitter i en kort stund.
Murky Brown, creamy offwhite head. Aroma is malty, some banana, hints of butter. Malty, caramely flavour. Soft mouthfeel. Nice but not that interesting.

Looks arent everything but something about the finishing turned my stomach! I couldnt handle whatever that taste was! I had to dilute it with 2 Dos XX Amber Suds just to finish it! Ill not taste this one again!
This may be my favorite beer its getting harder to find cause of the many crappy micro-brews!
Bottle. Cloudy mahogany liquid with big tan head. Aroma of banana peel. Slightly roasted. Medium body, light to medium carbonation. Light sweetness and bitterness. Very good.
50 cl bottle. Light brown. Creamy off-white head. Clear smell of yeast, some malt. Slightly watery.

Review following the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 15B). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 17.03.2013 20:11. AROMA: clove, slight sweet vanilla, dried grapes, raw yeast, wheat and caramel malts. no hop aromas. no diacetyl or DMS. APPEARANCE: dark copper color with a slight off-white medium-thin and moussy head. average retention. TASTE: slight sweet caramelly taste with wheat and clove. esters and phenols almost absent. very low bitterness and finishes somewhat sweet. a little dull. PALATE: medium-light body with average carbonation. OVERALL: a below average bulk dunkelweizen, a little dull across the board.

Dark brown, strong white head. Yeastiness with roasted malt and wheat on the nose. Sour-sweet wheat notes with a nice roasted sour-ish finish. Some banana notes - if my mind is not playing tricks on me. Okay.

Old rating rerated 31.07.2014, tap @ (Franziskaner), Hamburg:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet grainy, wheat, dried dark fruits, yeast, burnt caramel, banana, broth, hay, grass. Taste is slightly sweet, wheat, yeast, burnt caramel, toast, dough, dried dark fruits, hay, banana. Little bitterness, slightly "watery" mouthfeel. Nice.

Popular Dunkelweizen in the Franziskaner series, which was taken over from the abbey by Spaten already in 1860. Thick, firm, rocky, yellow beige head, deep caramel brown colour with rusty hue, hazy. Soft malty aroma of caramel candy, sourish wheat, flowery hops, orange peel, banana, cinnamon and cloves. Lightly sweet taste, very caramel-like, quickly becoming more sourish, citrus touch, smooth graininess in the finish, chocolatey maltiness, sourishness keeps accompanying the palate and makes for a refreshing ending.
Pours dark and hazy with tan head. Cleaner nose than the light version. Less complex nose than the light version. Lighter mouthfeel and cleaner taste, lighter banana flavours than other version.

Bottle. Hazy brown body. Frothy, off-white head, lasting. Aroma of toasted bread, caramel with notes of banana and clove. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Overly sweet, but the sweetness is tempered by acidic tartness in the finish. Taste of caramel and bread with some hints of English ESB characteristics. Or maybe that was my imagination. Sweet and not overly refined, and I should not have enjoyed it as much as I did. But I did.

de color ámbar oscuro, tiene cierta turbidez. Media intensidad aromática, con recuerdos a caramelo, cereales solubles y plátano algo sobre madurado.
En boca bastante fresca, algo picante, amargo comedido que recuerda al cereal tostado.

Cloudy brown color, big staying brownish head. Some lacing. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of banana, wheat, hazelnut cream. Silky mouthfeel. Medium sweet taste, no bitterness. Sweet banana finish. Excellent dunkelweizen!

Pours a brown brew with a big white head with regular retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet with banana, clove and caramel, medium to light bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with asweet finish and a short aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a nice white head. Nose is some ester and banana along with yeast. Taste is some dark fruit with some dryness.

Drunk from 0.5 litre bottle at Kirchenwirt, Mayr in Franking. Dark tasty wheat beer.




---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Eroski, Pollenca; I was on holiday so Im buggered if I can remember the detail, however I do recall that it was as tight and well defined as the standard Franziskaner hefe, but with a sort of dark fruit (cherry / strawberry) twist; needless to say it totally hit the spot.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Hazy brown colored brew with an soft bitter taste and hints of caramel and banana.

Bottle. Pours mostly clear mahogany brown with creamy beige head. Aroma is bready and cookie malts, light toast, light fig, woody notes, and light nuts. Flavor is chewy malt base with some nuttiness, some dark fruit notes, light woodiness, and some sweetness; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

From a bottle. Pours a tawny medium.brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like dried fruits, sweet malt, corn, dough, and dry soda. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet malt, yeast, caramel, and raisins.

50cl bottle. Bottled 23.06.14. Pours light brown, almost like pale cloudy cola. Aroma is classic weiss with grain, banana, yeast and maybe some light dough acidity. Some roasted note emerges in the mouth but not very strong.

Bottle from hotel castello, malcesine, Italy. Cloudy brown ale with a resilient off white head. Banana and some toffee and tea. Taste is mild and sweet. Not much bitterness. Carbonation is low and body is medium. Not bad.
It has a broad range of aromas and sweet flavors with just a hint of sour finish. Great to look at and a surprisingly light body. Very enjoyable.
Tap beer at Waldhotel Im Insenthal, Germany. Hazy dark brown. Taste like ordinary weissbeer, but with slightly more roasted malts.

Bottle at hotel in Germany. Pors cloudy light brown with a lasting white creamy head. Malt, cloves, banana, roasted coffee and fruitiness in the aroma. Medium bodied sweet and dry taste. Lighly roasted chocolate and coffe, biscuits, caramel, sour red fruits, banana and hints of cloves.
Der Antrunk ist malzig/hefig. Der Abgang dann malzig/fruchtig (leichtes Bananenaroma). Fazit: Schönes Dunkeles Weizen. Kann man gut trinken!
aspecto muito apelativo... sente-se de imediato o toque a caramelo....começa bem mas acaba por faltar alguma magia no final... a boca fica com sabor a pouco

Bottle i danish bar. 
Cloudy dark brown. Frothy white head. Malty aroma with some caramell. Sweet malty taste with some bananas and mango. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

DWGIS (drunk with girlfriend in Szczecin); Pours hazy brown with a off-white to tan, lasting, leaving lacing head. Nose is roasted malt, yeast, spice, sweet fruit and light sour berries. Taste is moderate sweet, light bitter, light spicy and moderate lasting. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Pours a brown color with off-white head. Bananas, cloves, and darker fruits on the nose with a little caramel malt; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a nice wheat note.

Its body has a brownish or ice tea color with a cloudy appearance. On top sits a big creamy tan head that has good retention, lasting until the finish after slowly fading to a small cap of foam. Its lacing was slick and slid down the glass as I drank. The aroma hits you with a big overripe banana followed by some other fruity and earthy yeast notes with a touch of clove. The flavor starts with a lightly roasted wheat malt base with some fruity banana clove notes coming in. The wheat and yeast flavor gets dryer and brings dusty earthy notes. Hop flavor and bitterness is light and most noticeable in the finish. The finish is very dry with a smooth, thick, almost powdery texture. Carbonation feels about average and the body is a good solid medium.
Hellbräunliche Farbe. Banane, etwas Röstmalz in der Nase, etwas zurückhaltend. Am Gaumen Malz, Süße, Gewürze. Sehr süffig, etwas wässriger als sein helles Pendant.
Aroma of dark malts. Taste is malty, yeasty, lots of roasted malts. Alcohol is not very noticeable.
Bottle. Cloudy, brown, frothy, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, & long finish.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 Hazy deep brown pour with a l,arge white head. Smells of banana and vanilla with a bit of a malty sweetness. Slightly tart banana bread flavor with caramel and cloves. Great beer.
Bottle 0.5l at Caio, Oulu. Originally rated 2011. Colour is brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, wheat, sweetness and malts.

500ml bottle bought at TASTE in Olympian City, Tai Kok Tsui.
Looks: Translucent deep brown colour with lots of trunky yeast sediments; Explosive three finger head with crumpety off-white foam which lasted for 2 minutes; Moderate sticky lacing and slight carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment roasty light malt, with banana, vanilla, brown sugar, caramel, wheaty tartness, chocolate, strong yeast, cloves, spices, and very light grass.

Taste: Light sweet roasted malt, with very light tart notes, light banana, strong caramel, toffee, light caramel, burnt toffee, toast, light phenolic, strong yeast, cloves, spices, faint lemon, fairly low bitter hops and very light grass.

Body: Mid to light. Quite slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Good malt with strong roastyness, not much nuttiness but with really tasty caramel and toasty, burnt toffee characters. Yeah! Adequate wheatyness with barely detectable tart notes. Good dose of yeast with right amount of banana, cloves and spices. Right on!

Hoppiness: Very light grassy nose, faint lemon and grassy taste. Bitterness is very low-fi in background for an abrupt detectable lowly semi-finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Very easy and caramel-ish to mouth.

Comments: Finally got to taste this one and it lives up to the good ratings - impressive head, very fragrant roasty and yeasty aroma, and tasty caramel and toasty palate. Its solid all round with a little more to tease. Hows that? It may not be absolutely top, but its in that direction. Highly recommended!

Dark honey color, medium thick off-white head. Banana nose. Banana and roasted malt aroma. Touch of wheat, yeast and caramel. Medium sweet. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
(0,5l bottle)
Ez a bajor power. Telt gyümölcsös nyitánnyal berobban a szánkba, majd pörkölt ízzel landol a gyomrunkba zabszemnyi karamelles utóízt hagyva maga után. Elég karakteres, és megfizethető áru söröcske.
UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 Typical Dunkelweizen aroma, with some malts, banana and cloves. Shy taste, with some sugary cereal and banana notes.

Transferred from BA reviewed on 3-10-12 - 
Poured from bottle into pint glass

Appearance Pours a hazy lighter brown color with a large billowy off-white, bordering tan, head. The head is nice and thick in nature and fades over time to give a persistent film on the brew and leaving some spotty lacing on the sides of the glass.

Smell  Yeast aromas are the most prevalent with hints of darker fruit mixed in. There is some bready aroma in there as well with a little bit of spiciness.

Taste  Sweeter malt flavors with a bit of yeasty flavor are upfront. The sweetness gives way a bit of dryer roasted flavors. While losing some hold in the middle of the taste, the sweet flavor does persist and at the end seems to gain ground again with some caramel flavors which mix with a bit of nuttiness.

Mouthfeel- Rather thin with a slightly above average carbonation level. The body is a bit lighter than expected and threw me off at first. It is really too thin and carbonated for the more roasty flavor of the beer. The mouthfeel of this one is a little off in my opinion.

Overall - A good, look and smell and a pretty nice flavor profile, but the mouthfeel definitely leaves something to be desired. Not bad, but not great either.

Brown towards red, cloudy. White foam that dosnt last that long, but I am not drinking the beer out of weissbier glass though. Hint of banana mixed with orange and metal in the aroma. Icelandic hvítöl. Mild taste Malt, hint of banana, orange and mild thick bitterness in the aftertaste. Not much taste in comparison to other weissbier´s. High in carbon.

500 ml bottle. Hazy dark brown with a huge, long lasting, creamy, off-white head. Sweet aroma of bananas, malt and yeast. Sweet malt flavour with notes of banana, yeast and just a hint of wheat and caramel.

500 ml bottle served in a goblet glass. Dark sunrise orange, pretty hazy, with a nice, creamy and persistent white head. On the nose fruity esters, unripe bananas, yeast, light alchool presence, some spices and maybe just a hint of darker fruits. Light astringency and acidic edge upfront, solid malty base, spicy and moderately fruity. Big yeast influence, as expected. Not particulary easy to drink, it feels heavier compared to the actual ABV. Slightly watery as well. Average carbonation, light to medium body, slightly creamy texture. Not impressed honestly.

Pours a murky brown with nice head. Aroma is toffee, toast, banana, red fruits and some noble hops. slick and fruity mouth feel with low carbonation. Aftertaste is very fruity. Lasting fresh toffee. Overall: very good.

Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel is a great speciman of a classic German beer style. Aroma is moderate with notes of yeast. Pour is a murky dark brown with an decent head. Taste is hearty with yeast notes or bananas and cloves with a smooth finish. If you closed your eyes, you wouldnt know it was a dark beer. You cant go wrong with this Franziskaner.
Murky dark brown, big fluffy head. Aroma of cloves, slightly roasty wheat and some bananas. Nice wheat finish, light roast wheat, bready malts some yeast and cloves. Nice.

Bottle to hefe glass. Aroma is bananas, clove, breadiness, some malt. Appearance is super cloudy with a big beige head. Taste is more banana, some fruit, some bread, and some malt sweetness. Finishes nice on the tongue. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy brown color with minimal tan head. Aroma is banana, yeast, malt, roasty. Medium hody. Soft carbonation.

Begins with a soft, sweet aroma with a generous beige head. Dark brown color and hazy, Body is round and almost thick. Has strong flavors of banana and cloves, also feels flavored with bread and caramel, very malty and slightly bitter. Aftertaste is long, sweet and malty.
Very interesting Hefe-Weissbier with toffee notes. Very lively beer.............

Bottle. Hazy amber brown. Banana, clove on the nose, nice white foam. Medium body, lively carbonation. Light roastiness supplemented with wheat, yeast, dry dates, raisins. A very tasty dunkel weissbier.

Poured from bottle a hazy orange-brown with a very durable and creamy tan head which leaves a moderate amount of lacing.

Aroma: yeasty banana and more subtle clove and light malt.

Taste: la well-integrated mix of flavors. Not bold but highly drinkable and easily recommended as a dining beverage. 

M: smooth but a tad too thin and watery. 

O: an exceptionally good-looking beer with fine flavor but a mediocre mouthfeel. 

(from Aug. 2012 notes)

(Bottle) Hazy amber brown with big dense off-white head. Pleasant aroma mainly of banana esters. Medium bodied with smooth carbonation. Taste starts with refreshing fruity notes of under-ripe banana and maybe a little citrus, then develops some nicely balancing caramel sweetness, and on to some cleansing subtle bitterness in the finish. A nice balanced beer.

50cl bottle from SPAR, Puerto de Mogan Gran Canaria. Deep murky brown appearance with a lovely foamy head. Beautiful banana yeast weisse aroma. Yum yum, Tasty! Nice combination of chocolate raisins, brown sugar on apple pie with cinnamon. Lovely !
Colorc caoba oscuro, espuma color crema densa. Aromas dulces de frutos rojos. En boca es dulce y afrutada aunque algo metálica en el regusto. No está mal, le falta intensidad.
Dark pour with a nice head, yeasty banana aroma. Taste is malty, banana bread and some yeast esters. Nice
Bought at bier shop in Bernburg (Saale).Everything from Franziskaner is great.Also this chocolate and weissbier taste.Perfect!

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, bottled on 12/10/2012. Pours very hazy reddish brown color with a 1-2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of caramel, toast, toffee, brown bread, brown sugar, light roast, banana, pear, apple, pepper, clove, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark malt and fruity/spicy yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of caramel, toast, toffee, brown bread, brown sugar, light roast, banana, pear, apple, light clove, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toast, toffee, brown bread, brown sugar, pear, apple, banana, light clove, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and moderate fruity yeast ester flavors; with good robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth, moderately creamy, and lightly bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very good dunkelweizen style. Good balance and robustness of dark malt and fruity yeast flavors; and very smooth to drink. A nicely enjoyable offering.
Pours brown. Aroma is bananas and sweet malts. Taste is banana and some caramel.
From the tap came a cloudy brown brew with a nice head. Aromas and flavors of bubble gum and hops. Nice mouth feel and tasty.

Bottle from Jumbo. Hazy chestnut body with an off-white head. Very lively carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of marzipan, nuts, orange and spices. Flavour of red apple, nuts, and a hint of cinnamon (the missus said this "tastes of Christmas", which I think is a pretty good description). Medium body with a frothy, spongy mouthfeel. Fizzy carbonation. Very tasty.
Amber cloudy color with creamy head, aroma and taste are yeasty, sweet and light sour for wheat use...
Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color marron. Sabor a trigo, malta, con un muy ligerisimo regusto a caramelo.
Bue en bouteille de 50Cl. Belle couleur marron, peu de mousse. Notes de caramel, de grillé. Très douce au palais, très agréable à boire.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with tan head. Wgeat, caramel, malt, slightly roasted aroma. Wheat, sweet, malt and slightly roasted taste. Some banana, fruitness. Medium body.
500 ml bottle. Dark orange, cloudy color with a huge beige head. Aromas of banana and some roasted. Same taste. Sweet and floral aftertaste, sticky mouthfeel. Medium body with high carbonation.
Liian laimeaa pullaa. Varsinkin tuon vahvan juhlapullon jälkeen. Hyvä olut ykskantaan yksikseen.
Draft. Pours hazy brown, tan head, good retention/lace. Aroma of banana, clove, light roast, wheat. Taste is sweet, banana, clove, wheat. Palate is soft, a bit watery, refreshing finish.
Roodbruine kleur met een aardige kraag. Ruikt mout, kruiden, iets bitter. Smaakt als een weizen met typische mout.
Iets minder dan de gewone Hefe. Donker rode kleur. Smaak is iets zoeter met caramel invloed.
Unusual pork gravy flavor with a hint of potatoes. Has a murky brown color and fizzy palate. An unusual beer that I enjoyed drinking.

Bottle 50 cl.
Foggy brown with large creamy off-white head. Aroma of yeast, some malt with a touch of caramel. A bit on the fizzy side.
Cor avermelhada turva, com espuma de boa formação. Sabores e aromas de tostado, fermento, pão e especiarias.
Has a sweet aroma of caramel and flowers. Pours cloudy brown with a thick white head. The flavor is fresh and sweet of caramel with a slight finish of hops.

Piwo prawilne i w ramach stylu, no ale to wiadomo. Mętne, błotnisto-brązowe. Piana taka sobie, znika błyskawicznie. Smak i aromat wzorcowe, są banany, jest kwaskowość, ale mało to intensywne. Taka stylowa średniawa.

Appearance: Pours dark brown with a creamy head that dissipates rather quickly.

Smell: A mix of the usual banana and some sweet almost caramel like tones. 

Taste: Banana with some wheaty tones.

Mouthfeel: Slight over carbonation, but it eases with time in glass.

Overall: Not a bad beer. I do prefer the regular hefe over this though.

Serving type: bottle into Weizen glass.
Ciemno-bordowe piwo o wyraźnym aromacie banana i goździka. W smaku słodowe, dosyć lekkie, orzeźwiające, delikatnie kwaskowe.

Cloudy dark ruby red. Aroma of dark fruit (cherries mostly) & bananas. Sips light and frothy with sweet. Light and Spritzy like palate with sour raspberries like middle and very dry finish. Very fruity for a dark weizen. I would prob guess this is sour, it has that much red fruit.
Murky brown color. European pour only produces a heavy head. Taste is on the lighter side of a dunkel. Decent beer.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes braunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, röstmalzig, leicht fruchtig würzig. Geschmack hefig, leicht würzig, leicht fruchtig.
Very soft and smooth dunkelweizen. Has a nice fruity taste of banaan and mango. I like it.
Cloudy brown with good head retention. Low fruity and banana flavor and aroma, some cloves in there, sweet, maltiness. Hops are low but in equilibrium. A very refreshing dunkelweizen.
50cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a moderate white head. Wheaty, yeasty, sweet aroma. Flavor is wheaty, light alchool and yeast.

Tap at the brewery tap in Munchen. 23/1/14. Clouded brown burnt orange coloured pour with a stadfast off white head. Aroma is light caramel and mineral with some nuttiness. Flavour is full caramel, sweet and smooth, caramel and honey malt. Palate is medium full with nice spritzy carb and lifts things of the tongue. Very sessionable and drinkable dunkel. I could pound this happily.
Tastes like banana bread! Fairly mind aroma. Murky appearance. Malty on the palate. Enjoyable.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2014 Bottle, 500 ml at Wir Zwei, Berlin. Pours hazy brown. Malty taste and aroma. Some fruit.
Hazy brown with big, long lasting off-white head. Yeast, banana, brown bread, light tropical fruits and a slightly roasted touch. Medium bodied, average cabonation and slightly watery feel.

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Weizen de Hoepfner. Color ámbar oscuro y apariencia turbia. La espuma beige permanece como una capa tupida y fina. Intensos aromas de plátano, maltas tostadas y pan, trazos de clavo y notas florales, redondeados por caramelo subyacente. Entrada tostada. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Textura aguada. Los sabores agradables de maltas, notas de pan y toque de azúcar moreno quedan equilibrados por un leve amargor. Final afrutado. Refrescante y de trago fácil.
500ml bottle. Hoepfner Weizen glass. Deep amber color. Foggy appearance. Beige foam remains as a close & thin crown. Intense aromas of banana, toasted malt & bread, hints of clove & floral notes rounded by caramel on the back. Toasted upfront. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Watery texture. Gentle malts, bread notes & brown sugar touch balanced by low bitterness. Fruity finish. Refreshing & easy drinkable.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Very carbonated, very nice dark brown color, tan head, citrus flavoring. Wonderful texture in the mouth very refreshing

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a deep, ruby/copper colour with a foamy offwhite head and plenty of carbonation. Aroma features banana, wheat, citrus and bubblegum hints. Medium body, a touch watery but has plenty of character. Very smooth and drinkable, but with a weak finish.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with creamy, foamy head. Not much in the aroma, but beautiful balance of malt and fruit in the taste. Lovely creamy mouthfeel and lingering sweetness in aftertaste. Love it!
Довольн& крепкое, 5%, но приятно& Мутнова& т.к. нефильт& любимые тёмные не запишу.

Aroma: pear, banana clove.
App: murky brown hazy, tan head
Flavour: wheat, malty and pear.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lovely bread and malt aroma. Very smooth and mellow sweetness. Very nice. I'd drink this multiple times.
En. 50cl, belle robe brillante, peu de mousse, cette dunkel n as pas énormément d arôme comparé av son homologue blanche, mais elle reste tout de même très bonne, et se laisse boire très facilement
Bottle. Not a _huge_ fan of wheat beers but this is different. Lightly sour taste, dark cloudy appearance, floral caramel aroma. Nice head with decent retention. Currently my favorite weizen.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 0.5 bottle.  Pours cloudy brown with a thick beige head.. You can feel little wheat in taste which is nice. Aroma is wheat, banana, dark fruit. Very nice foam. Average carbonation. Good beer :)

cloudy brown, cream head rocky
Banana, malts, a hint of winey and caramel, orange peel, yeasts
Sweet, slight sourness, banana aftertaste
Caramel, carbonation, orange, yeasts
I like dark beers, and I have purchased this in our local shop... it was a good beer for a night, great taste
Hazy dark red brown color, big white head. Aroma of banana, wheat and caramel. Dry taste of wheat, banana, citrus, caramel and note of chocolate. Light body and average carbonation. Refreshing.
Bottle. Deep red-brown with short-lived sea-foam head. Aromas of roasted malt, root veggies. Perhaps a touch overcarbonated and acidic. I got toffee, sour plum and spice over an earthy malt backbone.

Draught at Bavarian Bier Café, Broadbeach on 29/11/13. Poured a translucent mid-brown colour with a one-finger off white foamy head that diminished quickly and laced poorly with a few spots. Moderate to high carbonation with lots of small to medium sized bubbles forming trails. Aroma of spices, cloves and fruit (?peach). Taste almost immediately with each sip the cloves dominated from the first to last sip. Light body. Smooth, light, sweet with along clove dominated finish. Once you get used to it its a nice beer.
Nice dunkel weizenbier may be a bit too acidic. Nice brown color whith not that big white head.

Slight aromas of Hefe-Weissbier and faint hints of caramel. Cloudy brown, head dissapears almost immediately. Taste fruits, wheat and caramel, also some sourness and watery taste in the background. Medium carbonation. Overall: a little bit dissapointing considering how great regular Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier is.
Bottle, kindly shared by Dohny, many thanks. Hazy dark brown beer with medium light beige head. Aroma of wheat, caramel, banana esters, yeast. Taste, wheat, caramel, banana, yeast. Not bad.

500 ml bottle poured into a Weihenstephaner glass. Pours a hazy dark brown with a big, velvety head of beige foam. Thick sheets of lacing. There are also some clumps of yeast sitting on the bottom of the glass. The aroma is yeasty with some nutmeg and banana coming through. I get a lot of sweetness in the taste. Notes of bubblegum. Some spice. A little chewing brings out some caramel notes. Medium to light body. Aftertaste is sweet and just a little spicy. Fairly light beer overall. I was expecting a little more body and depth.
Fin gyllen kastanjebrun farge. Duft av malt og krydder. Tykt kremet skum. Smak av malt og krydder.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2014 Bottled by Dohni, many thanks! Roasted malt and weizen malt aroma plus some caramel and bananas of course. A bit too much carbonation for me but nothing extreme. Overall very tasty!

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a cloudy brown with a tan head. Taste sweet malt, banana, Carmel. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy, very dark Orange-brown with a Tall, Fine Head. Nice aroma of roasted malt, banana and some herbal notes. Well-balanced, but slightly flat Taste.

Bottiglia 50cl comprata al supermarket e bevuta a casa.
Color ruggine con schiuma piuttosto evanescente, torbida.
Domina la banana matura, sfumature maltate, corpo medio, finale amaro.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2013 Bottle. Pour is a deep brown mahogany, with a thin lacy off white head. Smell is awesome, you get the spicy yeast and citrus including orange, mango, and pineapple along with a whiff if caramel dark malt and brown sugar. Taste is yeasty, spicy with citrus and sweet with caramel malt. Smooth aftertaste which leaves behind some citrus and yeast. Mouthfeel is the perfect combination of effervescence and smoothness. Needless to say Im a big fan. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaske på altanen i Elviria: et utmerket inspirasjonsmiddel når postkortene skal skrives i formiddagssolen, siste dagen. Litt syrligere enn den lyse fra samme bryggeri, men like rund og konsumeringsverdig. Livet som klimaflyktning er riktig så behagelig i en sådan stund.

Bottle from Spar, Puerto Mogan, Gran Canaria. Cloudy brown beer with small head. Aroma of cloves, banana and wheat. Taste is mild spice, banana skins and yeast. Medium carbonation and light bodied. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: caramel, roasty, cheese, dough, bread, smoke, woody, brown, clear until last cup was mixed with trub,, white foam, medium sweetness, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, truly a different beer when mixed up with trub,, in a very good way,,
Bottle. Pours caramel with an off white head. Aroma is malty, banana, herbal and some yeast. Taste is medium sweet. Medium body with average carbonation.

Bu en bouteille de 50cl. Une belle bière entre lambrée et le brun, une jolie mousse qui tombe vite. Cette bière est bizarre, mais très intéressante, on a un début de bouche complètement banane, cest super intéressant derrière on ressent la note du malt ça commence sur la grillé et ça se termine sur le caramel.
Bottle. Cloudy brown appearance with a good head. Aroma is light clove, banana, caramel. Taste is a roasted grain, spicy clove, banana, malty.

Served in a tulip glass.

Poured a nice cloudy brown/amber with about 2 fingers of tan head, dropping off to some thick lacing around the glass. On the nose, hints of malt, wheat, sweetness and a little funk. Was surprised at the lack of hints on the first smell. In the taste, wheat, banana (light), bread and and some spice.

Overall, not a bad tasting of its type. As I learn more about Dunkels, I may think differently down the road. Not the greatest but certainly no drain-pour.

Cheers!
Bottle in Berlin. Pouts light brown with quite a large head. Taste is banana and some yeast.
Banana clove juice with some dark caramel notes to it, I bit over carbonated for me but an easy drinker none the less
Generous beige head, turbid amber colour, aroma of bread, yeast and nut. Faded bodiless taste, non-persistent bitter aftertaste.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. It pours a cloudy dark brown color with a lasting white head. The nose has a bit of clove, bready notes, and a little fruitiness. Subdued banana and clove intermingle with yeast and wheat notes. Everything is in balance. Light to medium body with a nice, crisp, wheaty finish. Nice beer.

Half-litre bottle, slightly out of date when poured into a Franziskaner Weissbier glass at home on 20 Oct 2013.

Huge head on top of the dark brown body with ruby hints: looked lovely.

The nose is a mixture of yeast, vanilla and banana esters: the taste follows closely but with a malt presence that didnt appear in the aroma.

Lively and flavoursome, very pleasant and one of the best Dunkelweizen Ive had so far.

Its aroma is earthly with a mixture of caramel and dough. The head is light brown and is full bodied. The color is a light brown with some clouding. It has a pleasant taste reminiscent of cheese, caramel, and a sweet flavor. It is decent on the way down that is appealing to the palate.

Mild aroma, with mild malt tones. Appearance is medium dark, with a nice head. Taste is very mild, average hoppiness, and very mild caramelized malt taste. Overall, a fairly pleasant beer, but the light body and light taste are not inspiring.
La birra si presenta di un colore rosso scuro con una buona schiuma densa che la protegge dalossidazione. Ottimo aroma e buona impressione al palato. Complessivamente una buona birra

die beste ! Aroma- stupendous
Appearance - wonderful
Taste - marvelous
Palate - divine
Overall - If I could get a room with this beer.......we are gonna have a gooood time !

Appearance: pours a hazy brown color, has a large beige head

Aroma: yeast, lemon, bread, subtle

Taste: very smooth, malt caramel with a yeast backbone, lemon, bread

Palate: lots of froth, high carbonation, n aftertaste, leaves mouth wet

Overall: pleasantly surprised with this beer, highly drinkable, kind of an amber and hefe mixed

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy brown, tall creamy head. Aroma of yeast, spice, roast. Light body, fruity finish. The taste of is not intensive at all. Kind of a light Dunkelweizen. Crafty but not my choice of that style.

Appearance- Cloudy dark red brown with large white/tan head, lacing that stuck 

Aroma- Hoppy smell with spices and a nice sweet smell

T/P- Light Hop taste slight fruity after taste and a good wheat taste all the way through

Overall- Nice beer very smooth and very drinkable. Would defiantly buy again. Nice for a hefe-weisse that it is dark.
Hazy brown, medium carbonation. Aroma of dark fruit, malt and hops. Also some caramel. Bitter sweet finish.

500ml bottle from duty-free shop on Kaliningrad, Russia - Poland border, hazy brown colour, small white head. Very fruity aroma with banana, plum and notes of herbal hops and some roastiness. Medium body, short bittersweet finish, medium carbonation. A bit of an industrial and generic feel but quite tasty very drinkable.
Bottle. Pours a deep, murky brown with fluffy off-white head and some lace. Nose of caramel, roasted malt, light banana. Medium body. Sweet and malty with subtle banana.
Pours a dark caramel like coulour. Foam does not stay for long. A light aftertaste with hints of malt, raosted, banana. One of the best of its kind.
September 2010. Red brown with an offwhite head. Aromas of roasted malt, bread, banana, clove. Caramel flavors with spice and yeast showing through. Not too big a fan of this one.
Брал вместе с вайсом этой же фирмы. Ничего особого сказать не могу, обычный д-вайс.

Hazy dark brown with a creamy, beige, fading but somewhat lasting, lacy head. Smells of banana/wheat, light roast, malt, caramel and spices like cinnamon. Butter? Medium to full body with soft carbonation. Tastes of wheat and banana, dark malt, caramel with nice bitter spice  pepper, clove finish. Smooth and easy to drink.
(bottle) hazy orange brown colour with a tall tan head; aromas of grain, dried fruit, cloves; somewhat creamy palate; balanced flavour; nice

Classic. Had this one many times, but havent rated it yet. I dont have the proper glassware in Belgium (all the weissbier glasses are in storage...) but still a great pour with a head that lasts. Reddish-brown. Honestly this tastes a bit more marzen-like than I remember, but has a good frothy/chewy quality that brings it back to weiss. I definitely prefer the non-dunkel (or truly "weiss") version, but you cant go wrong with Franziskaner.

brown, cloudy, tan foam, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, lively, average carbonation. This was so much better than I expected. Admittedly, this was my first German Dunkel, so that may be why it exceeded my expectations. Nice appearance- dark brown and hazy. Seems to have very little aroma; but I dont have a high sensitivity to mild aromas. Has a creamy, lively mouth feel. Virtually no bitterness ( which is what I look for in the Weissbier categories), so it is very easy to drink. Thumbs up on Franziskaner Dunkel!

.5l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours hazy dark amber with low head. Aroma is banana, malts, yeast. Flavor is dark malts, dried fruits, banana.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy and deep amber colour with a beige and coffee-like, medium head. The aroma is sweet and fruity with banana, dried fruit, chocolate and some berries. Light and fresh flavour with the addition of pear and some caramel. Slick mouth feel, and has a light bitterness. Balanced and not too sweet, and fresh at the same time.
9/11/12. Now this is what Im talking about! Slightly chocolate, bananas, bubble gum. Medium low phenols. full of chocolate and carbonation
palate is 3.5 which gives an overall score of 13.5.   caramel.banana,chocolate,bubblegum and spices.  very good,very refreshing.thank you bavarian purity law of 1516!
mmm... Very nice, perfect mouth feel, not much of a smell. Taste wise, lots of lemony which is a big surprise.

A nice, somewhat ambercolored cloudy beer, but with a firm slightly brown foamy top head. It has an aroma of caramel of fudge, but it smells like weizen as well. It tastes somewhat spicy, and somewhat sweet, but the flavors combine perfectly! Dry palate and a sweet aftertaste.

Een mooi, enigszins amberkleurig troebel bier, met een stevige lichtbruine kraag. Het aroma doet in de verte denken aan caramel of toffee, maar heeft ook nog de geur van tarwebier. De smaak is licht kruidig, ietwat zoetigs, maar het vult elkaar leuk aan. Droge afdronk en een lichtzoete nasmaak blijven hangen.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 0,5L bottle. Hazy copper-ruby color. Very high beige head. Very light aroma of caramelized malt, burnt sugar and hops. Sweet, nice taste of caramelized malt. Not very rich, but very tasty with some yeasty finish. Very pleasant and drinkable.

Una buona dunkelweiss, non la migliore ma sicuramente degna di nota e di qualità!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark amber color (color of the bottle) and medium foam.
Fruity aroma with toasted malt.
Sweet, fruity and malty.
An excellent weiss dunkel with Franziskaners quality.

Excellent dark malty. One of the best Dunkel beers I have ever had. Smooth thick mellow 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Pours a hazy brown with a huge, creamy, tan head that dissipates quickly into nothing. Small amount of yeast sediment is noticeable on the bottom of the glass. The nose brings out caramel, cinnamon, banana, biscuits, and clove. taste is more mild, but the sweet and bready yeastiness work well together. The body is a little on the lighter side for a dunker, but I wouldnt say watery. Good, and definitely worth a try, but a bit of a disappointment seeing as the hefer is one of the best Ive had.

This is about as good as a heffe-weisse dunkel gets. Fizzy yellow beer drinkers filter their perceptions through just that. Carmelized malts are here made subordinate to a fruity taste (plum and cherry) with a light hop. If you like this style, this top-fermented weisse beer will taste terrific. If it isnt your style, stay with your fizzy yellow beer or rate this according to its style, not on how it measures up to your personal preference.
Cloudy brown appearance, low but lasting head. Malty caramel aroma. Slight disappointment on the palate compared to Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier, but overall good Dunkelweizen style.
Boa carbonatacao. Amargor leve com retrogosto suave. O trigo torrado marca e torna o exemplar uma cerveja escura de ótima qualidade.

Caramel burnt like color..huge 4 finger head into wheat glass..nose of banana..mainly banana and also yes..rum raisin like qualities Haagen daaz..interesting combination..palate leaves a mineral like taste with traces of cinnamon.other spices..traces of plum..light bodied..glad to try but not a fan of this style so much..
On draft at Flood City Festival. Poured dark brown with fluffy khaki head. Estery nose. Flavor is of caramel malt with banana and cloves. Decent. Watery.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 Bottle. Aroma is sweetish fruity, plums, berries, lightly rotten. Light caramel. Lightly hazy copper-ruby colour. Taste is mostly caramel fruity sweetness, somewhat sugary. Light plain bitterness. Balanced finish, moderate duration. 5 4 4 2 10Rerate. Bottled by Dohny, many thanks! Aroma is bananz v cokolade old school candy. Amber-brown colour. Taste is nicely balanced caramel malty (upper hand) with background bitterness. Easily drinkable, good one. Light hops flavour discernible.

Filling out the style card. Seems like there is about 1 cm difference between many of these German Beers. Pours a murky light brown with off-white head. Scent is spicy, malty, and sour. Reminds me of a slightly more tart Hefe. Bubbly. Bottle - Toco Giant - Decatur, GA
Hazy brown with an off-white head. Aroma is malts, yeast. Taste is a bit roasy/caramel with malts, bit watery. Ok beer but I prefer the normal Franziskaner.
On tap. Pours a murky dark brown color with a foamy light tan head. Aroma of a typical hefe. Slight roasted malt, banana, and clove. The taste follows the nose exactly.

Murky brown with a frothy head that dissipates reasonably quickly. Wheat beer yeasts, a huge banana hit and a hint of mango. The roasted malts come to the fore at the front of the beer, leading into a sweetish banana and mango giving, however it remains refreshing and light with orange peel end notes. A luscious mouth feel and good with pork knuckle and belly

I didnt like this beer, especially right after tasting their delicious standard hefe. 
Caramel brown. A bit hazy. Think head that sticks around. Nose smelled a bitllike caramel, cough syrup, and black licorice. Taste is caramel, butterscotch and finishes weak. Feels like water in the mouth.

By far my favorite beer. Smooth. Great flavor. How real beer should taste. Best served with a slice of lemon. Perfect Carmel balanced with a good earthiness. I love this type of beer. After drinking it for a while and then drinking a standard American beer, it feels like the American beer is a beer flavored soda.

Bottle share by Jared, cloudy brown pour with white head. Aroma of tons of yeast and smokey backing, taste sweet banana and roasted malt.

Хороше пиво! Насичен& мутний коричне& колір , біла піна. В міру газован& Дріжджі дають гарний фруктов& аромат, легка гірчинк& в післясм& via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one has a cloudy brown body. The head is fairly quickly diminishing and off-white in color. Aromas of yeast, spices and some banana are present. Taste is surprisingly dry with a short bitter aftertaste. Carbonation is fairly heavy for this style. Large firm clumps of yeast are found at the bottom of the glass.
Bottle at krapi, tuusula. Hazy brown color, small white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, raisin. Balanced wheaty taste, yeast, raisin.
A solid weissbier. Nice fruit aroma. Full taste light body. Would definitely drink again.
0.5l bottle. Dark amber/light brown body, off-white head. Aroma of toast, caramel and a hint of banana. Taste of banana, caramel and lemon zest. Very nice beer.
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2013 Cloudy, amber color. Aroma: wheat and banana. Medium body, lively carbonation. Good dunkelweizen.
Een dunkel weizen dat mij tegen valt. Smaak is erg vlak. Ook qua body en afdronk weet dit bier mij niet te raken. Ik heb betere weizen gedronken.

Ambree, petit col, trouble
Aromes de cereales mais relativement faible
quelques notes fruites
bonne dunkel

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2014 Brown colour with huge head. Aroma has sweet banana and hefeweizen yeast. Flavour has ripe sweet banana, roasted malts and sweet malts. Finish is long and starts with a short bite of bitterness. High carbonation, thin mouthfeel. Comes out slightly watery at times. Good stuff, but nothing special.

From bottle. Dark amber color, clear. Aroma of banana and clove, reminiscent of a hefeweissen. Flavor of spiced apple and banana, with some dark malty notes. A little thin in the mouthfeel, but overall nice.

Bottle - pours out dark amber with moderate tan head.  Nose of cherry, booze, and syrup.  Taste of sweet cherry, caramel, and syrup.  Very smooth and would make an excellent dessert beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Cloudy amber color with a fine off white head that leaves a nice lacing.Aroma: Wheat, malty, banana and mild fruity.Palate: Medium + body. Slightly sweet and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Balanced and mild wheat, a bit to dominating malty flavor. Banana and fruity notes.Overall impression: Nice dunkel weisse.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with Grima

Bottle. Pours a cloudy reddish-brown color with a large head, medium lacing. Light caramel and malt aromas. Sweet with caramel, banana and wheat malt notes. Mouthfeel - medium body, crispy carbonation, good drinkability. Nice beer.

On tap at Harpers Pub.
Appearance: Hazy amber body with a thin white ring for a head.
Aroma: Light caramel with hints of yeast.
Taste: The taste matches the nose, very mild with caramel prominent.
Palate: Medium bodied, lively carbonation.
Overall: Bland, really a let down.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013

Bottle. Hazy brown with a large, creamy, long lasting white head. Carbonation is heavy. Aroma is mild malt, bread, sweet fruits, hints of banana. Body is thin, but not watery. Slightly bitter in the finish.

16.9oz served into a Weizen glass.

A - Pours a hazy russet brown with a hefty head of foam that is light tan in color and has proper retention.

S - Roasted wheat malt, banana, mild caramel, clove.

T - Follows the nose but clove is more pronounced. Toasted banana bread, moderate wheat, nuttiness pulls through and rounds things out very nice.

M - Moderate carbonation, medium body with slight creaminess.

A solid Dunkel. The nut flavors really pull everything together.

Serving type: bottle

05-04-2012

50cl bottle from Munich airport. Pours hazy brown with a nice, off white head. Mild malty and fruity aroma with wheat, banana, yeast, caramel and some toasty notes. Sweet and fruity with banana and light caramel flavour and a lightly dry and sourish finish. Tasty, refreshing and well balanced.

Bottle from The Beer Store, Nashua NH. Pours a cloudy reddish brown with a one finger pure white cap that lingers a long while. Aromas of bubble gum, banana, clove and brown sugar greet the nose. Flavor is similiar to the aroma. Wheaty, earthy, light clove spice and slightly sweet. Medium palate with average carbonation. Not really any finish. Nice average dunkel.

Nice brown hazy body, average gasification, huge long lasting creamy head. Aroma is mild malt, bread, banana, fruit. Mouthfeel is smooth, very easy to drink but not watery. Taste is fruity, toasted malt and wheat.

Aroma: Sour toast, slight yeast, mild citrus. Not too pleasant.
Appearance: Nice cloudy brown appearance, large creamy foam head that subsides.
Taste: Mild citrus, wheat and subtle sweet fruits. Nice mild bitter toasted nut flavour follows through.
Palate: Creamy, but a bit thin. Long pleasant toasted finish.
Overall: A nice bodied dunkelweiss, although dont like the citrus notes and flavours. Very drinkable.
50 cl bottle. Dark brown with a small white head. Low to medium carbonation. Combination of sour and bitter. Some hints of banana.
Sour and bitter taste, somewhat watery. Roasted palate with coffee nutes. Short finish. White head, only short after pouring. Dark honey colour.
Dark copper pour with foamy head. Sweet malty aroma, touch of fruit and a bit funky. Heavy banana and caramel taste with some clove. Nice crisp carbonation. Overall, a good beer.
Hveteøl dunkel god på smak fin farge og greit skum. Ikke den beste dunkel men helt grei.

Bottle. Dark brown with a thick light brown foam. Yeasty bready strong aroma.

Taste is crisp and light with roasty sweet malts and a definite yeasty note. A hint of banana in the background. Aftertaste is a bit alcoholic.

I prefer the regular Franziskaner Hefe-weissbier to this but still a nice wheat beer.
Poured about one finger head from a half liter stein. Nice banana esters with rich yeasty character. Refreshing, but nothing more complex.
Fruity esters in the aroma. Flavor contains wheat, banana and some small hints of toffee and bread. Not my favorite style of beer but decent.
On tap (0.5 l) at Mexicali, Marburg... Dark clody color, average head... Some nice smookey malt aroma... Mild taste with high sweetness... Ending is okay...
A light fruity aroma. Pours a cloudy light brown with lasting minimal head. Taste of mild lemon, banana, mild carbonation.
Medium dark cloudy brown with a big fizzy head,  Aroma of fruity esters,  Flavor well balanced between spicy toffee and banana bread.  Really nice.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2014 Pours hazy light brown with a big frothy head. Aroma is a bit weak but has notes of wheaty maltiness and some fruitiness. Taste is light sweet and also a bit roasty. Malty and yeasty flavours appear with a touch of banana. Palate is light bodied, average carbonation. Fresh, drinkable and fruity. Nice to drink but there are better dunkelweizens.
Smak och doft av vete, torkad frukt, belgisk jäst, karamell. Syrlig och lagom söt.

(Bottle): Pours a very cloudy brown with a small white head. Aroma of bananas, roasted malt, dark fruits, molasses and a sour smell I cant quite put my finger on. A sweet taste with hints of bananas, berries, caramel and again something slightly sour which I cant think of. Great drink but may be too sweet to session.

Very hazy orange-brown.
Malty aroma with the usual banana.
Taste is soft, bit malty. Has wheat and fruity flavor. Little bitter and sour in the finish.

16.9 fl oz / 500mL bottle into a pint glass. served cold.

Aroma: Malty, very very mild caramel, slight sour yeast.

Appearance: Opaque, hazy dark brown. Thin head.

Taste: Spices, a little orange or lemon, and malty bread.

Palate: Pretty smooth, no lasting finish.

Overall: Pretty nice dunkel. Nothing here that made me go "wow the whole world needs to know about how good this is", but Id drink it again.

Bottle @ home from Iper. Rispetto alla sorella bionda è solo un po più maltata  e se ci si impegna pare di percepire un che di tostato. In realtà è buona e beverina , ma rispetto ad altre dunkelweizen è un gradino sotto.

Bottle 50cl. Large off white head. Medium too thick. Hazy amber color. Aroma is yeast, banana, wheat and pineapple. Flavour is light and fresh. With a fruity image, a beef jerky touch and a hint onion in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Murky brown. Hoping this one would be pretty good because it is one of the more accessible german imports for the style that ive seen. Nice malty estery aroma. banana and bubblegum present. Beer is definitely good and true to style. A little mellow mid palate and boring but overall i was really pleased. Sticky and tasty.
Bought in bottle from lidl Spain. Very nice. Enjoyed them dark and ready will be having them again
Buena cerveza de trigo negra, sin, nada especial, pero  entra muy bien, se pueden pedir muchas sin cansarte. Puedo pedir sin problemas más de esta aunque no diga mucho cómo cerveza.
Poured a cloudy medium brown with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, banana bubblegum and a little spice. Medium to watery body, flavour of  sweet banana and maltyness. Bland.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2013 Very pleasing malty aroma and taste. This beer is dark brown and rich in flavor. A very good German easy drinking beer.
From notes. Draft. Mixed fruits, bready yeast and caramel. Pretty darn good. Ill be drinking this again.

0.5 l bottle.

Cloudy brown liquid with a medium sized beige head.

Aroma has notes of yeast, fresh bread, roses, banana, caramel.

Medium body, bittersweet taste, lively carbonation, slippery texture.
У нас есть папа! Отлично& пиво. Все, что мне нравитс& в темном пиве - вкус, аромат, цвет. Соверше& не горчит, сохраня& приятно& послевк& via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Colour is dark brown and yellowish. Rather small head, disappeared almost completely, leaving some at the sides. Medium to high carbonation. Banana flavor, some malts and wheat are present. Full texture. Nice dunkel but I still prefer regular hefe-weissbier.
Grumlig mörkbärnsten, beigeskum, smak av skumbanan och jäst. En Ok dunkelweiss.

1 Pt. 0.9 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured cloudy brown with about a finger of tan head. Predominant aroma is malts  and wheat that are mixed with some fruit notes and some caramel.  Flavor of toasted malts, wheat, sweet caramel and fruit. Easy to drink and enjoyable.

500ml bottle from lebensmittel.de webshop. Pours hazy brown with an off-white head. Aroma of fruity yeast and roasted malt. The flavour is mostly wheaty malt with some caramel and even roasted hues. Acceptable.

500 ml bottle, bought in Germany. Poured into a weizen glass. ABV 5%
Deep amber colour, with two fingers of thick and soapy off-white head. Good retention, no lacing on the glass. The body is quite hazy but you can see some activity in the glass.
Nice aroma of wheat along with some yeast notes. Along with that, some clove and bananas aromas.
Semi-sweet taste, following the aroma. Lots of wheat again upfront, followed by a taste of ripe bananas, fantastic.
Nice thick body, carbonation above average but on good levels.  Very dry on the palate, it just invites you for another sip.
Overall, a very nice hefe-weizen, I can only imagine how much better it would feel with a sunny, warm weather.

Purchased at Kaufland in Eppingen, DE; enjoyed at my hotel room in Eppingen, DE.  Appearance is a dark caramel brown with a thin white head that dissipates.  Aroma of caramel, wheat, sugar, smell is delicious.  Taste is pretty good with banana notes, a bit of chocolate.  Fantastic stuff.
Cloudy brown with beige head. Aroma of molasses cereal wheat and malt. Taste is serious wheat cereal. Delicious.

0.5 L from Super Deli Mart. Standard dunkel from a standard hyper-mega-global-corp. Dark, cloudy, wheaty, malty. Tastier than some other AB InBev offerings, However, Im against this beer on principal. Bet they werent churning out millions of hectoliters of this stuff back in 1397.

500ml bottle from a Pam supermarket in Milan. Hazy medium dark brown colour with a big beige head. Spicy wheat caramel malt aroma. Dry banana caramel flavour. Oily with sweet aftertaste. Decent dunkelweizen.

Cloudy coffee color with hints of red.  Nice white head made of fine bubbles.  Slight smell of parfume with  floral notes.  Toasty flavor with hints of butterscotch.   Mildly  carbonated with a smooth finish.

50cl bottle. Glass: Tumbler. Brown-reddish colour with medium white head. Both aroma and taste are dominated by roasted grain, with some banana notes. Medium body, soft carbonation. Seems better to me than the normal Hefeweizen, theres less sweetness presence here.

(From Notes 2010) 
Bottle poured into Pilsner Glass from Thrifty beverage, Chester, NY.

Pours a dark amber colored, almost syrupy. Little carbonation. One finger head, quickly dissipates, minor lacing.

A toasted wheat odor. Sharp but somewhat pleasant.

Malty to initial taste, strong finish, nice mouth-feel and no aftertaste. Filling, certainly not a session beer, but nevertheless decent drink-ability, better than the regular Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse in my opinion.
500 ml bottle. Aroma of dark sugar, fruits and hints of malt. Taste sweet and hints of dark fruits. Tastes a bit like plum wine.

Barva: tmavě hnědá s červeným nádechem. Pěna: středně hustá, poměrně rychle opadávající. Vůně: příjemná banánově kávová. Chuť: plné sladí sladové tělo, peničná chuť, jen mrně nahořklá s příjemným chmelovým dozvukem. Velice příjemné pivo.

50 cl bottle @ Ohranjyvä, Tampere. Rated on 11.01.2009
Aroma is sweetish with toffee, ripe bananas, some spices and hints of cardboard. Flavour is stale with bready malt, wheat, ripe bananas and hints of berries. Too stale.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown color with a moderate off-white head. Nose is actually pretty roasty and very slightly sour. Taste is just a tad sweet and very light. Just a tad odd.
A very good weissbier although a little heavy to go with a meal. A tasting beer that will not let you down.

This is one ugly beer, but boy does it taste great.  Hoegaarden wins the white wheat beer contest, but Franziskaner takes it in the Dunkel-Weisen category!  Yummy banana and clove with toasty malt.  I dont know how they do it!  A+
Cloudy auburn with a thick head.  Nice yeasty aroma.  Lots of flavor with a sweet and nutty banana taste.  Very enjoyable.
Color terbol, aromes a caramel, lleugera, amb carboni ben integrat

Flavor is dominated by yeast. Color deep hazy copper, light creamy small top diminishes quickly in foamy layer. Taste starts as sweet, yeasty palette, a bit cocoa or toffee in aroma. In late stages flavor becomes hoppy floral, light sour. Strange but - fresh finish it has. Medium bodied.
Bottle. Pours cloudy amber with stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel. Sweetish taste of malt with notes of caramel and fruit. Creamy mouthfeel. Quite good.
Good colur, very little aroma. Hints of caramel and banana. I could drink a lot of this beer.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy brown with tan head. 
Aroma dark fruits, caramel, bread, some yeast. 
Taste sweet, fresh, nice. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Nice dunkelweizen.

Has a real malt flavor,   Highly carbonated, some tastes of fruit and cola. Falls a touch flat at the end but very tasty
