50cl Bottle, courtesy of Nathalie. Hazy brown coloured beer with some light carbonation and a small off white head. Banana yeasty sweeter hinted aroma. Medium to full palate. Finish is sweet fruity light yeasty. Not that heavy as expected. Not bad for a Dunkelweizen.
Oh sweet dunkelweiss goodness. A deep cloudy beer with a refreshing balance of hops and malts. A classic of the style. Up there with HB dunkelweiss, which I rate slightly higher.

50 cl bottle. Good Dunkelweizen. Reddish brown color, hazy liquid and frothy head, which slowly dissapears. The aroma is fruity, with hints of caramel, bread, roasted malt. The yeast is noticeable, with earthy notes in the aroma. The taste is sweet but not over the top. Medium to full body, creamy texture and lively carbonation. The finish is smooth and average on duration. Drinkable beer, but it can get too sweet when you drink more than one.
cloudy brownish body, great foamy head; aroma of bread, caramel andyeast, taste of candy sugar, yeasty sourness with some bitterness in the background; really great dunkelweizen

Kaatuu lasiin ruskeana ja sameana päästäen kuitenkin hieman valoa läpi. Vaahto on muhkea ja valkoinen. Haju on banaaninen, limppuinen, ruohoinen, multainen ja hieman marjapensainen. Maku on banaaninen, leipäinen, happaman sitruksinen sekä hieman multainen. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja hieman hiilihappoinen. Kokonaisuutena ihan vakuuttava esitys, mutta en ole hirveä vehnien (sekä tumman että vaaleiden) ystävä. Maistuu mukavasti kesäillassa.
Dark brown with reddish tint color. Thin tan head. Aroma of spice, banana, caramel, and bready malts. Flavors of spice, banana, and toasty malts. Medium body. Nice flavor.

Great aroma of yeast, old barn, decaying fruits, reminiscent of some of the Belgian ales. The flavour is not as exciting or complx though. Still, nice, fruity (banana?), mellow and creamy. Good job. For a dark beer in Germany, this is much better than any (lager) Dunkel.

I can see both sides of the fence regarding this beer. The aroma establishes your right to expect high expectations- beautiful malt, fresh yeast and earthy scents. The taste is a little disappointing considering the tenacity of the aroma, but its still a good, balanced Dunkel.
Weissbier always rises expectations. Either you surprise or disappoint. This is a disappointment. Not very weissbier existence and not so fresh. Yes, it is OK beer, no surprises.

Világosbarna, lámpafénynél sötétnarancs szín, opálos. Piszkosfehér vékony, hamar feloszló hab. Friss, citrusos, érett banános, enyhén mézes illat. Látványra szép füzéresen gomolygó, érzésre csípősen szénsavas. Tipikus búzasörös íz, elég visszafogott intenzitással, gyenge komlózással. Olyan, mintha felhígították volna szódavízzel. Az illata alapján többet ígért. Az íze és állaga azonban az átlagos szintre húzza le.

Bottle pours a brown red big tan head. Light carb in tongue. Smells tastes bread malt caramel earthy sweet banana. Not bad Id drink it again pretty light. Makes me want some smoked meat. Keep getting pretzel tastes coming in my mouth.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Beautiful brown colourings, but not much up top. A slightly muted weissbier. Some soft nuttiness, some muddiness in the mouthfeel and a sweet, clovey finish. This is very drinkable, but its subtlety prevents it from being dramatic or compelling.

Bottle. Unfiltered brown hefe looks. Yeasty aroma. Some yeasty taste with little bitterness. Bit watery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown and shitty hazy colour with a brief medium white head. A mild banana aroma. Strongly carbonated, not too sweet. Some banana, some yeast and citrus flavors. Some metallic notes which are not pleasant. A good wheat beer but not my favourite.
a decent beer, but not the greatest. Good smelling and appearance, good flavor too, could maybe drink two

Comprata al Supermercato Simply di Gavardo per  1.00.
0,50 cl versata in un bicchere "weizen".
Marrone scuro con toni granati, molto torbida(grazie al cazzo è una Hefe!) con una head bella piena e persitente.
Al naso offre bei sentori di frutta esotica, banana in primis, ma anche sentori di malto, tostato e chiodi di garofano, anche se meno dei sentori di banana e frutta.
In bocca è poco amara, piacevolmente acidula e fresca di complessità, un poco sapida.
Di retrogusto maltato, piacevolmente beverina, carb decisamente viva ma non fastidiosa, finale poco astringente e mediamente persistente.
Un ottima Dunkel, molto gradevole secondo me e dallottimo rapporto qualità-prezzo(ricordo che lho pagata un euro per una bottiglia da mezzo litro).
Consigliata.

#532
Mittleres braun und sehr trüb. Aroma? Neben der Hefe ist Malz und vielleicht Nelke erahnbar. Fruchtigkeit? Fehlanzeige! Wiederum wäßriger Antrunk mit reichlich CO2. Leichter Körper, geschmackliches Loch zwischen Hefe und etwas malzigem Abgang. Im Ergebnis läßt es sich gut trinken, ist aber alles andere als ein gutes oder gar herausragendes Hefe-Weissbier!
	
Test vom 4.11.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,9,11,10,9,10 - 9,85
Bottle. Pours slightly cloudy brown color with nice lasting brown head. Aroma is banana, caramel, smoke. Flavor is wheat, banana, caramel, smoke.

28/X/12 - 50cl bottle from random German supermarket @ home - BB: VII/13 (2012-1208) 
Cloudy dark brown beer, aery beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: banana, and lots of it! Also caramel and fudge, but mainly banana. MF: too much carbon, medium body. Taste: banana, bit bready, raisins, some citrus, bit watery, little sour. Aftertaste: carbon sour, some citrus, grains, banana, hint of chocolate.

Aroma: some caramel, banana, maybe spruce and/or herbs; Appearance: dark brown, cloudy (barely translucent), big but quickly falling off-white head (with delicate lacing); Taste: medium sweetness, lightly sour; Palate: medium body, little creamy, average carbonation, dry and short finish;
Overall: very good "weizen", but Im not convinced that "dunkel" part ;)

Cloudy slightly dark ruby with off-white foam head, lacing to glass. Aroma is smokey. Taste is smokey, bitter not sweet. Dry bitter aftertaste. (Velp 201211)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a murky brown colored beer with a small, beige head. Faint aroma of malts and some banana. Flavor is light sweet with a spicy aftertaste. Not too bad.

Pours a hazy brown colour with a creamy brown head. Aroma of spruce, yeast and some dark fruitsa maybe. The taste is a good balance between the sourness and sweetness. Fresh mouthfeel. A really good balanced dunkel.

Into a weizen glass. Finger of head with a cloudy dark brown body.
Barnyard smell with a little ripe dark fruit. A bit muted though.
A little sweetness, mild bitterness and a chalkiness. Disappointing and weak taste. None of the styles characteristic richness.
Too fizzy, medium body.
Not impressed or interested by this.

May 29th, 2011 - That cheeky monk goes wherever good beer goes. Hes kind, affable, and accessible, even for the poorest beer drinker like me. Theres no reason not to pick up a whole line of the Franziskaner beers, then, and give yourself a week to take in a little German culture and art. I started my horizontal tasting with the Hefe-weissbier Dunkel, appealingly dark, but certain to have a refined elegance reserved for lighter beers. and lagers. It pours with a somewhat thick light brown head, and the body glows with a deep and dark-orange red color, like a dying ember. I cant catch much aroma through the foam, so I dig a shaft through the bubbles and take a sip. It begins with a light core of chocolate, accented with clove and brown sugar, resembling a pumpkin beer without the vegetal notes. The body is medium, the flavor is good, clear and clean, and sports a lot of straightforward, no-nonsense palate pleasing that would go tremendously well with chicken or pork dishes. Why dont I buy these beers more often?

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2014 Mild banana bread, clove, caramel, cereal, earthy hops, and spices in the aroma. The taste is not as sweet as the nose led me to believe, but it is good. The mouthfeel is smooth, silky, and properly carbonated. Good.

pours murky dark copper with a decent beige head, some retention and lacing. faint banana  esters, spices, some belgiumness (!), celery, caramel, grassiness. average carbonation, light to medium body, grassy and dry finish.

0.5l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. A cloudy cookie-brown beer with a small lacing light khaki head. Lots of sweet banana chewing gum, dark malts, some blue fruitiness, yeast and spicy cloves. Really classic and quite good. Small prickling bubbles in a oily mouthfeel. Dark malty with banana, cloves, wet old grass and some sweet bubblegum. A bit sweet at first but that fades. Yeah, a true classic. 22.08.2012
Dark brown color with beige head. Malt ann spicy aroma. Taste is light sweet and medium bodied.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2014 This beer was surprisingly inexpensive for a beer of this quality, $3 for a bottled pint, in PA.  Pours with abundant head, but foamy head dissipates quite quickly leaving a beer with little carbonation.  If you want carbonation, I recommend not pouring it and drinking from the bottle.  I tried this as an experiment and this beer really retains its carbonation this way.  Complex aroma, but relatively light-bodied, bordering on thin.  Aroma of bananas, grape, perhaps some apple, paired with nutty tones.  Lightly sweet, with little bitterness and thankfully, little sourness as well.  A very pleasing beer!

Cloudy dark brown with large white to beige head. Lasting quite well.
Aroma..roasted malts, some fruits, light wheat.
Taste.. sweet malt with bit bitter finish.
good.. would be great if not so carbonated
Weissbier dunkel är på pappret en bra ide, här har man inte riktigt lyckats få ner den bra ideen i flaskan. Smaken bär inslag av jäst och malt men kroppen känns tom och ihålig.
This one is just ok - was hoping for better.  Good price point though at Bevmo.
Fresh, dark hefe weizen. Easy to drink with an aroma and palate of spices. Very tasty, but filling beer. Great head.

Bottle from local Liquor Mountain. Sweet malty cookie aroma, some yeast. Clear light brown with a creamy head. Thin mild maltiness in initial; some tartness in mid palate; slight sweetness in final, which fades out quickly. Thin body. Okay. Id like a little more flavor and body. Aroma is nice.

16.9 oz bottle - FBF 2012, Hotel Ibis.  Pours cloudy caramel with gradual lightnening towards the bottom of the glass.  Huge, fluffy, rocky white tan head, fully lasting, not a lot of lacing.  Big aromas of bread, grain, cinnamon, darker fruity figs, and general goodness.  Nice medium-light palate, belying its dunkel-ness.  Tastes of good dried fruits, touch of chocolate, and hint of spicy yeastiness at the long long finish.  Dry at the end, leaves you wanting more. Yum.

Pours a dark brown with orange edges with a nice lasting thin head. Aroma is sweet with a light Belgium or hefe yeast smell. Taste is sweet, but not sugary, and the carbonation carries the yeast zest well. Not too watery, but does leave a bit of sugar film in the finish.

Reddish brown body with an off-white head and ok lace. Wheat malt aromas are evident, accompanied by ripe fruit - heavy on the banana, toast, clove and bubble gum. Slightly sticky fruit sweetness, bubble gum, clove, yeast and a big hit of bananas toward the finish. Medium body and carbonation, sticky mouthfeel and the ripe fruits linger in the aftertaste.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Pours in milky-orange with huge head. For a weizen nothing special so far. Usual yeast and banana aroma with a decent mixture in the taste. Simple and average weizen. Drinkable.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Pale dark amber brown in colour, low but steady head. Taste of old yeast and brown bananas. Nothing what I like. Some hints of roasted malt as well.

Cloudy medium brown pour, medium off white head.  Soft fruit, yeast and toasted malt in the nose.  Taste starts sweet but dries slightly.  Light bananas on the tongue with spice (cinnamon or allspice) and light but spicy hops finish.
very light in taste for a dark wheat beer. brownish colour, soft aroma and a  soft, fruity palate

16.9oz bottle. Nutty banana aroma. Sort of bready - banana bready, for sure. Little caramel. Moderate sweet, light bitter taste. Smooth but pronounced carbonation. Soft, more dry texture. Clear sort of amber - brown - orange color. Good foamy off-white head, leaves dots of lace.

Bottle. Dark, brown, hazy. Nose is loaded with ripe bananas, some clove, wheat. Some butter/corn. Body is carbd, some roasted tones. Some greenish hops. Ok, but not my fav of the dunkel weisses.-- bb/h

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is carmel brown color with lots of beige head.  Aroma is roast malts, wheat, and spice.  Taste is also roasted grains, heavy wheat and banana plus light on other fruits particularly pear.  Palate is medium-bodied, smooth texture, average carbonation, and a light, sweet finish.
Inconfondibile fin dallodore il gusto caratteristico delle franziskaner. Ottima dunkel, piacevolmente fruttata e aromatizzata. Retrogusto piacevole e di facile beva.
Tap. The aroma is banana. Taste of wheat and  banana. Quite nice. (But I am not the greatest fan of Weissbier)

After drinking the weissebier from the tap, I had this dunkel version from the bottle in a restaurant in Austria. The place and the taste of both these beers were great, Then dunkel tastes more-or-less the same as the normal weissen, but with a softer taste and a bit more sweet.
Transferring my data before I used to rate at Ratebeer. Ill add a more detailed description as I drink it again.

Grassy aromas with some coriander and barley. Murkey brown with a medium foam. Crisp, simple flavors of oats, biscuit and a sweet caramel malt. A touch of booze on the finish. Overall, a refreshing cold one with nice carbonation. B rating.
I cant really elaborate to the extent that I want. But this is now one of my favorite beers.

bel colore tonaca di frate velato con schiuma bianco sporco soffice non molto persistente.aroma lievito limone banana e anche dolce maltato e leggermente alcolico.unisce le classiche caratteristice della weisse con una complessita leggermente piu accentuata.corpo un po troppo leggero cosi come la carbonazione.
Best beer Ive ever had so far. However, I havent tried other beers of this brand YET.
Bottle. Pours cloudy, copper with little head. Nose is wild yeast and malt. Palate... Cidery with cloves and banana. Nice.

Deep caramel hued with a small film of white head. Aroma is like banana gum with light caramel in the back. Taste is mild banana and ester, finishing slightly on the sweet side. Well carbonated, medium to light body.

Posiblemente su característica Dunkel hace que esta cerveza la posicione algo mejor que su archiconocida hna. HefeWeissbier. No es que sea una cerveza de relumbrón, pero la recibo de mejor agrado que otras Dunkel más pesadas y alcohólicas.

The aroma is banana, honey and burnt toast.  in the mouth, theres more banana with a little chocolate, alcohol and a metallic taste on the sides of the tongue. More refreshing than I would have expected from a Dunkel and it has the good length that youd expect from this style.Quite enjoyable.
I slightly preferred this to their normal weissbier. It has a bit more of an interesting flavour, slightly fruity but not too strong.

Il colore è particolarmente intenso, con base di arancio torbido dai riflessi scuri, ed un corpo color ebano. In controluce si evidenzia la presenza di colpi di luce ramati e un lieve accenno di vivacità delle bollicine.
La schiuma è abbastanza sottile rispetto a quella di una tipica weiss. Si presenta con unaltezza media, di aspetto compatto, cremoso e dalla scarsa persistenza, particolarmente sottile in fase di riposo, dal colore bianco sporco tendente al giallognolo.
Laroma è distintamente fresco, carico in note di lievito, con una base dolciastra parzialmente attenuata da un sentore di luppolo appena percettibile.
Il gusto si distingue profondamente da quello della sorella "bionda", contrapponendosi con un sapore prevalentemente amaricante, tipicamente maltato, lasciando un retrogusto dolce appena percettibile in sottofondo. Il corpo è pieno e rotondo, parzialmente smorzato da un lieve pizzicorio a livello palatale. Media persistenza amarostica, ed una carbonazione medio/alta.

50cl bottle. Dark and hazy amber and brown, small dirty head. Nose : light aromas of malts mostly caramel and a bit roasted. Yeast smells like a bit like wet laundry. Background chocolate. Sip : low to medium body with creamy and fluffy texture. The body is airy and one of my favorite kind. Low carbonation. Mildly sweet with floral and a bit honey flavors, a bit like cream. Short finish. Overall : no action.

50cl bottle bought at a supermarket in Fuorigrotta, Naples, just to drink something at lunch. Poured in a TeKu, looks fine: dark brown liquor with big beige head. Nose is faint cloves, vague chocolate, distant banana; high sweetness at first sip, roasted tinges in a watery texture, unpleasant metallic finish. Not a bad beer, simply not good and forgettable dunkel weizen.
Fragrant aroma, wheat-y; beautiful color med-high carbonation, the best dunkelweizen I can think of, just a wonderful example of the style and a great summer afternoon drink
030812. Bottle at home. Pours hazy brown with a high head. Aroma yeast, wheat and some roasted malts. Smooth wheaty taste. Medium bodied and carbonated. Not Bad.
Cloudy brown - white head. Roasted. Nutty. Ryebread. Banana. Yeasty. Light citrus. Light bitterness.

A: Fiery copper with a thick, creamy head that leaves a few splotches of lacing on the glass.

S: Bananas, clove, bread, yeast, banana bread, banana muffins

T: This is a very tasty beer. Its easy to drink, smooth and has plenty of flavor. The aroma is a great indicator of the beers taste profile.

M: Smooth and easy with a medium or slightly less carbonation level.

D: Very drinkable and enjoyable, especially if youre in the mood for a good German ale.

(bottle) Poured an opaque hazy red-brown with creamy head.
Typical Hefeweizen yeast flavours and also some rich caramel coming through.  A nice beer for one or two in a session,
Bottle-This brew has a toffeeish malt aroma, and a creamy,grainy palate. It finishes with some spiciness,suggesting cinnamon and pepper.

Ok, not a great dunkelweizen. The beer smells of caramel and some deeper malt notes. The beer is brown with a thick off white foam head. The taste is sweet malt caramel notes. The beer is smooth and medium bodied.

0,5 l bottle 
coffee, banana, leaves, earthy, brown, cloudy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, watery feel, average carbonation,

Bottle. Pours a hazy red body, with an average light brown head that diminishes slowly, leaving a good lacing. Great roasted aroma, along with some caramel. Medium to heavy sweet and light bitter taste, and a fairly sweet finish. Light to medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. A very good beer, needs a little improvement in taste. I surely prefer this over the Franziskaner weisse counterpart
Dark brown, with a off white head, a bit reddish. Malty, prune flavour. Quite sweet, a bit of coffee. Nice.

500ml bottle @ Tallinn

Quite tasty, slightly watery dunkelweizen. Well balanced.

Nice nutty favor in this cdark copper colored beer. Nice covering of foamy head stays with the drink until the end. Adequate sedimentation in bottle to add final swirl to pour. A really good example of a dunkel weizen. Flavor stays on the palate fro a while...

Medium strong aroma is good and has fruits (banana) and some hay and yeast. Chestnut brown. Creamy head stays well. Light taste has long finish. Strongly fruity: ripe banana, mango, bit pineapple. Medium bodied, creamy with soft carbonation. A good specimen of its kind butfor some reason did just not hit me. Bit wrong season(winter) for this beer.
Hazy dark  brown colour with medium beige head. Aroma is wheat. Flavour is banana, roasted malt.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2012 0,5l bottle. A dark brown dunkelweizen with orange highlights. Good head. The aroma has notes of fruits, caramel, malts and spices. The taste is good balanced and quite tasty, with notes of fruits, caramel and malts. Long delicious finish. Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel, is a really great beer.

0,5l bottle. Hazy dark brown color. Small, fizzy, beige head appears only to disappear quickly. Sweet, malty, fruity aroma. Sour and crisp texture. Caramel, malty, bit watery flavor. Medium carbonation.
A solid choice however not as flavorful as others in its family. Goes down easy and makes for a good companion for a cookout.

Brown-white thick foam which stays for long, brown cloudy color with mediocre aroma and too much carbonation which I didnt like. Taste was light sweet-sour. Finish is short which is not a bad thing though. Overall a not so interesting beer.

Nice creamy head that stays very long. Nice brown color, getting hazy after adding the hefe. Good taste, some roasted malts. Very refreshing. Overall: One of my favorite weizen.

500 ml bottle. Pours hazy dark brown-reddish colour with large creamy off-white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, vegetables and some mild spicy notes. Flavour of banana, yeast and wheat. Medium bodied, bit watery and medium carbonation. A really refreshing beer for summer. Not very extraordinary though.

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ cloud brown with a large head. aroma of sweetness, some banana and malts. wheaty, medium mouth feel. nice dunkel
Aroma of toffee and banana custard. Light muddy brown appearance. tastes spicy with some tart and citric zest. Medium body, noted more for its lively bite than for weight.
Menos cuerpo que la original y con un sabor ligeramente más amargo. Mantiene la esencia de Franziskaner con su sabor original

500 ml bottle.  Pours hazy-brown with a thick long lasting white head and much lacing.  Aroma of yeast, wheat malt, cloves and caramel.  Body is full and crisp.  Wheat malt, cloves, some caramel and banana notes fill the mouth, some tartness.  Finish is short and slightly sweet.  Overall good brew.
500 ml bottle a brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts nuts fruits some caramel and spicy flavor malts spicy dark fruits some caramel yeast and hops

Out of bottle Slight sweet aroma. Taste of a surprising sour at first then quickly goes away.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A smooth beer with opaque red to brown color.  Its flavor is: roasty, smoke, woody, toasty
Bottle at bar. Brown color, white head. Sweet fruity taste with banana, herbs and plum. Sweet/sour finish. Very nice dunkel.
500ml bottle.  Pours hazy caramel brown with a medium head.  Aroma is caramel, raisin and slightly sour wheat.  Taste is a bit bland, some dirty wheat.  Raisin on the finish.  Hints of banana.

Bottle. Pours hazy brown to deep amber medium off-white head with good staying power and decent lacing. Smells of wheat with a bit of caramel and some yeast. Taste is wheaty, very slightly sweet with some roasted malt body and a touch of lemon. Crisp and refreshing.

50 cl bottle @ Wanha Posti, Tampere.
Rated on 20110617.
Pours cloudy dark brown color with a large, foamy head. Aroma of banana, spices and a lot of stuffy wheat. Flavor of very faint banana, grain and wheat. Balanced and full-bodied.
3324
i loved the standard franziskaner hefe. this is not quite as good, but still quite excellent. typical hefe banana sweetness, but some additional roasty malts. easy to drink.
Bottle Beautiful reddish-orange colour, brown, medium head. Aroma of some sweet-sour ripe banana, malt and some hefe. Sweet-bitter taste, some roasted malt, some banana, dark, but light hefe.

Pint 9 bottle. Pours dark brown with reddish/yellow hints with a creamy odd white head. The aroma of wheat is sharp and crisp, with undertones of roasted malt. The flavor is pretty much the same. Sweet cracked wheat over roasted malts gives this a wonderful flavor. Very good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2012 500ml bottle. Wheat and malt aromas. Pours dark copper colour, very hazy, with nice fine-bubled light brown head, really persistent. Some lacework. Medium body and carbonation. Tastes wheat, some of bread, sweet and sour flavours, with an average sweet finish.
A classic dunkel weissbier, really easy to drink.

Bottle from Etre Gourmet webshop. Pours murky brown with a big frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and banana. Taste is light sweet malty, wheat and banana. Medium body.Light hopped, easy to like this one.

Bottled, 0.5l. Hazy olive brown color, large frothy brownish head, flat carbonation and some grainy residue. Aroma of yeast, light hops,fruits, grains and weak hints of caramel. Sweet and sour grainy malt taste with some banana notes. Mouthfeel is somewhat acetic, but quite plain, while lack of bitterness gives the beer weak aftertaste. Medium body, thin texture and flat carbonation in palate. Expected much more...

16.9 oz bottle pours amber with an off white head.  Aroma is citrus, bananas, yeast and malts.  Taste is yeast, malts and a bit of sweetness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500 ml bottle. Pours an opaque dark brown. Aroma of molasses, grain, toasty, peat. Flavor of peat, wheat, molasses.  Very easy drinking.

Bottle. Ruddy, hazy red-brown color with a massive, tight off-white head. This is an attractive beer. The nose is reminiscent of other hefeweizens, but with a nutty malt element. Cut wheat, peanuts, sweet sugary banana. The taste is Some light berries and powdered cocoa, giving way to more delicate wheat beer flavors. Lemon, summer grass, sugar water finish. This beers light and very easy to drink. I find the body a bit too watery and thin. Overall, this is one of my first dunkelweizens, and I look forward to trying more examples. Meh.
On tap. Slightly citrus and banana aroma. Brown cloudy appearance with a two finger brown-ish head. Taste is malty, caramel and citrus. A fizzy carbonation. Overall a very good hefeweissbier.

Pours a very cloudy brown with off white head. Aroma is yeasty and grainy. taste is very yeasty with a does of caramely malts. Pretty heavy carbonation. Slight citrus and alot fo bananna bread flavors. Very good stuff.

pours a deep hazy amber with thick tan head, all the goo dunkel aromas of banana and cloves with some solid malt in the mix. the flavour i quite smooth with a solid malt backbone supportinfg more of the banana from the yeast. im a big fan of the style and this doesnt disappoint.
Bottle. Banana, wheat malt, and clove aroma. Hazy brown with a large beige head. Sweet yeasty malt, banana, spice flavor. Medium, lightly carbonated body. Very pleasant.
Cant believe I havent rated this one yet.  Taste is malty, smooth, fruity notes as well.  Goes down smooth as silk, light to medium bodied.  Very good dunkel

Malty aroma. Medium head. Hazy and brown in color. Light taste, no carbonation, abrupt finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Long Island, NY - 500 mL bottle poured a cloudy brown color with lots of tan head. Aroma was banana, cloves and a little bit of roasted malts. Taste was spicy with banana hints with cloves. Awesome Dunkelweizen 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy dark brown colour. Banana aroma. Taste of a little caramel, malt and banana

Big bottle. Too bad the big guys own this one. Out of a lack of choices, I gave this a try. Otherwise, screw the big guys. Fruity scent over a dark amber pour. Wheaty, grain fronted taste with a thick fruit note hitting second and a bready yeasty finish.
Cloudy dark brown with lasting off-white head.  Light fruity aroma.  Enjoyable weissbier, fruity aftertaste.

Pours a cloudy murkey brown with a standard Weiss head.  aroma is a malt/wheat blend that is pretty nice.  Taste is a lot better than their original Weiss.  Much bolder and less wheat heavy like their original.  I suggest this before their Weiss original

Dark brown color with a tan head. Hint of bananas and clean finish. Refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orangish brown color with a nice off-white head. Aroma is mild with a bit of caramelly malt along with banana and cloves. Taste also starts with a bit of caramel and toast, followed by some fruity tones - banana, a little tart citrus, and finishes more malt.
franzishaner weissbjer Dunkel. reddish purple brown with small head aroma of banana spice clove and malt. flavor of similar. nice and complete. 747414

Bottle.   Pours a cloudy dark brown,  very nice.   Has a nice nose on it which definitely lets you know what is to come.  Has a raisiny flavor,  not too overwhelming,  finishes clean.   Very nice dark hefe.
Inferiore alla sua sorellina più conosciuta! Un pò più dolciastra e se vogliamo più complessa della Hefe-Weissebier, ma meno equilibrata. Un pò dolciastra. Inferiore, come detto, ma lo stesso buona.
A really good one, little bit sweet on the mouth and easy all over else. Liiike it.

Pours a hazy braun with moderate head that stays and eventually diminishes leaving no lacing.  Prominently malt flavors that are caramel, cereal and perhaps a slight hint of raisin. Modest hint of herbal hops.  Starts mildly sweet and stays throughout the moderate finish. Moderate carbonation with thin to moderate texture. Clean on the palate. Good dunkel!

Addendum: after review of other ratings, I can appreciate the banana and slight clove, but definitely didnt get it without the suggestion. Thanks!

Poured a brownish amber color, moderate head.  Aroma has bread, raison, mild sugar, caramel, dough, yeast.   Med light sweetness.  Med light body.  Nice texture mouthfeel, creamier.  Has a nice taste. Little sugar raisin in taste with some roasted malt and light sugar and yeast.

Draught. Pours cloudy dark brown with a large tan head. Clove and banana aroma. Taste is equally sweet and sour with a hint of bitterness. Light body, lively carbonation, smooth with a long banana finish.
Full bodied and frothy. Good color and surprising palate. Hints of banana. Tastes better when a glass is chilled.
Cloudy brown pour with a huge fluffy head.  Bubblegum and bananas, even though its dark.  Like any other hefe, but with a dark tan.  Pretty good though.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2012 0.5 bottle. Surprisingly spicy aroma, banana is easily traceable with a citrus and hop addition. Very hazy liquid of brown, or even mahogany color, topped with a creamy off-white head of incredible retention. Taste is definitively sweet with elusive sourness and a fine doze of bitterness, slightly too much sugars. Medium body and creamy texture make this beer very delicate, and together with the creamy head lasting the entire session they create a pleasant fuzzy sensation, which is further emphasized by very soft carbonation. Finish balances the feeling by introducing more bitterness although not to a fault. Very good brew, perfect for some conversations with friends in the afternoon.
Cloudy,  sweet, almost candied in flavour, like it, but in a novelty way. wouldnt care for more than one at a sitting...almost an after-dinner with pie or cake drink.

Bottle. Dark brown and slightly cloudy. Pored with a small head. Some wheat is present plus a trace of citrus.Medium body, reasonable but nothing 
exciting.
Bottle, some what a surprising taste, nice dark collor and a nice brown head. Lot of fruty after taste, not a big wissebier fan but it grew on me.

From a 25 fl. oz. bottle stamped L-152136-20:54.  It pours a darker mahogany amber tone with decent carbonation and a tremendous cream colored and long lasting head. Aromas are enticing with dark malts, wheat, banana, and spice. The body is medium but fizzy. The taste is on the bold, bitter side with a keen sweetness and slightly dry end.  Very easy to drink.
Pours a cloudy dark brown with a decent off white head and nice lacing. Aims is yeast with some banana peel. Taste is bread, banana peel, and some earthiness. Lovely carbonation. Very drinkable.
50 cl. bottle @ home. Very hazy brown with an off-white head. Yeasty fruity smell. Yeasty taste, with some banana. very lively carbonation. really tasteful dunkelweizen.
A beautiful dark colour. A smooth yet interesting taste. Dunkels are right near the top of my personal list.
In bottle. Excellent weizenbier! caramel, brown, lightly bitter, medium sweetness,
Bottle. Malty. A little banana. Sour Rye. A little yeast. No hobs but a little bitterness. Notes of roasted hazel nut, cloves and peach. Sour aftertaste like wet cloth. Not my taste.

chocolate, citrus, floral, barnyard, leather, licorice, smoke, rotten eggs, skunky, ginger, vanilla, black, cloudy, brown foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, full body, soft carbonation,

Dark amber cloudy liduid with beautiful creamy head. Aromas banana, orange, earthy grains, malt. Body is medium full, palate has sweet malt , little caramel, yeast and earthy nuances. The carbonation is meidum devloped with sparkling smoooth mouth feel. After taste is short with little malts and hints of vague bitter and dryness.

Bottle 500ml @ Mary McGee, Holstebro
Pours cloudy brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, chocolate and banana. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Amber, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty  lightly wheaty and sweetish aroma, some fruitiness and faint banana. Body is light to medium, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, some fruitiness and faint banana. Finish is short to average, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish, faint fruitiness and faint banana. Bit thin-bodied and lightly sweetish hefeweizen - nothing special.

Tasted from tall bottle into tulip glass. Sampled side-by-side with Ayinger Ur-Weiss to compare two classic Dunkelweizens. This one was definitely the lesser. Poured a mostly clear dark brown with average off-white head. Darker than Ayinger. Aroma was mostly neutral, but some faint bread, toast, caramel, no sign of hops, nor fruit, nor spice. Definitely not a hefeweizen-style fermentation. Flavor was thin and boring as well: malty sweet, very little hops flavor, very little grainbill complexity. If I hadnt been told this was a Dunkelweizen, I wouldnt have known it contained wheat at all, much less a wheat ale yeast. It was reminiscent of a bland dark lager like Becks Dark, Heineken Dark, Amberbock, etc.
Im not excited about the smell of this, and it tastes a bit off, it might be infected as it as an unexpected sour smell to it.  The copper color kicks ass though.
Bottle. Greyish brown with a medium white head. Sweet banana aroma. Moderate bitter flavour. Light to medium body. Lively carbonation.
bottle. Brown color. Thick smooth head. Low carbonation. Low bitterness and sweetness. Roasty/light caramel aroma.

A very good dunkelweizen beer.
Dark color with nice head.
Weisse aromas with some roasted flavor.
Same as taste....
A very nice beer that I would gladly drink all night long.
Bottle. Fruity with a hint of cloves. Good dunkelweizen. I would gladly drink this again.

Bottle. Dark muddy brown, thick dreamt white head. Classic hefe nose, cloves, wheat, big banana. Slight roasty taste before the big ester flavours kick in, rich cloves and light banana, smooth and sweet. Finish is short with slightly spicy bitterness. Nice.

Tap Hoppy Monk El Paso, TX-pours hazy dark orange with a small soapy eggshell head and some lacing.  nose is big ripe bananas lite dark fruit bubblegum.  flavors of dusty esters, dark fruit and ripe banana.  nothing is really doing it for me in this beer though.  a decent representation of this style, but i think this beer would be better a bit more fresh and/or from the bottle?  TBD.

Not bad, not great. Not much aroma and relatively light in flavor.  Dark body but lacks the thickness I have come to be used to in Aventinus.  While I tend to like the dark wheat beers better, I would prefer the standard wheat from Franziskaner to this, and anything from Schneider over Franziskaner.
Date: December 23, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: Bulldog Description: Semi-opaque cloudy orangish brown, grainy/wheat, citrus and spice in aroma and taste, quite a bit of carbonation.

(Flasche) Die Farbe ist ein dunkles, fast Glasflaschen Braun, aber wärmer. Es hat eine starke Hefetrübung und eine fast weiße Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sehr gering. Es ist ganz leicht malzig-weizig. Geschmacklich ist es leicht samtig-weizig mit einer leichten würzigen Hopfennote. Es gibt keine Bittere und die Karbonisierung ist OK. Zusammengefasst; süffig und langweilig.

500 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on December 20. Pours hazy chestnut brown with a huge off-white head that slowly dissipates. Smell is malty sweet with banana, coriander and some spices. Taste is sweet with banana, coriander, caramel and hints of roasted malts and cocoa. Finish is sweet and slightly spicy.
Basically the same as the Hefeweizen version, but not as good.  Has some slight roastiness, chocolate banana character but otherwise very similar.

Botlled, 500ml from Sandras friends at Culham School, Oxon. Chestnut with white head. Initially quite a wet cardboard note, but this soon went leaving a rich, malty, darkly roasted malt flavour, the alcohol is quite apparent, as is a wine like character. Full and fruity, improves a great deal.
I drink this straight from the bottle. I think it tasted better this way. Its dark in appearance. Great thick taste. I thoroughly enjoy the beer.
UPDATED: JUN 14, 2015 Excellent dunkelweissen, dark color with nice malt taste, not too heavy.  Easy to drink in at the bar or a backyard bbq.
Rödbrun öl med svagt skum. Härliga söta dofter från citron och banan. Smaker av apelsin, knäck och banan. Svag beska i eftersmaken.
50cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a big light brown head. Smells cheesy and abit soap. Tastes cheesy/nutty, light bitter, abit fruity and abit watery with a similar finish.

from bottle, brown/reddish colour with unstable white head. Smell: some malty/sweet smell, caramel. Taste: sweet malts, caramel, coffee. Nice and easy drinking beer. Not that spectacular like the white version, but still nice one.

barva tmave zakalena,  jantarova, pena rychle klesa,   tmavsi barvy, nekrouzkuje. Vune ovocna, lehce visnova a bananova, chlebova 
 Chut: velice slaby riz, lehce trpka dochut, jinak lehce ovocna.
muy parecida a su hermana la clara,el olor es menos intenso y al paladar es menos frutada y tiene un toque de malta tostada,muy recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: On tap.  Comes a hazy brown with an average biege head.  Aroma of bread, malt, wheat and spices.  Taste is malt, caramel, banana, yeast, citrus and spices.  Complex.  A bit sweet.  Good stuff.
A decent drinking beer, but nothing out of the ordinary. Had it on draught. Its a medium bodied brew, brown in color w/ a tan head & a slightly wheaty taste.

Sweet and citric smelling. Beautiful color in the glass with a decent head that sticks around for a couple drinks. Medium sweetness with almost a creamy hint. Very lively carbonation in the mouth. This is a really good beer for a mid-day treat or a segue beer.
Very good beer. Malty with a very nice light banana flavor to it. Definitely will buy again soon.

50cl bottle. Murky brown with frothy off-white head, creamy and good persistence. Aroma is to floral hops, citrus and moderate toasted malt. Flavour is citrus, with a final moderate sweet. Carbonation is medium high, body is medium high.
Always a favorite. Franziskaner makes great ales. This has to be my favorite dunkel ever. Smooth, crisp palatable taste!

Creamy off-white lasting head with fair lacing. Hazy light brown body. Medium malt aroma of grain, nutty and roasted malt. Light hops and banana aroma. Medium body, oily texture and a metallic finish. Moderate sweet and light bitter.
First experience of a dunkel. Mighty impressed with this one. Dark, malty, with vanilla and banana notes. As a mate of mine would say, niiice.
Pours a dark brown with medium creamy head. Malty and wheaty with some sweetness in the finish. Prost!

Poured from a 1 pt. bottle into a Weihensrephan weisen glass.

The color is a cloudy dark brown with maroon highlights and about three fingers of foamy off-white head and some thick lacing left on the glass.

The smell has a little bit of figs and other dark fruits in the aroma. There is a slight pancake-like aroma with some a slight maple aroma too.

The taste is is a bit yeasty at first. There is a nice banana flavor that is unexpected for a beer as dark. The malts do come out and prove to be the strength of this beer, there are some good hints of figs, a little bubblegum mixed in, and a touch of clove as well.

The feel of this beer is smooth and pretty drinkable. A really great beer for a low price.
Tap. Hazy brown body with an average sized white head. Aroma-taste of cloves, tropical fruits , bread, spices, biscuity with a slightly sweet body and finish. Light to medium bodied.
Poured brownish with a nice head and good lacing smelled bananas bubble gum and yeast tasted lighter than expected decent
Bottle 50cl. A cloudy brown colour with a medium high, creamy, head. An aroma of malt and yeast. The taste is medium sweet. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a short finish.
This is my first Dunkel and wauw ! The smouthness of the weissbier, but than there is this complexx flavor of the dark side. Its between a Dubbel Abbey and a Heffe-Weisser/Witbier. Lovely !
A really nice Dunkelweizen, pours a nice thick chocolate-brown color with good foam head. Great body and wonderfull aroma with chocolate and banana. Highly enjoyable!

Bottle.
Spicy chocolate nose, light banana, somewhat dry. Very dark brown withorange, cloudy, tall, fine head. Creamy, chocolatey flavor, banana and clove. Lighter than expected, clean and drinkable. Not quite up their with the light weizen, but still  pretty good.

500mL bottle.  Poured clear reddish-orange (at least initially) with a creamy, sticky off-white head.  The aroma picked up sweet bananas and vanilla, with a whole lot of yeast presence.. a hint of orange in there too.. some bready and caramel malts deeper down.  The flavor found bready notes and warm banana at the core.. tangy wheat and orange zest around.. very dry and yeasty on the edges.. well-balanced.  Medium-bodied and well-carbonated on the palate.. flowed well through the mouth.. not a whole lot of darker malt influence, but this was very drinkable and tasty.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with ruby hue in the light and large tan head. Arima is subtle: yeast, clove, orange. Light bodied, slight banana on the finish.

in taster at BJs.  Looks like thick brown orange.  White soapy head.  Smells like a wit up front and german.  Tastes like a thick wheat amber with german yeast also sweet caramel in the carbonation near the finish which was a good dimension.  Overall 6.5 of 10.
Pretty much what youd expect from a German weizen, banana and clove aroma and taste. Slightly sweet. Youve had one, youve had them all....

500ml bottle.  poured a cloudy brown with a two finger light tan head and some lace. Aroma is a combination of sweet bread, cloves and banana, with a bit of yeast. Flavor starts slightly sweet and doughy, then turns to banana and clove, with a touch of earthiness. Slight metallic taste in the finish. Medium bodied with low carbonation and slightly dry.

Gift from my girlfriend.  Pours a cloudy reddish brown with a two finger white foamy head.  The aroma is nutty caramel malt.  Taste is caramel malt with a hint of citrus and spice.  Very slight hop presence in the finish.  A clean drinking, refreshing beer.

1 Sept 2011, bottle. light brown, hazy, thick foamy head. really yeasty, almost sour, bread aroma. med body and a bit fizzy. not as nice as their plain hefe. bread crust, some orange juice, a little yeasty. nice enough but nothing great.
Decent. Not a huge banana fan. A little spice character. A little sweet. Cloudy.
Brown color with a big creamy head. Fine slightly fruity arma. Taste has good notes of banana. Super dunkel weisse.

Drucken på Siesta i Malmö. Skummar rejält men lägger sig efter 5-6 min som ett lock. Ser åt som en tunn något grå cola i färgen. Doftar jäst, syrligt bröd och lite kryddigt. Smakar lite sötare, brödigare än sin ljusare version. Jag tycker den förlorar något på det. Inte lika frisk och syrlig.
Cloudy brown pour with an off-white head. Nice malty aroma, some cloves. Taste is like the aroma with a nice dry finish. I like this beer.

caramel, nuts, citrus, cloudy, brown, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, lively.
The refreshment of a hefe with a little extra body and maltiness. Good body, malty with notes of caramel. Fun to drink, though probably not as good in the heat as its lighter brothers.

500 ml bottle purchased Winooski Beverage Warehouse (Vermont), on August 2, 2011. Muddy brown, small head. Aroma of wheat and malted chocolate, sweet enough. Malted wheat taste slightly sour, slightly spicy, aftertaste of wheat. Very watered down!
UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013 Aroma is lemons, bananas and dark malts.  The flavor is bananas, lemons, dark malts, sour notes and a tart/tangy finish.
This and the regular weissbier are almost identical all except for the color. This beer has a slightly stronger malt flavor but finishs with that signature franziskaner fruit flavor.

Draught.  Pours dark brown with a small beige head.  Aromas are fruity, with plums and toffee.  The flavor is sweet and malty, with very little bitterness.  Medium to high carbonation.  Alright.  [770]

Pours a cloudy dark beige with a nice frothy beige head.  Aroma is fully of roasted malts, yeast and wheat.  Taste is medium bodied, loads of wheat and yeast with a nice well rounded roasted maltiness that just is great.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2012 Dark brown colour. Aroma of banana and other fruit. Sweet as hell. Ends up yeasty.

On tap at unos in neshaminy. Aroma is murky yeast, dark malts.  Theres a spiciness there as well.  Earthy, bread, yeast, caramel malt. Dark fruits. Medium body. Lighter in general than I expected.  The caramel malt lingers a bit, slightly sweet in the end. Good, but dont love it.
500 mL at Molly Malones in Munich.  Dark brown with a little red, with good head.  Rich wheaty aroma.  Good dark wheat taste, pleasant but a little bitter, could argue it gives it more flavour.

Murky brown, with a pretty good sized beige head. Aroma of prune and rye bread. Maybe its some other dark bread? Like maybe pumpernickel? No sure. Anyhoo, flavor is also the prune and some sort of dark bread, plus maybe a little bit of chocolate. Nicely sweet throughout.

Franziskaner
Hefe-Weisse Dunkel
Pours medium cloudy brown with a pleasing tan head and good retention. Aroma of some mild alcohol with a rich maltiness. Some pumpkin spices (nutmeg maybe) and anise. Smells sweet, but not overpowering. Nice aroma. Flavor is a bit underwhelming, but improved in richness as it warmed. Wheaty body with a mild spice note. Smooth as ice going down.
Bottle from Lidl, Velez Malaga.  I do like Franziskaner standard Hefe-Weissbier but this dunkel takes it to the next level.  Typical German wheat beer taste with a sweet kick.  Good stuff.

16.9 oz. bottle poured into a weizen glass. Its a dark, cloudy beer with a tall, everlasting head. Aroma has what Id expect: banana and clove, some wheaty notes. No distinct roast or caramel stuff in the nose from the dark malts. The caramel is noticeable in the flavor. Banana sweetness and clove spices are in check and tasteful. Its a pretty darn good brew, but not as well refined as a Weihenstephaner. Still, Id drink this and enjoy it anytime.
Sampled on tap at SIB. Pours a cloudy brown/orange with white lacing. Aroma of wheat, yeast and orange peel. Flavour of wheat, toasted malts, caramel and dark fruits. Medium bodied. Pleasant.

(Bottled).   Half of the glass finished and its a decent dark wheat ,but mild for my  palate requirements these days .   Dark malt flavours showcased with roasty bitterness ,and tart apple like acidity .  , Im 99 % sure ill never drink this again & could care less., maybe not the best endorsement ,  but  so ?
Dark muddy water appearance with a large white head. Wheaty, yeasty nose. Wheaty slightly earthy taste with a hint of orange. A reasonable weissbier, a little tinny in taste.
Good but maybe a little bit boring dark white beer. Nice hint of banana in taste.

Dark brown with an off-white head. Body is just a bit thin, but it does make it easily drinkable. Bread, French cheese, resin and hay. Okay but quite mild; would have liked a more fruity or spicy aroma. Taste is similarly unimpressive but decent enough. Aftertaste bring a nice yeasty dryness. Pleasant drink. (50cl bottle)

Sampled on tap at SIB, pours murky reddish brown. Aroma is very subtle - light toasted malts, nuts, subtle dark fruits and caramel. Flavour of toasted caramel, nuts, and light toasted malt, with a slight fruitiness on the finish. Solid.

1 pt .9 oz bottle into an Allagash chalice. Pours cloudy amber with a nice-sized light beige head with excellent retention. First aroma hitting the senses is clove, followed by banana, bubblegum, grain--all the classics for this style duly accounted for. Taste is sweet and slightly meaty. I detect a bit of age. Been sitting in some assholes warehouse for too long, I suspect. (:0). Carbonation is high and the body is medium. Despite the fact that its past its prime, Im happy to say its a good beer regardless. I know this is an even better beer when fresh, though.

0.5L bottle. Hazy brown, tanned white head. Nose of banana and fruits. Aroma of wheat banana, yeast, spicy bread, citrus. Some roasted malts, not big difference with regular weizen. Tastes sweet, low bitterness, high carbonation. Crisp, maybe a little harsh, light body, short finish.

Wunderschöne rot-braune Farbe, fast undurchsichtig. Bananig-hefige Geruchseindrücke. Im Mundraum fruchtig (bananig) hefig vorherrschend. Im Abgang malziger. 
Prima dunkles Hefeweizen mit guter Süffigkeit und schönem Geschmack. Empfehlenswert.Test vom 4.3.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Cloudy brown/cider color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, caramel malt, cloves, & spice; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, caramel, citrus, and some fruit; Nicely balanced; Overall, solid dunkelweizen.

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy brown with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, banana. Taste is malt, caramel, nut, fruit, banana, cloves, light lemon tartness in the finish. Medium body, lively carbonation. Good summer beer. 210611

Color is mat brown - very cloudy. For me the taste leaves a little something, kind of non-descript and a bit flat. There is definitely banana (maybe even banana bread) and clove but not much else. Very drinkable, but sadly also a little forgettable.

Recht mild ist auch dieses Franziskaner-Bier, soll aber keinesfalls heißen, es sei schlecht. Leicht fruchtig ist das Bier im Antrunk und Mittelteil, und ziemlich hopfig. Im Mittelteil recht würzig, das Bier wirkt recht vollmundig. Im Nachgeschmack kommen dann die typischen Aromen eines Dunklen hervor, wenn auch nicht sehr ausgeprägt. So lässt sich hinter der mittleren Fruchtigkeit auch eindeutig ein Malzton bestimmen. 	 
Test vom 30.12.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,12,14,13,10,12 - 12,45

Bottle @ Hästöskatan, Kronoby
A hazy brown beer, with a beige head, which last almost throughout the whole beer. 
Aroma is slightly complex with fresh wheats and roasted malts, a little citrus.Taste is quite equal to aroma. 
nice bottle and NICE beer! recommended!

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours dark caramel to red with a 1 finger head with so so lacing, aroma is all bananas, yeast, some pepper, appealing. The taste has a more roasted caramel flavor, but the bananas do begin to dominate, but I am not complaining, wonderfully drinkable and complex, very creamy. Body is full, carbonation is high, finish is long. I like the original, although I do think there are better examples of that style (Weihenstephaner, Ayinger Bräu-Weisse), this I like better. Great beer!
A dark brown color funnel with a sweet almost fruity aroma. A pretty decent drink overall.

Bottle from somewhere in GrazOff white medium sized head that went away at a medium pace. Dark bronze-brown misty body. Dusty cloves in the nose, sweetish and lactic/creamy, slightly sharp & spicy. Light slightly creamy acidic (in a herbal way) & banana taste. Vaguely creamy, but finishing a bit dry and herbal/vaguely hoppy. Some sips brought Twix-like choco-caramel notes. Later on it seems to boil down to that, and I dont mind, the nose took a slightly metallic note, but hey, the taste improved. The pale Franziskaner is the beer that brought me into this. Though messy at first, this is definitely very drinkable stuff. The pale Franziskaner is what got me rating at first. As expected, I dont nearly like this one now as I liked that one then, but its a solid Dunkelweizen that I wouldnt mind having again.

From 0.5l bottle. Cloudy brown body with an off-white rocky head. bread, roasty, banana, dough aromas.medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. medium body, creamy, lively, long finish. Wonderful dunkelweizen in line with the tradition of Franziskaner.

Bottle (500ml) - Sampled this one whilst in Munich. Its a dark reddish brown colour with a light brownish head that has good retention, leaving good lacing.

Smells of clove and mild spice flavours upfront along with the faintest of coriander in the blend. A rich dark fruit and a pleasant banana aroma.
 
A large banana and wheat presence in the taste along with a little clove & spice. In addition to this there is a good combination of toffee and chocolate.
 
Light to medium bodied and silky smooth. It was creamy and quite refreshing, truely excellent. A beautiful beer with great drinability. This one smells & tastes great along with looking & feeling outstanding. ***1001 Beers to try before you die:

I didnt review this until a number of years into my project... had a gazillion times, used to pick one of these up and have with a packed sandwich when on the go... your basic German Dunkel.  Mit Weiss!  Appearance is a murky dark, muted brown color... head is fine, off-white.  Looks heavy, malty, and beefy in only the way that the Germans (and Scots) can produce.  The aroma is uneventful, but good for a Weissbier, with hefty malts overpowering the inevitable wheat.  The flavor packs the wheat in, though, with a really soft and silky body of lightly roasted malts, powerful wheat, and an almost caramelized banana and spice finish.  Im probably not giving this beer the fair chance it deserves since my palate has strayed away from appreciating weizens over the years (hence the relatively low grade), but for a weizen/dunkel, its really palatable, unoffensive, easy to throw down, and incredibly decent.  What it takes to be a German beer... easy to drink, but beefy enough to still be called a beer.  I dont always drink weizens, but when I do I drink a dunkel.
Pours dark copper with a beige head. Aroma is light caramel, banana and clove. Flavour is light caramel, light malt acidic, banana and light clove.
bottle. Cloudy pale bronw colour, large off-white head. Aroma: nothing, really. Thin and watery, shy hints of caramel and banana. Boooooring.

Dark very hazy amber, firm off-white head. Aroma of malts, bread and sweet caramel, honey, some banana and clove. Flavour of malts, weizen, banana, cloves, honey, caramel and yeast. Moderately sweet, little hop bitterness. Short finish. Pleasant brew. (From 500mL bottle)
Pours a murky brown color with a thick off white head. The flavor was a mix of banana, wheat, and cloves. Very refreshing and easy to drink.

0,5 l. bottle from the supermarket. Brown, hazy colour with a big off-white head. Typical hefeweissen aromas like banana, dough and yeasts. As the dark colour indicates caramel and chocolate from the roasted malts. Pleasent light sweetness, medium body, slick feel, lively carbonation and a typical shortlived finish. A nice beer at a good price.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2012 Dark amber with a white head. Aroma is yeasty with lots of honey, wheat and banana. Sticky palate, sweet malty and yeasty flavour. (7/5/7/4/17)
Cloudy dark amber body with a white head. Nice aroma with wheat, caramel, banana and some black sugar. Medium, refreshing palate, flavour has banana, wheat and black sugar.

At Zum Franziskaner in München. Poured murky brown in color with tan 
head. Yeast, banana and wheat in aroma. Smooth and well balanced in 
taste. Very pleasant banana and sweet wheat in flavour.

Bottle poured into a weisen glass. Comes out dark amber and very cloudy with sediment. Head is tan and frothy. roasty, earthy, light sweetness, medium body, thin feel, and overall its drinkable and has character.

The authentic German hefeweizen is probably the best beer to drink in the summer, but what about the three other seasons of the year? For spring and fall theres the slightly darker, more robust style known as the dunkelweizen. I havent had much experience with this style and decided to start off with the Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse Dunkel - an authentic German offering of the authentic style. It wasnt quite as impressive as some of the German hefeweizens Ive tried, but it was darn good beer in its own right.I poured a 500ml bottle into a traditional German wheat beer glass.Appearance: Pure brown with slight maroon haze color; very cloudy body although massive carbonation is easily seen. Forms a large, frothy, beige head which retains and laces below expectation. Smell: A subtle, organic, mild aroma of banana bread and apple sauce. Smells genuine, and not like a candle shop like how many beers with added spices to tend to smell. Taste: I dont think Ill ever get sick of drinking real German wheat beers. The first taste of the first swig of Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse Dunkel was so tasty it immediately reminded me of why I love these types of beers. The palate is just like the aroma with a sweet taste of banana bread and applesauce with cinnamon on top. Unlike many other Its not overly-spicy and peppery, but much more subtle than most beers of the sort. The flavors here are milder, but more refined with no harsh edge to them. In fact, the only real flaw with this beer is that it might be just a little too mild as it noticeably weakens and flattens out the more I drink. Mouthfeel: Slightly fizzy and lively at first, but becomes noticeably flatter and thinner once the head dissipates. Not quite light-bodied, but difficult to peg as a proper medium-bodied beer.Drinkability: Almost ridiculous in how smooth this beer goes down. It finishes with a quick burst of bread, fruit and spice, but leaves little to no aftertaste making it very refreshing. "Helles" hefeweizens are the preferred summer brew, but this would perform just as well in warmer weather. The 5% ABV seems a little lower than it performs, though, as it feels like a heavier, stronger brew.Overall, a refreshing and tasty beer to drink in any weather. Not mind-blowing, but a solid performer for sure.
Hazy dark brown with a big and lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is medium sweet. Soft and smooth with a sweet finish. Nice dunkelweizen. 111009
Bottle$ pours a brown ressish amber color. Tastes and smells of banana, bread, and carmel with a toffee sticky aftertaste. Drinks lighter then it looks. Really good

Old rate. Pours a muddy brown with an impressively rocky tan head. Aroma is slightly woodsy with hints of toffee and banana. Taste is sweet malt, toffee apple, banana and a pinch of clovey pepper in the finish. Faintly smoky as it warms. Quality Dunkel.

Bottle - Pours a cloudy ruby/brown with a loose white head.  Massive aroma of tropical fruit and yeasty - my first thought when I smelled it was pineapple turnover we had at school!  Nice flavours, bread, bit of banana and herby, all while being dry up front with a lingering dry finish.
Dark amber, cloudy with a small head. The aroma is malty with bread, yeast . The flavor is similar with a nice balance. Good crisp finish.

Bottle 50 cl. Misty to cloudy pour, brown in color with a large off-white crown. Aroma of yeast, bread and banana with notes of something like flowers. Taste and aftertaste is slightly sweet. A typical Dunkelweizen, without being at the top of the class.

Bottle. Pours mahogany with a large off-white head. Aroma and taste are pretty much like a normal hefeweizen. Perhaps a bit smoother and a slight hint of roastiness in it. Palate is good, very drinkable. Light and refreshing.
Bottle. Pours with typical hefe cloudiness, and very generous head. Fruity aroma, and similar on the palates with bananas and spices to the fore. Very quaffable.
cloudy dark with a big off white head. ok hefe with the usual characteristics. no surprises. not my favourite

Aroma wise its still very much a Hefe but with smoothed out finishes and a bit more complexity. The flavours play out the same way as the bouquet. Familiar hefe tastes but more intermingled and become subtle white creating unique tastes. With that said the regular Franziskaner is still my all time favourite.

Bottle from Sams in Durham.  Pours orange-brown, hazy and with a stable, well-formed head.  Nose of clove, some darker caramels, and banana. Some bready-wheaty notes.  Tastes come through similar, but a bit focused more on the caramel notes and falling off into a bit of wateriness.
50cl. bottle. pours hazy dark amber, big off white head. light aroma, floral yeast. taste is sweet, golden apple and yests. aftertaste also sweet, banana, water. medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel.
Better than their original Hefeweizen, it has a certain richness that the original lacks with some nice roast in addition to the wheaty banana; good Dunkle Weizen.
Bottle: Pours amber with small white head.  Aroma of bread and banana.  Flavor of fizzy banana.  Quite good.

Poured a slightly hazy orange-brown with a large off-white head.  Aroma of bananas and wheat with other fruits and yeast.  Some bread notes as well.  Taste is smooth and sweet with caramel and fruit at first.  The finish is mostly of banana and wheat with some grain notes.  Overall very smooth and drinkable.

Dark cloudy colour with an off white head. Aroma is wheaty with hints of banana. Taste is also sweet with banana, caramel and cloves. Im not usually a fan of dark wheat so I like the understated taste of it to be honest.

A: The beer pours an opaque brown color with a finger and a half of khaki colored head.

S: A nice sweet aroma of banana and wheat bread. Theres a touch of toast and a mild roasted malt note to it as well. A moderate level of clove/spice, and some nice toffee and caramel.

T: Nicely balanced between the sweet bread and banana notes and the hearty spice flavors. A touch of dark fruits, and a little bit of nuttiness. Toasted bread and some nice toffee flavor. Really smooth and slightly creamy.

M: The body is medium with a full carbonation and a slight creaminess on the tongue.

D: For the price of this beer its really tough to beat. A solid dunkelweizen.

Gesztenyemézhez hasonló sötétbarnás szín, kissé piszkosfehér habbal a tetején. Illata inkább banános, mint citrusos, de az élesztő is keményen érződik. Íze kezdetben gyümölcsösen édes, érett banán és búzamaláta, majd betör a citrusos fanyarság, egy kis pikán élesztős fűszerességgel. Közepesen testes, száraz, oltja a szomjat, tehát egy igen korrekt barna búza.

From a 1 pint bottle, beer poured murky dark orange-brown color with a small beige head. Lacing was spotty. The aroma was moderately strong banana and clove. The flavor was tangy, bready and malty with notes of orange and caramel. Thanks AirforceHops for the bottle! Good brew for a Saturday afternoon!

From a 500ml bottle on 6/2/2011. Pours a cloudy amber. The aroma is of banana lolly, carmel malt and a little yeast. The flavour is more of the same with a nice mix of sweet banana and caramel, some spices and citric hops. The only negative is that the carbonation is a touch more than is needed. Still, its a very nice beer.

An amber beer with off-white head.  Sweet and grassy aromas include a light yeasty character with sticky hard candy notes.  Flavors include light banana, clove, hints of cinnamon/spice, with a big malty presence.  Grass pervades too.  Decent carbonation.  Enjoyable, affordable beer.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a medium cloudy brown with light brown highlights (mostly bottom portion).  Big off-white head, thick lacing, good carbonation, and silky mouthfeel.  Taste is roasted bready malt, caramel, banana, and hint of spice.  Darker than most hefeweizen dunkels.
Pours dark caramel with off white head.  Great aroma with a sparkle when it hits your tongue.
A dark-brown pour with an off white head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty with hints of caramel. Flavor is equally yeast with a lingering bitterness. Somewhat medicinal.

I didnt like this one as much as others. I see this taste and character is popular among the hefe-dunkels, although I dont care for this taste much. Teh aroma is weak and I get banana, burlap, malt. Color is 2-tone brown/amber. Taste is malty, wheat, banana bread, murky water. Not the best I would say, dont like it too much. Palate is left with unfavorable remanants

Colore scuro e intenso,non torbido. Schiuma biancastra,cremosa e aderente,spessa tre dita buone e di gran persistenza.Aroma di malto, grano e di banana.Sapore di pane lievitato,banana e spezie.Tutto sommato molto più leggera di quanto mi aspettassi. Ma anche molto rinfrescante.

Poured from bottle, pours a murky brown with a nice foamy head, aroma is sweet and has faint hints of banana and spices, flavor is has a nice wheat backbone that has more and more banana as it sat and warmed up, I really enjoyed this.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2012 Bottle @ home. Brown, hazy appearance with a cream colored and plentiful head. Some dark, roasted malts along with wheat in the nose with a nice banana aroma. Good full dark, roasted wheat flavor with banana and clove flavors. Sweet and full, dark wheat body. Creamy, velvety mouth feel.Very good and simple Dunkelweizen. I wish more American brewers could make a Dunkelweizen like this. Fuck yeah.

Let me start out by saying im not a fan of wheat beers. But I had this at an event at Hop Angel in Philly and i enjoyed it. It was on tap and poured a brown, cloudy, color with a white foam, about a 1/2 inch thick that went away after awhile. The  aroma was a little sour the taste was medium sourness, and the finish was where the wheat came out in it and it lingered in your mouth. My rating might not be fair because like i said im not a fan of Wheat Beers.
Colore rossiccio-ambrato con buona schiuma. Aroma di frutta ( banana), e lieviti. In bocca è il malto di frumento a farla da padrone.

50cl bottle from a local supermarket. It pours a hazy brown-red dense liquid with high beige head that kind of lasts throughout the beer. Its aroma is complex, with yeast, fresh wheats and roasted malts, a little citron from the hops, and a nice ripe banana hint too. It tastes accordingly, with more banana in the mouth than in the nose. It is a little lower than average in carbonation, full bodied, creamy and kind of sweet; it has a long and gentle bitter finish from the hops. Very nice white, with the addition of malts for a different and complex brew. Much better than other dunkels. Nice presentation, with the classical monk icon and a slender bottle; its a pitty that the crowncap is plain.

At Löwenbräu keller, Munich.
Red-brown color with a semi lasting beige foam. Phenole aroma with a tuch of bananas. The bananas are more pronounced in the taste toghether with much wheat maltiness. Some malty sweetness and a tiny hop bitterness. Rather big body.
21st November 2006  Warning! Early amateur rating! Refreshing darker wheat beer. Normal wheat beer fruit tones balanced by chocolate and malt. Nice.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2010 The aroma is sweet and bready yeast in the nose with beautiful banana notes as it warms up, so delicious and much more than expected. It pours murky caramel brown with a nice creamy head.The flavors of sweet bready yeast with pure malt flavors lay on top of a delicous thick body. This is delicious, so much better than I remembered, and the flavors of banana settle in an awesome way on the palate.
Dark roasty beer, it has a very full-taste not unlike banana bread. I thought it was a bit heavy, but overall very good.
Pours a yeasty cloudy chestnut brown. Aroma is yeast and banana. Flavor is straight forward - toasted malt, banana, and bready yeast. Slight clove notes on the finish. Nice creamy mouth feel.

Murkey pale brown.  Banana, clove and allspice dominate the nose with some sweet roasted malt, maple syrup and a hint of ripe red fruit.  Medium bodied fluffy mouthfeel.  The banana comes through and acompanies the caramel malt and bready flavors.  Just a wonderful session beer, complex and refreshing.

pours a cloudy caramel with a full head - head dissolves to edges in a short time. Mostly sweet, but not a lot of discernable flavors.  Edge is produced primarily by carbonation.  The finish lingers with a trace of ahcohol at the end.  A solid brew, but nothing above all the other solid brews.
Had this at Hemingways, Tampere. Aroma of smoked ham and fruit. Flavour is more smoked ham fruit and wheat. Hazy and brown.

Rating #465, bottle at free beertasting at Hatten Bar  

Red-brown opaque beer with a low, dense, head. Very nice first impression. Aroma is quite simple; banana and yeast, but very obvious, fruity and nice. Flavor is much banana, wheat, dark and light malts, and only subdued bitterness. Medium thickness, easily creamy. One of the better dunkelweizen.

Pours chesnut brown with huge head leaving some lacing. Aroma of yeast, wheat, roasted cereal, banana and some notes of vanilla. Nice acidy crisp mouthfeel. Not too heavy body, lean flavor of yeast, wheaty, hops and bananas. Lean acidy palate with banana touch. Finishes dry hoppy with notes of yeast.

Cloudy light brown, off-white head. Sweet malty aroma, notes of bananas, apples, cookies. Smooth mouthfeel, subtle carbonation. Malty, bready taste, with sweet creamy fruits. In spite of the sweetness its quite refreshing. Good brew.

Pours pale brown with a beige creamy head. Aroma of malts and fruity notes, spices as well. Malty taste, with some roastiness, hint of caramel. Light sweetness, very drinkable.light body, thick feel, average carbonation and a short finish. Ok.
Bottle. Chestnut brown with a full off white head. Aroma of soft fruit. Banana and fruit flavour with a creamy short finish
tap at fids.   aroma of sweet, candied dough and banana cream pie.   taste is dry luscious sweet doughy bready malts with a light creamy banana backing.  nice beer.

Full, large white head, shrinks into a creamy foam at the top of a cloudy amber drink. Spicy and malty smell. Clove, wheat, bananas, maybe some toastiness.  Typical hefeweizen taste, with added bananas and other dark fruits. Much lighter taste than I expected.  Very refreshing.

Bottle poured in mug. Dark amber brown with a phenomenal head. The head was very large, very creamy, and so much retention that it was like a solid object. The aroma was a musty yeasty smell with some banana. The taste was sweet, and a tad malty with a short finish. Medium body with some slickness to it. also, sometimes I had some astringent feelings in the finish that I felt was kind of metallic. In Sum, I thought the aroma wasnt too pleasing but the beer tasted pretty good and it was easy to drink although the aftertaste bothered me a little.

Bottle pours dark amber/brown with thick creamy off white head. Aroma is heavy on the spice and banana. Taste is very sweet, banana, clove, coriander, bubble gum, coppery aftertaste. Not bad but not my thing.

Pours hazy dark brown with a towering white head.
Nose shows ripe banana, malt (as in malted milk), soft phenols with some clove characters and lots of doughy wheat.
Flavours are very similar but seem to add a hint of cinnamon and show less of the malt and banana. Very short finish, no bitterness.
Carbonation is a little too high for my liking.
Overall, pretty much youre bog-standard dunkelweiss. Nice and easy to drink.

Aroma is mild, roasty, banana, bread. Appearance is dark orange brown. Medium head. Taste is very mild roastiness, chocolate, banana, wheat, bread, maltyness. Palate is medium or less. Crisp. Overall ok. Not my favorite style. Flavors are all nice, probably a very good example, but I always find myself wanting more with this style.

Bottle poured to my usual sampler-1/2 pint glass, with a brownish amber hue, creamy, light tan head foam, and waves & spots of lacing. The aroma started with a little breadiness, light grain, banana, clove, and some caramel. The flavor continued these, adding some low, hop bitterness, medium carbonation, in a medium body. Nicely drinkable!

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 6.1.2010.
Pours a deep brown colour with a large, beige and foamy head. Aroma of caramel and roasted malts. Similar elements on the taste with wheat and banana notes. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. A bit watery mouthfeel. Easy to drink.
Dark brown with a beige head. Spices, fruit, some banana, wheat as expected, some caramel and roasted malts.

Surprise gift from my wife. Hazy amber color with a nice foamy off white head. Aroma is weat, yeast and herbs with a touch of that darker malt. Flavor is weat and yeast with cloves and some malty sweetness.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2011 Cloudy amber colour.Large creamy head.Has a non-overwhelming sweetness combiined with some acidity. Taste banana, bubblegum, wheat,some caramell and fruits.Very good drinkability.Smooth feeling.
Draft. Yeasty musty nose. Taste is very wheaty a slight bit of chocolate. Body is fairly thin and fluffy. Overall not bad.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: 0.5L bottle. Dark brown pour with almost no head. Mild carbonation brings a sour smell to the surface - which I find somewhat pleasant. The flavor is a mixture of wheat and sour overtones - not much caramel in the mix. The aftertaste is pleasent - subtle notes of sour that does not offend in the least. A nice variation on the basic Hefe.

Bottle, poured German style.  Massive foamy head, ivory and creamy with yeast sediment mixed in.  Whopping banana and clove and sugary malt aroma.  Pours a cloudy muddy brownish.  Medium bodied with ample carb, stays effervescent.  Flavors dominated by wheat and chocolate malts,  light spicy, earthy, peppery hop bitterness.  Should be considered for session beer status for Weizen enthusiasts.
pours dark brown with a creamy off white head.  nice aroma of banana with some plum and brown sugar.  taste is sticky with clove and banana.  nice creamy texture.  finishes light.
A really smooth beer. Dark, fruity, simply smoth. One of the bests of his kind.
Bottle, Brownish colour, small head, taste like a weizen blonde one, maybe somewhat sweeter, with hints of banana, but less than the blonde one. Full bodied with some carbonation.

A murky medium dark brown beer with medium body. A fruity spice aroma. The taste has strong presence of ripe pears and some cloves with malts. Not overly bitter, but hop character suggests quality hops. A smooth drinkable finish but with a bit of the wheat funk I dont like. This was on tap.
500mL Bottle -- Pours a dark mahogany with a medium beige tinted head.  Aromas of honey, caramel, tootsie roll, butter, and apple.  Even with the darker flavors the beer remains light and refreshing.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 Unfortunately not as good as their non-dunkel variety. Perfectly fine but maybe not the character of some other examples. Serving: Bottle and Tap
Bottle pours a deep brown/red beer with a tall foamy white head. Scent of wheat and bread. Taste is light and not in a good way. Watery

On tap, at sunset grill, beer poured murky dark orange-brown color with a small beige head. The aroma was moderately strong banana and clove. The flavor was bitter, tangy, bready and malty with notes of orange, pepper and caramel. Great brew!
UPDATED: OCT 11, 2010 I love the dunkel beers but this one was my first dunkelweizen.Very tempting aroma,nice appearance and leaves you quite full after ddrinking it.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2014 Bottle. Murky brown body, medium head. Yeasty aroma with lots of coriander and banana. Smooth yeasty/fruity taste with some hints of toast. The taste is similar to the lighter Franziskaner, even though this one is quite a bit darker. This beer is great too but I prefer the spiciness of "Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier" over the malty accents of this one.

pours a deep cloudy brown, nice lasting tan head, sweet yeasty aroma, watery smooth drink, nothing jumps out taste wise, soft wheat taste. eye catching bottle but noth9ng jumps out at you taste wise, very soft smooth finish.

Bottled pour.  A one inch bubbly head thinned out pretty quickly without a trace of lacing.  The color is a mid to dark hazy brown.  Aroma is mostly bananas with a bit of malt, yeast, and spice.  The flavor is malt and spice, but pretty thin, lacking complexity and body.  Overall a good brew, but I was hoping for more from it.  Tis the burden of high expectations, I guess.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté chez Das Bierhaus (Burlington, VT). Arôme: Odeur de céréales et de bananes avec une pointe de vanille. Apparence: La couleur est brune opaque. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe de bananes et de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de banane en arrière goût. (Rating #3144)

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2014 Bottle. (August 17, 2010) Pours semi-clear, brown with a medium, off-white head. Aroma holds yeast, wheat and some dark malts. Flavor is fairly sweet with some nice malt tones and caramel. Light bodied with average carbonation. Finishes sweet and clean. Not bad. (3.4)Draft at Zum Franziskaner - Munich. (January 2014) OK stuff. Some lightly toasted wheat, faint toffee. Light bodied with average carbonation and creamy texture. Very basic but tasty enough. (3.3)

500 ML bottle in Germany. looks good in its dark Weizen form. Murky brown with lost of yeasty parts. Aroma is of dark rosted bananas. Taste is slightly bitter and burnt but good. Palate is bananas and sour mash. Not bad but not a great one either.

2010-07-04. Murky brown body, small beige head, and light lacing. 3+ Flavour is mild, pleasant sweet malt, mild estery character and very light wheat notes. 6+ Wheaty aroma over caramel and muted esters. 6+ Thin palate is a bit watery. Disappointing. Shows potential but lacks depth. On tap at Seattle International Beer Festival
