Bottle. The aroma is fruity, bananas and vanilla, also some yeast. The head is large, creamy and light beige with a long duration. The body is dark brown. The taste is light, bananas and vanilla and yeast. The body is light, creamy and with a lot of carbonation.

On tap at the Porter--Cloudy, dark brown with an orange tint and fine-grained off-white lacing. Medium aromas of coffee, orange and pumpkin. Palate is medium-bodied, smooth and balanced though a touch on the sweet side. More coffee, nuts and pumpkin on flavor profile. Medium-long finish. Really Good.
Very tasy dunkle; pours with heavy but rich head; settles quickly; smooth straightforward character refreshing and good!
50 cl bottle. Hazy amber/brown with lasting medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, wheat, caramel, yeast and banana.
At the risk of sounding tired, it is exactly what it says on the tin. Copper/amber color, some lightly roasted malts. Rather thin. Decent, but not something I would seek out.

Pours reddish black with thick beige head and foamy lacing.  Notes of wheat, citrus and corriander typical of this style evident; maltiness not so much.  Taste is refelective of aroma; additional maltiness not evident as expected for a dunkelweizen.  Smooth with a medium finish.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2010 Not as good as the non-dunkel variety, but still a good beer at a good price thats palatable even to my non-beer drinking wife
Bottle at NB-ølsymposium. Cloudy red/brown - offwhite head. Fruity, perfumed, banana, soapy, caramel, light dark bread, light roasted notes, wheaty. Plain.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy, orange-brown with a one finger tan head.  Sweet fruity nose.  Flavor is sweet, sticky banana with some citrus and a bit of caramel malt, finishing with a little bitterness and alcohol warmth.  Quite good and refreshing on a summer evening.

Medium beige head. Hazy opaque brown body with carbonation. Wheaty yoghurty aroma is kind of anonymous. Dry, and faintly acidic, sweetish perfumy banana yoghurty taste. Mid-bodied. Mild, faintly fizzy mouthfeel. Dryish wheaty faintly roasty caramel aftertaste. Nice, drinkable, unremarkable. (0.5l bottle, El Mariachi, Bremen.)

[3110-20100704] Sample. Dandelion goop malt aroma. Murky, dark amber body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head. Rough grains malt and noticeable alcohol in the flavour with a light candied aftertaste. Full body. Fine.
(@ SIB 2010, Seattle, WA)
Pt. to weissbier.   Pours dark amber with thick massive off-white head.  Aromas of cloves, citrus, grass and grain.  A little thin in the mouth.  Sweet finish.
fruity, raisin aroma. Pours a muddy reddish brown with tan head. Sweet, raisins again and some sourness. Palate is thin. Quite a bit of carbonation.

Pours medium brown with a big, fine-textured light brown head with some serious lingering power. Nose is bananas and brown sugar, with a little oak and yeast. The taste is very wheat bready with a little orange, banana, caramel, and brown sugar. Virtually no hops- bittering or floral- to speak of. The finish almost seems to have a touch of dark chocolate. Its a very "warm" beer...I poured it near ice cold but it never felt cold the whole time I was drinking. This is definately an interesting and drinkable beer, albiet not life changing.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2010 Dark amber with generous head. Aroma sour fruit and yeast. Taste sweet and some sourness from yeast. Medium body, text smooth. Finish some sourness.
Very yeasty smell, bready.  Sweet, light hops.  Thin mouthfeel, but not watery.

Tasted 7/5/10.  500ml bottle.  Peeling away the foil top, the cap had a little external oxidation.  Not the beer, mind you, but the bottle cap itself.  Initially, it smells alright.  Here goes.  First half pour is very heady with a relatively clear brownish amber hue.  Multiple fingers of off-white head.  Aromas of bananas and citrus.  Caramel and toast.  Mild clove and orange rind.  Medium bodied with a sticky and lingering body.  Flavors of citrus and bananas.  Tart berries and slightly sour.  Second and final pour was activated and produced a substantially more sedimented product.  Brown and brakishly opaque.  Similar three fingers of dense off-white head.  The aromas are similar with just a touch more emphasis on the toasty malts and slight caramel sweetness.  Lingering finish that has a mix of zesty citrus effervescence and a trace bitter fruit flavor.  Still a good body.  Prime example of the style.

From a pint bottle into a pilsner glass.  Pours with a lot of fluffy head but not much lacing.  Brownish copper color.  Aroma of cloves, banana and yeast.  Mouthfeel is moderate but bolstered by the yeast.  Taste is of berries, banana, yeast, wine funk and hay.  Very good dunkel.  I love a good hefe but havent tried many dunkels for some reason.  Ill have to start.

Bottle in Spain. Hazy dirty brown pour with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is spicy with some banana, alcohol, clove and some soap. Flavor is slightly sweet, spicy and a bit bitter. Slightly messy. Lively carbonation and a creamy texture. Decent brew.

Bottle from "Sörspecialista", Budapest.
Hazy, mahogany coloured brew with a creamy, pale brown head, carbonation seems lively.
Banana-fruity, spicy, light toffee nose.
It starts crisp, flavours of banana and toffee.
The middle brings a mix of caramell malt, cloves, citrus hops and wheat aromas along.
The finish is spicy, citric and dry, which drains the palate.
Nice and very enjoyable one.
Nice light brown hazy color with a short lived head. Great sweet wheat aroma. Delicious sweet dunkel taste.

A hazy amber colored beer, with a thick foamy light beige head. The aroma of fruits like bananas with some caramel sweet. The taste is sweet with some bitter, fruity with caramel. The aftertaste is sweet with some bitter.
Cloudy medium brown color with a white head.  Aroma of wheat, spice, and roasted malt.  Flavor has banana, bubble gum, wheat, and spice. Lacks some depth, but still a good summer brew.
Trovata al magazzino Metro in cassa da 10 bottiglie. Come la sua cugina chiara è frumentosa, opaca e bananosa, ma con un color mogano scuro e una schiuma beige bella densa. Buona

Franziskaners Hefe-Dunkel pours a deep, dark, hazy brown with a tan foam.  The aroma consists of bread, roasty chocolate, and sweet bananas.  The taste is both medium in sweetness and sourness with a slight bitterness.  The palate is medium bodied with a creamy texture, soft carbonation, and a long smooth finish.  Overall, Franziskaners Hefe-Dunkel was drinkable and enjoyable, as well as my first taste of the Dunkelweizen style.
Bottle. Aroma of wheat malt, yeast and flowers. Dark amber colour with large beige head. Flavour of wheat malt, yeast and caramel and some slight bitterness in the end.

Pours a cloudy, orange tinged brown, slight head that dissipated quickly.  Smells of bread, apple, earth, clove, and chocolate.  The flavor begins with a bright acidic/citrus effect followed by light bitterness, grain, slight chocolate/banana with a somewhat sour and salty ending.  It has a light body, creamy and slick texture, lively carbonation, and an abrupt, tart finish.  Very nice for a change, but not my preferred style.
Bottled. A hazy brown beer with a beige head. Aroma is wheat and banana, notes of yeast. Taste is roasted wheat and yeast. Sweet but refreshing.
Nice muddy brown pour in the glass. Creamy head. Taste and aroma of caramel, fruits, malts, cereal and dough. Rated 11/23/2000

Pours a cloudy, rusty reddish brown with a moderate sized fluffy white head that lasts forever.  Aroma of cloves, grass, wheat, pear, banana (not overly so), smoke, and caramel.  Flavor follows suit with a dry mix of caramel malt, earth, grass, cloves, pepper, banana and a light smoke (or some dry sensation).  Finishes pretty clean with only a little pear, caramel and earth lingering.  No bitterness.  Pretty light bodied, high carbonation and a fluffy mouthfeel.  I think its great.

Colore marrone ambrato, schiuma biancastra, aroma di frumento, banana. Al palato e di vivace frizzantezza con sapore di frutta secca, banana, caramello e leggermente di cioccolato. Finale abbastanza secco. Discreta dunkel.

Bottle. Cloudy brown color with an off-white head. Aroma: Malt, a bit roasted, banana, light clove, light sourness. Flavor: Lightly roasted/toasted malt, banana, caramel, light clove, light wheat. Dry and a bit earthy finish. A rather discrete dunkel weissen, but not bad.

500mL bottle.  Pours hazy amber-brown with a thick off-white head that settles down somewhat.  Yeasty, estery (particularly banana) aroma with some volatiles and a little toast.  The flavour is yeasty and mildly sweet but with nothing to balance it.  Average carbonation, medium bodied, creamy with a yeasty finish.

Draft at Mecklenburg Gardens in Cincinnati.  Pours a dark, hazy brown color with a small tan head.  Aroma of nuts, chocolate, roasted malts, banana, caramel malts, and pit fruits.  Taste of biscuity German malts, toasted nuts, brown sugar, banana bread, overripe fruits, and yeast.  Light-medium bodied, with low carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel.  This one exceeded my expectations, a really nice dunkelweizen.
33 cl bottle.Flavour and aroma are very sweet and malty. The head is huge and lasting. Not bad
caramel, bread, sweet,amber, hazy,hell brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish. nice beer.

Draft @ Bavariahaus, KL. Opaque with rising bubbles on the bottom only, unique. Dark orange-tinged brown with tan head, thick and stable. Smells fresh, fruity, yeasty with mild chocolate in background, nuts, carrot cake. Palate a tad thin but quaffable and good. Flavors are nice with bready malts. Unexpectedly bright and not overpowered by yeast. Nice clean bready dry finish. Light palate, highly carbonated and a little gassy. Like it much better than the hell. Had 3 in a row...but Im in KL so it all takes friggen awesome right now.

Spaten Franziskaner Brau Munchen--Hefe Weisse Dunkel--1998 16.9 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (3.25 / 5.0)  Cloudy dull brown color.  Rich lacy head.  Light german yeast flavor further mellowed by richly textured flavorful malty wheat body.  Nice pellicle.  Finishes dry with a slightly sour citrus note.  Sampled 3/28/1999.
Pours hazy copper with a decent beige head and a slightly sour toffee aroma. There is a tasty roasted malt flavor that a just a little too thin.
Bottle. Pours a dark beer with a small white head. Taste of caramel and bread. Good beer.

Pours to a medium head of modest thickness, but not so thick you can spoon it off. Has a fruity aroma that really expands on your palate. Goes down smooth with no bitterness of aftertaste. Not a bad beer at all.

Bottle Pours out a brown with some red highs topped with a tall off white cream head. Aroam was nice a mellow banana and some light spice. Taste was a little more of the banana notes and a touch of bitterness. I think this bottle was a little over the hill.

Draught at j Clyde. Cloudy and tea colored with a medium white head and little lacing. Aromas of lemon and wheat. The taste is the same with medium maltiness. Good carbonation but rather thin mouthfeel.

The Franziscaner Dunkel Weizen pours into the tall glass in typical cloudy weizen style, topping off with an off-white dense head.   Aroma is heavy on the banana, a bit spicy cloves and faint caramel.  Slightly creamy texture with a slight bit of carbonation.  Thin to medium overall. Dry finish
Dark pour from bottle.  Color reminds me of real apple cider.  Fruity nose, with bananas dominating.  Smooth, malty taste with a creamy mouthfeel.  An excellent hefe, near the top of the class!!

This was a good one, pours dark brown, almost black, into pint glass. Small off-white head that dissolves quickly. Aromas of oranges/bananas/caramel and a hint of chocolate on the nose. The taste is pretty much the same, but the chocolate is even more noticeable. Very unique brew, very enjoyable. Will order again.
17 ounce bottle A murky brown pour -3 finger head-taste of caramel, roasty, dough, .Finishes smooth- A good beer.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2010 Bottle 500 ml.Dark brown-red color with medium creamy head. Aroma caramel, roast, wheat.Taste caramel, wheat, orange, spicy. Thin Body, dry finish.
New try this time i find it better.

pours a hazy red-orange with a nice creamy off-white head. Looks awesome. Highly carbonated. Smell is heavy on banana, some cherry, caramel, bread. Light to medium body,overly carbonated, kinda vinegary feel. Taste of bread, fruit, banana. A bit too sour for me, but not terrible.

1st beer of this style.  61 of 72 styles covered.  Orange brown with a super head.  Dense, creamy, off white, and long lasting.  Nose is banana and clove.  Malty sweet and yeasty.  Taste is a moment of sweet, then quickly taken over by a round banana tartness.  Then a light maltiness.  Lots of movement from this brew.  Nutty bananas at the end.  Not my fave style, but definitely a drinkable brew.

1pt.9oz bottle.  Dark brown pour with an orange tint and lots of tiny carbonation.  Thin light tan head.  Faint caramel, cherry and bread aroma.  Texture is tight prickly carbonation - but also creamy.  Thin to medium overall.  Taste is roasted wheat malts, spices, yeast and some citrus (maybe?).  Finishes still tingly with a metallic vibe.

Bottle Pours a deep cloudy reddish mahogany with a small off white head. Aroma is heavy on the banana, a bit spicy cloves, some citric fruitiness and some holiday spices, nutmeg or cinnamon I picked up. Sort of a fruit bread nose. Flavor starts with some dark fruits, a bit of raisin and a bit heavy on the fruity side, not a whole lot else, a tiny bit of spice. A bit gummy towards the finish, but heavily sweet. Medium body and a sharp carbonation.
i really liked the flavor of this beer. tan head with a brown mid tint

The Franziscaner Dunkel Weizen pours into the tall glass in typical cloudy weizen style, topping off with an off-white dense head. It smells of freshly baked buns and dark malts. The tastes gives me bread, malts and notes of fig or plumes, cant make up my mind here. Really nice and very drinkable, among the top of the line of dunkel weizen.
Certainly my favorate German Weissbier. I always make sure to buy a case when I am in Germany.

Bottle 50 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH).
Hazy brown, fine beige foam. Aroma of roasted malt and caramel, we feel the fruit of the wheat. Light, onctuous, it is malty, spicy (clove?), banana. We enjoy the yeast. In the final, mixture of caramel, more dryness, wheat, thirst-quenching and easily digestible.

Something about that monk on the label of the bottle always makes me want to buy this one. I have had it at Clarks ale house every winter for the last 4 years or so. So how is it out of a bottle...? 

It has a wonderful thick and cloudy light reddish brown. Massive cloudy head; its actually a cloudy hef but with the tint turned up from yellow to yellowish-brown. Soooo cloudy! 

Delicious fruity/wheaty smell; nice combo of both. Slightly spicy. Sour, with the volume turned up. Wheaty with a hint of spicy orange. 

Deep, dark wheat flavor, with that subtle hint of orange. No malt or hop whatsoever; its all dark wheat. Pungent in its slight sourness. Puckery sour. 

Thick like orange juice. Nice bite. Quite dry. A really full beverage. Its a wonderful, hefty drink. A thick sippin beer. Excellent excellent.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2010 On top at the Glockenspiel in Saint Paul, MN. Pours a cloudy, dark amber brown. Quite opaque due to the yeast. Decent head and lacing. Subtle citrus and coriander aroma. Lots of orange peel, coriander, and yeast flavors. Surprisingly, the alcohol is detectable in quick traces, which is bizarre considering its only 5.5% ABV. Quite pleasant on the palate. Not bad at all -- Im not a big wheat beer fan, but I liked this one.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2013 Bottle from Dettorimark cons 2013-08-04 La Saline
New rating 3,2 - new average 3,2+4,3=7,5/2= 3,75

Provdatum: 2009-05-25, flaska Göteborg 
UTS: molnig, mörk siraps färgad/vanilj färgat hög fin krona
Oändlig hållbarhet.
D: jäst, druvmäsk
S: Muscavado socker (mörk), jäst ,svarta vinbär
ES: mild tingel av ovanstående - lite kort 
Anteckningar:

16oz bottle. Didnt get much head this time. Thin, carbonated, some yeast sediment. Smells... like a dunkel. Flavor: cola. straight up coca cola. Finish is cola too. I guess thats why Germans like to mix this with cola. Fine beer, nothing special
Tap. Very nice session beer. Aromas of cola, caramel, and grain. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness. Palate is oily, with a thin-to-medium body. Light brown, with a big and frothy white head.
Bottle. Pours a hazy brown with a fluffy white head. Aromas of yeast, banana and clove. Mild flavours of sweet malt, caramelized banana and some wheat. Enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy hazelnut brown with heaps of yeast sediment, Medium rocky head. Typical weiss aromas of banana and clove mixed with toasted hazelnuts. Flavours are quite restrained with some malt sweetness and a little toast. Mouthfeel is quite thin.

Pours brown with large beige head; sweet banana chocolate aroma with slight roasted, woody notes; body slips on the thin side, but the carbonation is pleasant and it´s greatly refreshing; flavor is also led by banana along with some doughy yeastiness to slighty spicy, dry finish.
50 cl bottle, Fargo, ND, USA. Hazy iced tea colour, thin even head. Banana and hazelnut aroma, carbonated with mild flavor, balanced spiced with a dry finish.

500ml bottle.
Hazy brown body, big beige foam hangs around.
Nice aroma of candy banana, caramel, nuts, cocoa, dried fruit and cereals.
Creamy texture, lively carbonation, decent full body with husky wheat dryness.
Flavour is a bit subdued on the body; light roasted nuttiness, caramalised banana, sultana and dried fruit, and clove spice. Very dry finish, low bitterness yet not all that sweet.
Tasty dark wheat beer.

500ml bottle. Pours like a muddy puddle. Beige head fades to a cm or so. Smells a little of yeast, a little more of roasted malt. Some spicy/ sour funk too. Velvet mouthfeel at first, but starts to taste a little watery after a bit. Some fruit sweetness and bread with a modest sour and spice finish. A good example of the style.

500ml bottle. Pours red-brown color with little white head. Aroma and taste of caramel malt fruits. Specialy banana is noticeable. Plenty carbonation, almost fuzzy. Mild bitterness and short aftertaste.

Pours cloudy with a deep reddish brown color and a big fluffy head that shrinks but never goes away completely. The aroma isnt quite as strong as the regular non-Dunkel style from Franziskaner. But there is some clove some cinnamon and some apple. The flavor has lots of red apple and some spice with some caramel and banana.
Bottle. Not as complex as the regular Hefe. This one is kind of lame, although well balanced and refreshing.

Bottle, purchased at Bottle Barn. Pours a deep mahogany / caramel color; fluffy light tan head with good retention and lacing; great looking pour, though it could have retained its head better. Medium-to-high amounts of clove and banana in the aroma, along with light caramel and seemingly overripe fruit character; moderately sweet without any stickiness. Medium mouthfeel: creamy texture, lots of flavor here without much heaviness; clove and banana, certainly, along with some caramel and hints of wheatiness; nicely textured, no roast and minimal hop character apparent, this is a tasty dunkel that errs on the side of the slightly bland and a touch overly sweet; otherwise a great example of a style that tends, in my mind, to be slightly lackluster compared to the standard hefeweizen offering. Medium finish, showing light wheaty graininess, some lingering malt sweetness, and a pleasantly dry ending.
Bottle. Pour was medium brown with a malty roasted aroma. Flavor was mostly malty with a slight floral and fruity character. Fine beer, but could have been more over the top fruity.

Birra ambrata torbida, con una bella schiuma beige, cremosa e duratura, al naso i lieviti la fanno da padroni, colpiscono immediatamente, poi però si equilibrano bene con i classici toni fruttati delle birre di frumento.  Equilibrio che trovo interessante soprattutto al palato dove il dolce del malto si sposa molto bene con le note di frutta e spezie.

Poured on tap with a tall, full white head. Aroma of banana & clove with malty, toasty notes. Smooth, medium bodied wheat malt flavor with a background of banana & clove with some slight caramel. Long smooth finish.

A dark amber pour with a big, frothy head.  It has sweet smelling aroma with apple, wheat, caramel notes.  This brew is full bodied with lively carbonation.  The taste is generally sweet throughout and finishes with a velvety smoothness.

A very nice Dunkelweizen.  Nice yeast tste, with dark roasted malt.  Very lightly hopped.  Excellent head retention.  This is a great summer brew.  Ive had it on tap in the US and Germany.  US is a bit more metallic tasting.
Yeasty and fruity but had a metallic sensation in the finish. Decent weiss and If i could get a fresher version I think this would be very good.
thick head, yeasty, cola/caramely, carbonatey, head smells yeasty. I didnt care for it...
50cl Alko. Notes from June 2009. Pours lightbrown, bit cloudy color, with a nice white head. Aroma is slightly yeasty , bit malty. Flacour is wheat and bit sweet caramel. Nice, refreshing.
Roasted malt aroma, with hints of nuts. Has a light brownish color with an off white foam head. The taste also has nuts and malt in there as well.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2011 (br-btl rd-lbl w/monk, poured at Hollerbachs in Sanford FL, 5.5%)

hzy-br, med-thick-foamy-head.
malty german-wheat-yeast(banana, cloves, bubblegum) aroma T1 T2,
mnrl(overtook the delicate yeast flavors) T3.
not much wheat-sourness.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2013 Bottle; I think it may have been a little old. Good color, though the aroma was not appealing. Taste was quite grainy, cereal like with no body. Based on this tasting, I did not enjoy this beer. On tap in Berlin 06.30 ... much different than in different. Tasted like ripe banana .. overall quite good and one of the better dunkel weisses
Poured a great head with plenty of aroma - perhaps banana or bubblegum.  Plenty of carbonation with a bit of creaminess.
Bottle. Poured a light brown with a large off-white head. Aroma had caramel and roasted malt notes. Flavor was sweet with a bit of wheat as well as some caramel and grain.

Bottle 50cl. A brown hazy beer with a huge head. The smell is rich with some roasted and wheat flavour. The beer is quite sweet with malt, caramel and some fruit aroma. Ejoyable beer with multiples aroma that goes well together, very drinkable a very nice beer.
Nice arouma of fruit, cloves and cinnamon with bready notes. It was good but not great. I was hoping to get more out of this beer.

Bottle.  Pours light brown with a small head.  The aroma is light cream and hefe.  The flavor is some hefe, a bit of banana, but also some roastiness and a touch of sour. A solid dose of metal in this one too.  Lots of carbonation.

Aroma/Malty-toasted,
Appearance Head/Initia-huge, Head/Color light brown,
Body/Hue-murky,
Initial Flavor-bitter light
Finish Flavor-bitter light
Palate/Body-medium to full,
good beer

Draft at Edel-Weiss in Norridge. Pours a pale brown, darker than the normal hefe but still somewhat pale for a Dunkelweizen. Nose is spicy and cloves/bananas dominate. Taste is pretty well balanced, mildly roasty and distinct Bavarian flavors of wheat bread and spice and a slight tartness in the middle. Very nice one, actually.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours maroon with a off white head.

Some sourness, wheat and in the backgrond slightly spicy aroma. 
Tastes of wheat and a bit spicy, a bit belgian like a light abbey triple.

bottle - pours light mahogany with a light brown 3 finger frothy, head. Spicy citrus aroma, with a doughy apricot-apple flavor with a hint of tobacco, light hoppy finish with a slighly acidic undertone that evens it out.

Bottle. Hazy dark with a large head. The flavor is slightly acidic with caramel, malt and yeast. No banana in aroma or flavor. Did found some pepper and maybe a little cinnamon. A pleasant and easy to drink dunkelweisen.

Pours a nice dark amber with a nice tall head. The aroma is nice, if you can catch a whiff of it. A nice bready aroma with some nice clove. Im expecting banana, but find it missing. Flavor is nice, I guess. Sharp and yeasty, some nice cinnamon and clove flavor, and finally some banana in the finish. This beer is just nice. Not great, just nice. Very accessible.

Quite the nice combo of dark malts to go with the fantastic banana and clove angle.  The aroma is yeast, light fruits (apricots and apples), medium malts with cloves and light banana.  Flavor has some nice roasted malts, nothing overpowering, bready, a bit of banana and clove with a suble sweetness. Very nice.

Bottle pours hazy brown in color with a creamy off-white head.  For some reason, the aroma reminds me of overcooked (not burnt) oatmeal raisin cookies.  Flavor is light malt and yeast with the slightest touch of clove.  Nothing outstanding, but definately worth a try.

Muddy amber-brown color with thin white head. Fresh citrusy, phenolic aroma. Citruses dominate in the flavor, along with phenolic banana feel and refreshing clove spiciness.
It leaves oily, yeasty feel in the finish. Easy-drinking pleasant dunkel wheat.

Pours hazy brown with a small cream head. Aroma is bold and for me the best part of the beer. Its deep complex with fruit, apricot and prune with malt overtones. Then the first sip and you wonder what happened to the flavor. Yeast and malt flavor flaver dominate while your tast bud search for the flavor of the aroma. Then the beer disappears from your palate. Not impress at all.

Source:500 mL bottle from Green Life in Chattanooga. 
Glass:Wheat. 
Appearance:Hazy amber pour with a two finger tan head.  
Aroma:Aprictos, bananas and cloves. 
Flavor:Lots of fruit and spices.  A little muddled though. 
Palate:Medium body with solid carbonation.
Overall:Good beer, but not well defined.

Hazy amber with a small head. Nose is big wheat with notes of coriander. Hints of peach and malt. Some apricots. Taste is wheat, some citrus, coriander. Pretty much like aroma. Nice balance but a bit simple perhaps. too much apricots/prunes or something for me. Carbonation is lively.
Pours hazy dark maroon, big, fluffy light tan head.  Aroma of citrus and toffee.  Yeasty taste, with bananas and grapefruit.  Light finish.  Not bad.

Bottled. murky brown and looks like cider. head is big and creamy but totally disappears quickly. Yeasty aroma with some sweet malt and sour fruit Sour fruit taste also with big yeast alive on the tongue.  Bready and uneventful. Not exciting. Long finish
Beer poured dark and cloudy with a very healthy head.  Wheat aroma and flavor was there, but not much else.  Still was enjoyable.

1pt9oz bottle shared with brother.  Pours hazy burnt orange with a very generous soft off white head.  Smells of toffee, caramel, and sweet malt.  Tastes sugary sweet, lightly caramlized wheat, and a little spicy.  Not a big fan of this style of beer, so its kinda hard for me to drink and enjoy.
pale cloudy yellow with a nice smooth taste nice foamy head and no aftertaste a good beer that goes with a lot of food.
Tap at the Local.  Cloudy Nutmeg brown pour.  Thin white head.  Clove and banana nose.  Buttery, fruity taste.  Very good.

Ok, I admit it, I really like dark wheat beers, so Im biased, but damn - delicious. Lighter than many of the other dark wheats Ive had, but here, it just played so well. Refreshing light tender banana succulence.

Bottle. Pours light brown wit a substantial white longlasting head. Aromas of yeast and malt with notes of ripe bananas. Flavour reflects the aroma with an addition some clove and some nuttiness.  Very good and refreshing.
Snäll smak, grumligt utseende. Liksom de flesta veteöl saknar den en inramande beska, något distinkt som håller ihop det hela. Synd, eftersom grundsmaken är högt angenäm.
Aroma says not too much to me. Dark appearance, interesting. Palate very good, soft and tender. Something spicy on its flavour. Good beer
Bottle poured into a Sam Adams Sensory Glass produced an off-white head with beautiful light amber body.  Sweet and delicious, definitely one of my favorites and highly recommended wheat beer.

My rating #700 came randomly during my holidays in Alps, just as I found this beer completely accidentally in Defreggerhaus mountain hut, during our climb to Grossvenediger. Always before Ive chosen something special for the milestone ratings, but is there any better thing than try this famous beer at the altitude of 3000 meters. 
Anyway, had it on 4th Aug, from a 0.5 l bottle which poured murky reddish brown body with big brownish head. Fine aroma of some caramel, bubblegum and other typical weizen scents. A touch of rotten vegetables though. Flavor is sweetish, fruity and caramelly with a touch of some sourish thing. Wont say veggies, but not too far from that. Medium bodied. Pleasant and long finish helps the final image of the beer is somewhat better. Well, its pretty good beer for sure, but Ive somehow expected more.
Somewhat sweet, yeasty flavor, small hint of sugar and dates. A little chewy, but otherwise falss far short of a dunkel, in my opinion. Bottle at abraxas Lounge, Miami Beach.

500 ml bottle. Notes are unreadable, but a quick analysis. Drinked long time ago and tasted much better then than now. I could hav esworn that this is the best beer. Well, Its not. Something has changed. Is it me or the beer.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2011 (Bottle). Clear dark copper color. Small off white head with good retention. Light caramel aroma with light breadiness. Flavor of the same. Avg duration. Smooth finish. Creamy texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing. 

(bottle at Old Chicago Downtown in Colorado Springs).  Pours a cloudy amber color. Medium off white head. Wheat aroma. Sweet wheat taste. Thin texture. Moderate carbonation. (original rating 7/27/09. 3 overall.)

Pours a dark copper with a fluffy white head. Aroma is lager yeast and some fruity esters. Flavor is malt, some banana and other fruit, and a little wheat. The wheat really takes a back seat in this brew that tastes like a malty lager. Pretty nice.
Draft.  Dark brown/hazy with thick head.  Nice malty aroma, some banana, caramel, flavor of candied sugar and wheat.  Caramel.  Good beer.
Dark brown cloudy pour with a surprisingly white head that disperses rather quickly. Banana on the nose as well as the palate. Relatively sweet beer with a very refreshing taste.

.5L bottle enjoyed with a Lentil buger at Blanc Burgers + Bottles in Leawood, Kansas. Pour is hazed/cloudy brown orange ruby. Nice one inch tan head. Banana sweetness and caramel are on the nose initially, followed by wheat and some dusty grass. Taste is soft wheat, banana, sweet caramel and slightly citrus tangerines. Slight bit of roast in the back. As it went along, sweetness subsided some, and became more pleasant.  near the finish, it turns to dusty straw hay.  Palate is medium, slickly mouth coasting with a nice level of carbonation - drinkable.
Pours cloudy brown with an offwhite fizzy head.  Nose is wheat.  Taste is spicy and sweet, with notes of cinnamon and caramel.  A nice dunkelweizen.

Overall Impression: 
This is a really tasty Dunkelweizen, for a really solid German brewery.
Pours a brown, cola color body and a finely carbonated, little legs, off-white head.  Smells of toast, yeast, and dark sugar.  Flavor is yeast and dark sugar.

0.5 L bottle from Systembolaget. A firm  offwhite head upon a dark reddish-brown, translucent body. Soft, light nutty malt aroma. Some yeast tones and touch of candy-sugar. Taste is quite mellow; wheaty, and medium sweet. Faint caramel and touch of dark fruits. Softly carbonated and light-bodied. Short wheaty finish. Too soft maybe, lacks some attitude.
Dark brown-orange with a creamy off white head.  Taste is lightly spicy, burnt sugar, caramel, a hint of clove.  Taste is caramel, citrus, burnt sugar, light clove.

I am not sure how this rating got deleted, but I originally rated this about three years ago after a trip to germany. Bought this in a store.  From the 500 mil bottle it poured a hazy amber to brown color with a light tan head and big lacing. Nose of oranges and cloves. Medium mouthfeel.   Flavor is malts and some banana. Good beer and easy drinking.

Sampled on draft at Johnnys Wifes Place in Jeannette PA this beer poured murky dark orange-brown color with a small beige head. The aroma was moderately strong banana and clove. The flavor was bitter, tangy, bready and malty with notes of orange, pepper, cardboard and nutmeg underneath. The finish was long, dryish, spicy, bready and had a touch of clove. Nice.
Dark Amber with thick creamy foam.. a very light and refreshing dunkel... I typically prefer higher alcohol content with a bit more flavor, but this goes well with the Hef on a hot summer day
50 cl bottle. Pours brown-amber with big creamy foam. Smells fruity whit yeast too. Taste: nut, cereal and a hint of banana. Good beer.

pours very cloudy red with a heavy citrusy yeast aroma. flavor is sweeter than i expected, almost bubblegum with some spice notes. finish is tangy as expected. pretty good, but a tad too sugary for me.
TAP: brown/grape pour, nice white head. Sweet malt and dark fruit nose, but mild. Taste is wheat, sugar, caramel, maybe a little nut. Somewhat dry.

500 ml. bottle. Pours  huge fluffy off white head of poor duration,over a slightly cloudy brownish (SRM 15-20) body.....nose of slight banana/bubblegum, clove.........tastes initially of sweetish roasted malts (toffee, slight brown sugar), then light lemon and finishing clove.....mouth feel is light, carbonation high, finish is dry. I was disappointed. This is not particularly spicy, nor as rich as I had anticipated. There are many better hefes out there.
Dark amber color with a white head. No lacing. Smells of sweet malt and yeast. Taste of very light banana. Mostly caramel, nutty, and bread. Good beer for any day or event.

Aroma of fermented fruit. Dark cloudy apperance. Tastes fermented fruit and jeast. The taste is simular to the speciall taste of belgian strong ales. Not a tasty beer, the fermented fruit is not getting along with the yeast taste at all. This beer hade been in a closet for about three months, the taste could been destroyed by this.
A brown beer with a fine but short head. Salty smell and taste. Small and uninteresting palate. Too little bitters in this slightly sweet beer. Disappointing due to higher expectations.

Bouteille de 500 ml, rapportée de Munich par François et Martine. Arômes de levure allemande épicée (clou de girofle). Robe ambrée, belle mousse et effervescence active. Bien équilibrée, la levure épicée (clou de girofle, cannelle) est accompagnée par une belle touche de céréales et un soupçon de caramel. Finale peu amère.

Im in a pinch with this one. I lived in Germany for a while and this beer was the best around. However, it doesnt travel well. It doesnt taste right after the journey to America. There is something wrong with the sediment in the American bottles. If I was rating a fresh bottle in Germany Id give it better marks than Ive given it for the imported bottles in the US.

Not as good as I thought this was going to be.  Poured a cloudy copper color with a average off white head that mostly diminished.  Aroma of bread and caramel.  Flavor was mailny roasted malt with a slighty sour aftertaste. Fairly thin beer with some fizzy carbonation.

did not enjoy as much as the non dunkel hefe.

strong hop at end

big foamy head copper color

A really nice aroma of bread, banana and butter. Taste of banana, syrup, bread and yeast. Finish is sticky and dry, and is slightly reminiscent of rancid butter. Its probably due to the months in a locker this one has endured. Im gonna rerate with a fresh specimen one of these days.

Pours mostly brown with a solid frothy head. Aroma of banana, caramel, champagne, and other fruits. Flavor is quite fruity, with more banana, apple, caramel spice, and nuttiness. Palate is OK, nothing special, but an above average brew.

brownish copper pour with a nice frothy offwhite head. 
vinious, some banana, clove, caramel sweetness in the nose.  
nice bready character, taste is somewhat like the aroma, tiny bit of roast in the malt, some light fruity nuttiness.  finish is a little watery.  Overall a great offering, pleasing

Copper brown pour with one finger beige froth. Aroma is caramel, ripe fruit, nectar, vinousness, and some brown sugar. Flavor is bready, biscuity caramel with lingering over ripe fruit sweetness. Clove and nutmeg  are evident. Palate is a tad thin, quite carbonated, and thoroughly dry in the finish. Quite interesting.

First off it was a lot of head to navigate through. The smell was all yeast and malt.  taste was mostly malt with a bit of nuttiness, like licking walnut shells. A decent beer but I should try some more from the style.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy  brown with huge tan frothy head. Aroma is spice, honey, some bannana. Taste is cloves ,sweet malts, nutty.

Poured 10% beer and 90% head - it just exploded in the glass. A nice light tan thick head remained the whole time and the lacing was decent enough. Amazing looking brew - brown/slight orange cloudy muck - reminded me of when my fat german friend A-bombed his colossal ass into a pristine pool 2km into a cave. Aroma is a bit weak and unique, but the yeast is very prominent, secondary are the cloves, stinky banana (maybe, but its something a bit unsettling) (weak) and maybe nuts, not that Id know what nuts smell like... - smells slightly sweet, crisp and dry. Yeast is the first thing to hit the mouth and its fairly big. Theres a bit of dark malt in there. Sour. Sourness that sticks around behind the molars. Maybe a hint of bananas and dry and somewhat empty. Beer massages the tongue with its sour yeasty assault and leaves the mouth tingling. Found myself tasting but avoiding smelling it. Highly drinkable but mysterious at the same time - could be better, but Ive never had a dunkel hefe-weisse before, so maybe Im just unedumicated in the style.

Bottle. Hazy dark brown colour with a nice white head. Aroma is malt, banana and yeast. The flavour is banana, wheat and yeast with spicy notes. Not the best dunkelweizen I have had, but still quite tasty.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown with a nice frothy white head. Aroma of spice, banana, and wheat. Flavor is much the same. Very tasty, but I was slightly disappointed the flavor wasnt stronger. Still this is a very refreshing tasty brew.
Nice color. The aroma is a tad faint but ok. A good wheaty taste. I really like this one.
Pours brown with a thick beige head. Aroma is yeast, spice, apple, and wheat. Taste is traditional wheat and yeast with just a hint of roast on the finish.

Pours a great dark brown color.  The aromas, while a little muted, are great, there are some smells of carmelized banannas, the malts are prevalent.  The flavors are quite good as well, mirroring somewhat the aromas but with some additional fruit and a hint of a roasted note.  My only non-glowing comment is that the beer seems a little bit light and weak, not quite thick enough of a mouthfeel.
Beautiful colour , nice taste. Not strong though. The classic german taste dominates in this one. Not bad at all. Youd better taste this one cause if you havent yet youre missing something.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2009 Aroma of caramel, banana, orange and honey. Flavor is great, slightly sour and refreshing. Banana and honey stands out. The flavor is like a weaker Leffe blond. I like it.

Pours a hazy dark amber/brown.  Sizeable head diminishing slowly to light head - head is beige.  Pleasant, sweet aroma of caramel, chocolate, toast, dark fruits and definite yeast notes.  Well-balanced, smooth with plenty of taste.  Id be happy to sit and enjoy several of these with friends.  Alas, I bought only two.  But they will be enjoyed - Cheers!

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2010 A good dark hefe-weissbier.  Pours brown in color, with a light and airy taste.  Aroma of bananas with a hint of sweet molasses.  Only down size is the lack of fullness to the beer.  An easy drinker, overall okay.

From bottle, brown hazy with nice beige head, aroma of banana and orange some clove and nice sweetness, flavor is not balanced, some yeast and peach then some malt and citrus and the finish is spiced with clove. Watery.

50cl bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours brown and cloudy with two to three fingers of frothy tan head.  Smells a bit roasty with some citrus notes.  Tastes roasty but kind of light-bodied.  Its good but seems a bit watered down.

Bottle, 50cl - Hazy brown beer with a nice head. Aroma is malty with hints of yeast. Soft flavor with weak hints of wheat, toffee and acidic. Not too impressed at all, needs a lot more flavor and fullness.

Draft - Poured a dark reddish amber in color with a creamy off-white head.  Aroma is fruity with plenty of yeast.  Flavor is not that strong... slightly sweet with some banana, clove and citrus.  Not at all like a traditional dunkel weisse, but pretty good...

50 cl bottle. It poured a dark reddish cloudy liquid with a huge foam which left allot of lacing. The smell is allot weaker compared to the normal hefe-weissbier. But there is a hint of the sweetness in the background. The taste is very smooth allot less fizzy then the normal version. Its also more malty with a hint of some toasted bread. A very nice beer but the normal version was better.

Bottle sampled at SF International Beer Fest.  Not as good as the hefe-weissbier but still solid.  Dark amber color with a nice off-white head.  Spices, earth, banana, and clove on the aroma.  Sweet malt, roast, banana, clove, spices on the flavor.  Smooth palate, medium body.
Dark brown amber color with fine head. Nice sweet aroma, and sweet burnt malty flavor.

300ml on tap at the Lowenbrau Bier Keller, Sydney. Clear, very dark gold, with a pillowy soft head. Fine weizen characteristics. It is not too bitter at all, but has a crisp and fresh taste, with the smoothness of a dunkel to back it up. A very pleasant drink.

500ml bottle $2.49. Nice dark, cloudy brown color poured into a pilsener glass and had a foamy head but now its just a two centimeter blanket atop the beer. Aroma is slightly spiced but not what I would expect from a hefe, average. taste is nice and fruity and almost makes me think of chocolate bread for some reason. Not a bad beer at all considering the price.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-26-2009 22:51:50

Presentation: It was poured from a 16.9oz brown bottle into a Weizen glass.

Appearance: Its body has a brownish or ice tea color with a cloudy appearance. On top sits a big creamy tan head that has good retention, lasting until the finish after slowly fading to a small cap of foam. Its lacing was slick and slid down the glass as I drank.

Smell: The aroma hits you with a big overripe banana followed by some other fruity and earthy yeast notes with a touch of clove.

Taste/Mouth feel: The flavor starts with a lightly roasted wheat malt base with some fruity banana clove notes coming in. The wheat and yeast flavor gets dryer and brings dusty earthy notes. Hop flavor and bitterness is light and most noticeable in the finish. The finish is very dry with a smooth, thick, almost powdery texture. Carbonation feels about average and the body is a good solid medium.

Notes: For me I felt that this beer had a few ruff edges but overall was good.

Definite clover and banana aroma, similar to the hefeweizen. Small head that was gone by the time I sat down to drink, color resembled molasses. Clover, banana and fresh apple flavors, but perhaps a little watery. Palate was lively for the style, but went away quickly. This beer does things well, but for a seemingly short time.

Bottle. Poured a hazy orangish color with a two finger white head that left lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma was citrus, spice, yeast, and malts. Flavor was banana, and other fruits. Decent aftertaste, thin to medium body. Decent beer.

Bottle from Three Sons.  All of the character of a Hefe Weizen, though not as much head as some others or lacings, but plenty of citrus flavurs, but more complex with some roasted and caramel character coming through
Bottle from BevMo! Mission Valley.  Pours light brown with huge head. Banana in aroma with some candy and spices. Banana, wheat and maybe a little caramel in the mouth. Great mouth feel.
500ml Bottle - Hazy brown in colour. Malty and slightly spicy aroma, with hints of dried fruit. Fruity taste with raisins, banana and a hint of spice.

Pours a cola like color with a quckly diminishing tan head.  aroma of fruit, banana, and yeast.  taste is fruity in the begining with banana and then its change to a more maltier taste of banana nut bread.  moutfeel is light and too fizzy.  this Dunkel is a tad too waterd down and lack charcter.  overall, a ok dunkel.
500ml bottle. Poured a dark ruby with a thick tan head. Good carbonation, hazy almost cola like. Citrus and coriander notes with a sweet malt banana taste. Clean and very moreish.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy brown with a large, fluffy head.
Fruity spicy aroma with clove and mostly bananas.
Fresh an light body. A bit too thin.
Some bananas and clove.

1 pint .9 oz bottle from BevMo in Tucson, Poured a dark amber brown with a small white head that faded quickly. Very small amount of carbonation. Aroma is roasted bananas. Taste is again fruity with bananas at the front. The finish was a little dry with a little bitter metallic taste. Its OK to be honest. Im not a big fan of it, its missing something. The taste is a little too simple and it leaves me wishing for something more.

Pours a dark brown with a white head.  Big yeasty aroma.  slightly sweet taste without much depth to it.  

pint bottle

Deep brown hazy colour with a creamy, but collapsing head. Classic wheatbear aroma, fruity and yeasty. Malty, citric flavour with weak hints of roastiness in the finish, not much bitterness nor hops. Watery and flat mouthfeel - no...

50cl bottle. Best before 2009-08. It poured an orange colour with a big creamy off-white head that settled down fast in the glass leaving a thin white roof-top. The aroma is sweet with notes of dark malts, yeast, apples and bananas. The flavour is unfortunately not as good as the aroma. Its a bit flat with notes of malts, bananas and sweet caramel. It has a short aftertaste.
Bottle. Dark brown pour of a small head. Notes of dark fruits, caramel, yeast and bananas. Taste had a little bit of malt, some dust, light yeast, sweet vanilla and banana.

Bottle. Pours with an off-white froth over a hazed hazelnut brown body. Aroma of banana, spice, clove, toffee and chocolate. Taste is a bit oxidized, with cardboard, nutty malts, banana esters, clove and CO2. Very fizzy.

Dark amber-brown with some floating yeast and a creamy white head.  Aroma of some bananas, fair amount of lactic acid, and some pretzel dough.  Taste is on the malty side, not as much banana as you get in the regular Franziskaner.  OK but not my favorite weissbeir from this brewer.

On tap at the Bavarian Bier Cafe in Sydney. A cloudy brown beer with a moderate off white head. Toffee malt aromas predominate. Full bodied with a vibrant mouthfeel and caramel-wheat malt flavours. The finish is quite sweet. Not bad at all.

16.9 oz bottle. Earthy aroma with hints of spices and fruit. Dark amber with a long lasting thick beige head. Medium sweetness, lightly sour.Medium body, soft carbonation, and a long sweet finish. This is a very smooth beer that has a nice sweet finish but not overly sweet.

0.5L bottle, small quickly diminishing head, murky light brown colour with yellow taints, strong carbonation. Not really too apealing but maybe what a dunkelweizen usually looks like, Sour wheaty aroma with with some spicy cinamon  notes and a whiff of smoke. Mellow fruity sweetness suprisingly turning into a dry appely flavour which also dominates the finish.
An unusual dunkelweizen
Pours a hazy brown with a small beige head. Aroma is banana, yeasts, fruits, wheat, roast. Flavor is banana, wheat, dark malts, bread. Fairly dry but it works well here.

Not too much on the nose.  Nice cloudy brown color with a foamy beige head.  Nice amount of carbonation with a light mouthfeel and subtle flavors of bannana, bubblegum, clove and floral flavors one would expect froma Hefeweizen.  Nice beer.
Muddy brown with a fine baige head. Fruity yeasty aroma with some spicey notes, cloves. Smooth palate but abit weak flavor wise. Medium bitter and a mild sweetness.
Draught at the German Club, Brisbane. Pours ahazy brown with a decent white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, malt, caramel, fruit and clove. Smooth palate and finishes nicely. An enjoyable brew.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2009 Bottle: some malty notes, strong banana notes, bubblegum notes, quite yeasty, some bready notes, some sour notes, an ok dunkel beer.
Finishes with tastes of citrus and wheat. Very good hefeweizen beer.  Copious amounts of head.
A dark unclear apperance with a big head. Not to much aroma, but some yeast and a bit malt and the flavor is also yeast.

Smells like the browned crust of banana bread, tastes spicy, like clove and pepper, fruity, with a little citrus and subtle banana, caramel and vanilla, but its pretty dry, quite refreshing.  Everything is well balanced, a little bitter in the finish.  This is a nice beer, the flavors are interesting, they work well together, the whole is more than the sum of the parts.  The murky brown color doesnt do much for me, but looks arent everything.
really enjoyed this beer, Poured an unfilter yellow with banana flavors. pretty smooth.

nose of some yeast esthers that fade into almost metallic like bitterness. color is cloudy rust. flavor is of some fruits but not enough to satisfy me with the experience of better dunkelweizens. palate is just thick enough, very nice. overall this is less of a success then regular franzi is in its own category.

Muddy river-brown or dark unfiltered apple cider in color with nice head retention. Plenty of floaties. Nose is malty apples. Toasted bananas sit in a classic weizen spritzy mouthfeel. Spicy citrus alongside. Sorta light-medium boddied and despite the color would make an excellent summer brew. Ill have to visit Ayingers version next. Very good!

(bottle) pours a murky reddish-brown colour with an off-white head. aroma predominantly of peanuts and toasted malt. flavour is the same, with a hint of coffee and a full roasted-bitter finish. medium body with fizzy carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a muddy brown with no head. Smells of fruits. Great smooth taste with a nice hue of bananas. Left my glass full of sediment.

Bottle. Nose is phenolic, slightly metallic with banana and clove undertones. Caramel as it warms. Thick-ish brown with a nice bubbly white head. Flavor is caramel and bananas, well-intertwined. A touch of roasty character shows up at the end as well. Full-bodied with a very smooth feel, like thick velvet. This makes it a very drinkable dessert beer.

Picked up a botte at the World Market. Reminds of a belgian a little, crossed with a wheat beer. Food color and body, with a light colored head. Mine was a cloudy amberish orange color. Full bodied and very drinkable. Thumbs up!

Not great - not horrible. Its good to see what a Dunkelweizen should taste like, not what our opinion of them is. Pours a dark brown with white head. Aroma is bananas, with a touch of must. Not overly sweet, but with a clove note in there. Finishes on a clean note.

Poured a very nice Red/orange/brown colour with a dense and tall off-white head. Aroma of wheat, cloves, and roasted malts. Flavour same as aforementioned with banana, toast, spices, and caramel. Medium to full-dodied with a fairly sweet, spicy finish. Excellent.

Appearance: Pours a medium brown body with a tall, meringue-like, ivory-colored head.

Smell: Clove-scented toasted wheat aroma with notes of apple juice and, to a lesser degree, bananas.

Taste: Sweet, toasty, and tangy malted wheat. A bit of treacle and caramel sweetness present. Fruity tastes of bananas and Granny Smith apples. Pinch of clove. Light spicy hops and bitterness. A disquieting wateriness begins to the develop midway. Dull, muted spice on the dry finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Downright fizzy carbonation.

Drinkability: Pass. While not bad any stretch of the imagination, it fails to show the depth, grace, and deliciousnicity of the finer examples of the style.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2009 A good Weissbier, with a different taste. But if you make a blind test it will be hard to make a difference with the classic weissbier

Pours milk chocolate brown with a creamy light tan head that has pretty good retention. Aroma is of wheat, floury lemon tart, severely overripe banana, vanilla, and berry. Flavor is heavy on raw wheat and toasted barley, plenty of banana pudding with Nilla wafers,  a hint of over cooked caramel and some light citrus notes. Finishes buttery and tart with a honey-wheat bread backbone. Good stuff, not great.
Bottle. Cloudy, ruddy brown with a smallish head. Banana and chocolate aroma. Some clove blending with banana flavours and caramel. Overall semi-dry. Drinkable.

A creamy pale brown head rapid strong carbonation in a clear orange brown por aroma malty wheat banana vanilla flavour creamy smooth wheat taste crispness clove banana light bitter hops soapy finish a light roasted wheat taste.

light brown fogged color, tall rocky white head, rich banana hefe nose, mild hefe weizen flavor, no dark alts stand out in flavor, tastes like a rich standard hefe but loses points on the lack of dark malts in the backbone, it looks dark but the flavor hardly matches, actually tastes like a lager...?

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2009 500 ml bottle. Finland. (HHOK).
Very dark brown hazy colour with puffy head. Not very nice as most of the Dunkelweizens.
Aroma is almost as enjoyable as in Hefe-Weissbier. As fruity (banana) but somewhat darker. Flavour is a bit more away from the non-Dunkel version. Quite sweet. So this cannot compete with the original. Very good though.

Had this one on tap at the porter beer bar a while back.  Dark brown color with a bit of a red hue and a big tan head.  Spicy aroma with a distinct banana flavor.  Some clove and cinnamon like flavors as well.  The finish is pretty sweet.  Full bodied long lasting beer.
Superior à versão clara, tem um paladar pouco intenso, mas ainda preserva o aroma frutado.

Poured from bottle a hazy burnt caramel color with large light-tan head.  Much like the blond hefe Franziskaner, the aroma is nice with yeast, clove, banana, to a lesser degree - bubblegum and more caramel malt.  The flavor is a more subdued banana and bubblegum with a stronger caramel toasted bread combo taking over.  The palate has a nice spiciness to it with plenty of carbonation to sizzle the tongue and a mild sweetness.  Overall a very nice beer with a good taste and aroma profile.  I could drink a lot of these.
I love the way this beer looks in a mug.  it has a great taste and finish.  overa,ll i was very impressed with this bever and other Hefe-Weissbier that Franziskaner puts out.

Poured a hazy dark amber/caramel color. There were bits of sediment suspended in the glass. There was a tall foamy off-white head that reduced slowly. As the head went down you could hear the bubbles popping. The head eventually disappeared to just a film. There wqas a bit of a spice aroma with a mix of a light caramel scent.Initially there was good carbonation and a big alcohol taste with an underneath sweetness. The finish was rather mild.

(10/23/08) Bottle drank in my hostel room in New York. Cloudy brown with a big, slowly-diminishing, beige head. Aroma of banana, lots of clove, caramel and bread. Sweet flavor with some toasted malt, bread, wheat, fruits, caramel, some spiciness and light toffee notes. Medium-bodied. A very pleasant Dunkelweizen.

Pours quite dark brown with full opacity.  A full creamy tan head emerges and although it fades quickly, a film of foam persists throughout consumption.  Lace is heavy upon a drink, then falls quickly.  A fairly light scent gives off a fresh banana tone.  The taste is pleasant and not very overpowering, and body is medium light. Flavor indeed quite similar to the scent, with a nice banana taste and some fresh sourdough bread connotations.  Finish is light and sour.

Pours a hazy dark amber with a perfect, fluffy off-white head that sticks around. Aroma of dark fruits, yeast, and cloves. Taste is strange. Begins like normal Franziskaner with some higher than average bubbliness and banana notes but then turns a light sour with a somewhat watery, bland aftertaste. No lacing. Strange that this is the dark version of Franziskaner but is more watery and muted than the normal hefeweisen.
bottle. red brown, big off white head. malty roast, lot of carbonation. seems a little thin. slightly sweet. ok
Bottle. Poured deep teak with thick white head.  Citrusy aroma with a bit of fresh baked bread.  Full flavour, like very good freshly baked bread, with  a fine hop bite.  Lekker balanced finish.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
Aroma - sour rye, sweet, banana

Appearance - cloudy caramel, off-white head with some white lacing

flavor - dry, slightly sour, like a Belgian wit

palate - thin, lingering sourness

overall - not bad, but not something I’ll try again

The color is a medium red/brown, with a strong hop smell, the smell of the grains/wheat really come through as well. The hop flavor was too strong for my personal taste, and it was a little too carbonated.
Red-brown body with quickly disappearing white head. Malty and wheaty flavor with some extra carbonation.

The aroma is strongly wheat, banana, spicy cloves.  Its appearance is a nice dark brown, hazy, large off-white head.  Wheaty, spicy flavor, with notes of bitter chocolate.  The carbonation, and a slight hoppiness dominate the palate.  Ok for the style.

ar:cardboard dominates, bruwn sugar, dark fruits below that.
fl: brown sugar, raisisjns, wheat, slight sawdust.
sort fo an okay dunkel weissbier, but not as fantastic as the light version.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber body with 3 finger off white head.  Nice malty aroma of cereal, caramel and some chocolate.  Grainy with a toasted malt flavor and a light hop seasoning.  Decent beer.

Poured into an 80oz glass boot.  Poured very  dark with just a bit of light brown head that dissapated pretty quickly.  Smelled of coffee and some alcohol could be sensed.  The taste was coffee and chocolate and it went down smooth.  Despite having on the medium side of a heavy body, this one was quite drinkable, as the boot took just barely over an hour so I would guess.  I would definitely get this again, perhaps in a smaller container.  Perhaps not!

Bottle.  500 ml - Pours a cloudy deep copper in color.  This brew has a rich malty aroma to go with the slight citrus hop character.  It has a slight toasty flavor with a small wheat grainyness.  It has a medium body and a slightly oily, cloyingly sweet finish.  Very nice.
(Bottle).  Grassy wheat aroma.  Cloudy mahogany body, small off-white head.  Flavor is tart and clean, but tails off abruptly to a non-existent finish.  Not memorable.

Bottled. Dark amberish-orange to brown. brew with rich, dense and firm head. Aroma is intensively banana estheric, yeasty and slightly hoppy in the finish. Flavor has sweetness of fermented fruits and sourness of yeast with slightly bitter finish. Palate is quite smooth, but a bit overly carbonated.
Bottle, 50 cl, thanks ekstedt. Brown with light brown head, hazy. Light aroma of fruits and some caramel, somewhat malty. Sweetish taste. Light mouthfeel.

small off-white head into cloudy brown body.  aromas of light bubble gum yeast, light to moderate malts and a touch of hops.  flavor is watery light sweet into a more bitter finish.  short finish duration.  watery texture.  average carbonation.  okay not great beer.
Bottle (50 cl) from Toom Getränkemarkt, Würzburg, Germany. Murky copper, medium off-white head. Nutty and caramelly aroma with dark fruits, and bananas. Moussy mouthfeel. A bit sweet.

Pours cloudy brown with a thin, tan head, although I recall the head being thicker when I tried some this unpasteurized in Munich (aka München).  Aroma of spices, wheat, and bananas--reminds me of home baked banana bread.  Spicy, smoky flavor with a smooth, creamy mouthfeel.  Again, the flavor of the bottled version exported to America is blander than that you can get in Munich. Still...
Es ist ein wunderbares Dunkelweißbier!
Pours hazy brown with a big off white head.  Aroma is yeasty and spicey.  Taste is wheat, dark malt, and some spicey banana notes.  I like it.

Not as enjoyable as the standard hefe.  Translucent cloudy brown pour with amber highlights and offwhite head.  Nose is malty and wheaty.  Some phenolic dry banana and stale clove come out in the flavor.
bottle, amber pour with huge tapioca head, nose is standard hefe but flavors are bananas foster nuts and a buttery finish

(Bottle) Dark brown. Hazy. Medium sized white rather quickly disappearing head. Banan and malts in nose. Full bodied palate with lot of carbonation. Banana, raisin, bitterness and caramell in taste. Bitter and caramell flavoured aftertaste.
Brownish amber, kinda creamy, sweet, roasted malts, yeast, bready, caramel,  spices, little citrus. Slight cola flavor as it warms.

Frothy and large white head, with hints of sediment in it. Light brown and muddy color. Roasty malts and bananas in the aroma. Spices, some roasted malts, and banana in the taste. Bubblegum-like aftertaste.
Cloudy brown color, aroma of wheats and bananas, tastes quite fruity/banana and some dark malt.
Pours nice Medium brown, with 3 finger beige head. Can taste yeast some smokey flavor to it. Cloudy appearance some lacing on glass. Very smooth and creamy feel. One of my new favorites!
Pours hazy caramel color with light tan head. Wheat and yeast aromas. Flavors of wheat, babanas and spices. Medium body with minimal carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle poured to glass.  Pours brown with a rich white head.  Heavy aroma of wheat and yeast.  Smooth full flavored wheat beer with a long creamy mouthfeel.  The smokey flavor really opens up when the brew is swallowed.
50cl bottle, brown colour, white head with brown notes that quickly disappear, low carbonation, fruits (banana), wheat and yeast aroma, balanced flavor, clean finish with light hops notes, very good
Cloudy brown with yeasty ripe banana and spice aroma.  Moderately sweet with the perfect level of carbonation.  One of my favorite Dunkelweizens.

Brown beer with big slightly beige head. Wheats and bananas are foud in the slightly sweet aroma. Flavour is quite sweet, and there are found bananas, hint of roastiness and some spicyness. Quite light to drink with lot of biting carbonation. Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel is good beer but it would need some provement for every section to be rising up to the top.
Excellent dark malt and nutty flavor mixes well with the banana and clove flavors.  Almost like banana bread with nutella(I know that sounds weird, but it’s what I wrote down while tasting.)

essa Dunkelweizen alemã tem o aroma característico de banana das cervejas de trigo; fora isso, traços de caramelo também pode ser farejados. Nada muito diversificado, mas os poucos aromas satisfazem o olfato (6/10). A aparência inicial também não apresenta nada de outro mundo (3/5), com espuma inicial média, coloração marrom-claro, moderada formação de colarinho, curta longevidade da espuma, claridade lodosa do corpo (eu diria que é seu traço mais marcante), que apresenta partículas de tamanho médio (sedimentos e corpo de fundo) e coloração marrom acobreado.
No nobre campo do sabor, permanece o mormaço dos sentidos (4/10). O sabor inicial é levemente adocicado e ácido, sensação que se mantém até o final, de média duração. O paladar conta com corpo médio-leve, textura aguada, carbonatação borbulhante e final de sensação ligeiramente ácida (2/5). O trigo parece dar seu ar da graça apenas no final do gole, quando fica mais pronunciado.
Em termos gerais, o exemplar que degustei parecia uma Lager escura, sem muita personalidade.
Nice roasted wheat beer.  Tastes of tropical fruit on the front and finishes with malty toasted chocolate.  Excellent beer.  Thank you Ryan at WOB Westchase for recommending this for me.

Brown, cloudy. Nice white fluffy head with a highish carbonation to make i last. Aroma of bubblegum and malty chocolate. Tastes quite fruity/banana, some dark malt and a spicy dry finish. An enjoyable beer.

Off taps at Capital Ale House.
Pale Munich style malt aromas with spicy fruity yeast character. Cloudy amber brown with small fine white head.
Light caramelized malt flavor with spicy fruity Belgian yeast flavors. Bubblegum and clove. Light body with moderate carbonation and fairly full mouthfeel. Dry fruity finish.
A darker, richer version of their wheat beer.  Loads of rich wheat goodness balanced out by some subtle smokiness and citrus blasts from the yeast notes.  A very well done beer.
50 cl Bottle @ home. Cloudy amber coloured, big off-white head. Aroma of banana, caramel, yeast and some spices. Taste is soft, caramel, some banana, yeast and wheat. Soft mouthfeel.
Pours a brownish reddish color with an off white head. Aroma is sweet malts and pretty bland, Flavor is much the same with some added chocolate and nutty notes.
Better than I expected.  Carmel and creamy just like I like them.  Light to medium bodied. Medium amber in color.  Pretty mild but more than acceptable.

Pours a clear amberish colour with a medium sized white head. Aroma is wheaty, slight caramel and nutty. Taste is bubbly, semi sweet, and a little creamy. Decent head retention, and virutally no lacing, except for a few dots.
Bottle 50cl. Dark brown and slightly hazy body with a large off white head. Sweet nose with yeast and wheat. Light body with a little wheat. Not as good as the normal hefe.
This is a very well made beer.  It has a full body and alot of flavor.  I wouldn’t really drink one on a hot day but it would be perfect in the winter.
Nice refreshing beer.  Subtle yeast and spice aroma.  The wheat flavor is mild and I don’t really get any of the roastiness of the malt, but it’s a tasty brew.

500 mL bottle from Beer Run in Charlottesville. Hazy bronze pour with a very large head. Medium retention and good lacing. It takes a while to pour this thing. Rich and nutty yeast aroma with some fruity notes. Very light taste, with notes of yeast, wheat, nuts, caramel. Light to medium bodied.

Hazy, reddish brown appearance with a large, off white head and modest lacing.  Subdued, wheaty aroma, moderately spiced, with a hint of caramel.  Earthy, malty taste; some yeastiness, some fruitiness.  Well carbonated, medium bodied mouithfeel with the characteristic smoothness.  Slightly sweet, medium length finish.
One of the better dunkels I’ve had over the last 10 years.  Nice aroma, good Franziskaner flavor with a hint of banana.  Goes great with a garlic sausage.

.5l bottle, vigorous head quickly subsides to a thin film. Moderately clovey, no real hop aroma. The slightly dark color doesn’t translate to any caramel or roasty flavor, middle of the road flavor, good but not outstanding in it’s field.
On tap.  Brown pour, has a typical hefe smell of banans and cloves with a taste to match.  Not really different in taste to a god hefe, just darker.  Pretty good.

Tap. Moderate notes of grain and roasted for the malt, light lemon and grass for the hops, moderate barnyard smell for the yeast and banana and clove in the background. Head is average sized, creamy, white with fair lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is muddy brown with tiny particles. Flavor starts lightly acidic and finishes moderately acidic and lightly bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery, and has a lively carbonation. A nice deep roasted smell sets this Dunkelweizen apart from others.

Slight roasty aroma with thick biege head.  Cloudy brown color.  Roasted malt notes in the brew, with a little lemon.  Detected a very slight metallic aftertaste.  As a stand alone brew, I prefer a standard hefe, but the roasted flavor addition makes this pair better with slightly stronger tasting foods than a standard hefe.
Mix franziskaner hefe-weiss with any random dunkel and you’d get this; a heavier, maltier hefe-weisse.

This looks exactly how you want a Dunkel to look.  Rich brown with a dense off-white head that leaves very strong lacing.  Aroma is very pleasant - subtle spice and deep clove.  Very well-balanced aroma that intensifies as the beer begins to warm slightly.  A bit watery on the palate but very refreshing.  I enjoy the Dunkel style.  Doesn’t quite measure up to Ayinger’s but still would highly recommend this for the style.

Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel is a cloudy, marvelously brown beer.  It’s very sparkling and wears a dense, splotchy, oily, off-white head that leaves nice lacing.  The aroma is spicy: banana and nutmeg, mostly.  It’s pretty light bodied, a little watery, but reasonably smooth.  The flavor is pretty faint.  It’s fruity like raisins and spicy like clove and nutmeg.  It’s sessionable, refreshing.

THOUGHTS: Very nice. Aroma just kept getting better as it warmed. The flavor is a little watery, but that’s all the better for a summer refresher. I actually think these darker wheats are more refreshing than the lighter ones.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a murky, light to medium brown with an average-sized, off-white head that mostly diminished and left fair lacing. The aroma was wheat, spices, banana and very light chocolate malt. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and acidic; while the finish was light to moderately sweet, moderately acidic and a little sour with an average to long duration. There was malt, wheat, yeast and spice. Also some banana and slight chocolate. The light to medium body was dry with quite fizzy carbonation and a light astringent and also dry finish.

Pours cloudy amber brown with a fizzy off-white head. Subtle fruity aroma with a bit of yeast. Flavor is slightly fruity, with a bit of sugary malt, but very watered down. Palate is light and a bit fizzy, but not unpleasant. Not bad, but a bit off for the style.
tons of cramy white head aromas of plum molasses banana sugar nice thick mouthfeel one of my favorite beers

Appearance: Dark brown, cloudy. Nice amount of creamy head.
Aroma: Wheat and toffee-ish. Some malt.
Taste: Wheaty and malt. Hoppy. Dry.
Info: 500ml bottle, 16/1-2007, 134/500

Pours dark brown and cloudy. The Aroma and initial taste is yeast and malt. Then the fruity flavors arrive. Creamy and smooth. On of my favorite beers.
I had this in Munich but am reviewing this from bottles.
Deep and dark colored, cloudy with yeast. Brewed with a darker roasted malt which adds some maltiness to the refreshing flavour of the Hefe-Weissbier.
Pours a dark orange hue. With alot of head. The aroma is not really very radiant and not all that impressive. smells fruity. The flavor is fairly tame for a dark weisse.Not really that great.

Pours hazy burnt orange with a thin white head.  Aroma is of banana, but little else.  This isnt very bold for a dunkel... almost like a darker version of the regular weiss...  the regular is good to me as a weiss... this is just an ok Dunkel...  pretty basic.
clody brown body and white head. aroma of banana, dark bread and caramel. a little bit high in carbonation. sweet and dry.
On draft at Yard House in Las Vegas, Nevada.  Full-flavored and full-bodied dunkel.  Banana notes over roasted wheat malt.  Detectable yeast from the middle to the end.  Very enjoyable.
All day my day was pretty crappy. Then I got a taste of this and wow. Its a new day now. Beautiful. Tastes so German. I am drinking this at room temperature.

500 ml bottle. Hazy, dark amber colour. Big, foamy off-white head. Yeast, wheat and banana in the sweet aroma. Spicy, slightly roasted flavour of wheat, nuts with a hint of banana and citrus. Bread-like aftertaste.

First noticed caramel in the nose and then a lot of wheat and some lemon.  Poured a hazy amber with a sustaining white head.  Not much happening on the front of the tongue, but it hits you in the back with a bold burst of hefe - that combination of wheat, citrus and flowery hop.  Finishes dry.
Cloudy brown colour, off-white head. Aroma has banana (and phenoles indeed) and some spices. Flavour has banana, spices and bread. Full mouthfeeling, very smooth.

In my opinion, if Germany didnt have hefeweisens, beer would be overrated in that country. Thank God for hefeweisens. This ones my favorite Ive had thus far. You can keep the head down if you pour it right. Its EXTREMELY smooth with a solid finish. Its sweet and tasty! I spent 7 weeks in Germany a year ago and gained 15 pounds thanks to drinking 6 cases of this stuff. I love a meal in a bottle. This one is worth it!
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Brown cloudy murk, nice head. Smell of banana and vanilla (phenols). Lots of carbonation. Nice taste, but a bit bland. Pretty good.
Bottle. Pours a brown colour with lots of fizz, and a large white head. Aroma is primarely wheat & fruit, whereas the flavor is more spicy and malty. Good.

Very nice.  Aroma has that banana, bubble gum smell w/ some malt as well.  It has a very pleasant brownish color, with a nice white head.  It tastes similar to traditional Hefe, but with both a fuller body and a deeper maltier taste.  Its not quite the same, not as smooth not quite as refreshing as Franziskaner Helles.  Good nonetheless.

Murky orangey brown, basic off-white head. Wheaty nose, ripe banana and little clove. Flavor has strong banana, wheat and spices. Wheat and a bit cellary finish. Medium bodied, strongly carbonated palate. Good honest dunkel.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2008 while the aroma is a better than average, its a nice dark brown body, moderate at that and malty, very smooth and easy to drink, more of an enjoyment beer,

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2008 This is pretty nice for a dunkelweizen.  Light brownish amber, it has a big fizzy, light tanhead that steadily shrinks to a thin top and its slightly hazy. The aroma is cloves, bananas, yeasty sourdough, and raisins.   The taste is lightly tart, wheaty, with banana mostly on the edge of the mouth and in a perfumy quality.  Its dryish and lightly zesty with a light mineral quality and slightly watery feel.  There is a long grain aftertaste, a light banana-bread quality, and its rather crisp and refreshing, but still not really my style.
Pours a cloudy light brown with a smallish head for a hefe. Aroma is banana, bread, caramel, and spices. Nice flavor.
esta la probe en munich con la vea cuando fuimos a pasear y todos los dias despues de reuniones nos echabamos las birrias y pasamos un buen rato que vale la pena super buena
Pours a hazy brown with fizzy white head.  Flavors of grain, bread, banana, spice, caramel, and clove.  Pretty nice dunkel, I enjoyed it.

A very murky brown with a thin laceless head. Smell is great with the most prevalent being banana, spices, and bread. Taste is like banana bread. Mouthfeel is very good finish is smooth with lively carbonation.

large bottle.  Pours a pale grayish brown, but settles in glass as a murky light brown apricot.  Rocky cream head.  Smells of chocolate malt, fruit, and yeast.  Upon sipping, the heavy carbonation initially veils the flavors, but as this subsides grassy notes come forth along with caramel malt.  Given the intensity of flavor present in Franziskaners Weisse beer, I was surprised at how weak this beer was by comparison.  It just seemed like the wonderful aromas that I noted came up quite empty in the body.  Still, certainly quite drinkable.  8 3 6 3 15  3.2
Pours a cloudy brown with a moderate head and nice lacing.  Nose of malts with earthy notes.  Taste of fruit with coffee and caramel notes.  Short bitter/sweet finish.
Pours a dark hazy brown color.  Aromas of bread, malt, and some fruit.  Flavor has a touch of sweet malt and clove, I think.

Aroma: Fruity, like apples and pears, with a hint of tobacco. Malts are well-developed, chocolaty with a hint of coffee.

Appearance: Thick, murky brown, with a pea-soup greenish tint. Creamy, uniform head with good retention.

Flavor: Very much like apple cider, or applesauce. Yum! Toasted malts are the base flavor, with a bit of clove and alcohol. Reminds me of bread pudding. Finish is sweet and refreshing, not sugary in the least.

Palate: Glorious! Incredibly creamy, with little sharp bursts of carbonation.

Overall: This is quite yummy, but I can imagine it might get somewhat cloying after a while. Still, very drinkable.
I like this beer for a macro.  The Germans know their beer and even their macro brewed beers are very nice.  This one is nice and malty and hints of a nice bread can be found also.

Bottle-chilled and ready to go after a long drive to NC, thanks Gabs.  Nice orange brown hazy pour and foam head.  Yeast up front, malt texture and what a great blend.  Aroma of bread and grains mixes into the body and pallet.  This was a refreshing quaffer, only thing missing was a large Stein.

Draft:  Poured a amber color with a nice amount of head.  The aroma was sweet banana and bread.  The flavor was smooth with fruit, caramel and a hint of cloves present.  Overall, an easy drinking beer, one Id get again.
Cloudy amber/orange with light tan head.  Aroma of banana, clove, bubblegum and spice.  Flavor is spicy with wheat and banana too.  Medium palate leads way to a metallic but spicy finish.
Tap. Big brown beer with big brown head. Wheat and malt aroma. Very easy to drink. Wheat, bready and clean taste.

Fredagsbaren på Biologi, Aarhus, DK
Bottled, 020508.
Aroma and flavor of banana. With a hint of caramel/malt sweetness wich balances the high carbonation

50cL bottle courtesy of Naka.  Pours a dark copper color with a thick, two-finger, foamy head that dissipates rather quickly.  Moderate lacing.  Nose is sweet, with banana and spicy clove, some bready notes with a slight roast hint.  Taste is lots of malt, sweet with mild roast.  Lots of banana notes with clove spice, just like a DW should be.  This is really tasty.  Im a big fan of Dunkelweizens, and this one is spot on.  All of the characters that Id expect.  Good stuff.

From the bottle, pours a very dark reddish, with a decently foamy off-white head.  Very nice aroma of banana, some dark malt, some chocolate.  Great taste too, bananas and chocolate, just the right bit of malty and enough carbonation to keep it from being too thick.  Really good beer.

Pours heady and slightly cloudy, aroma of hefe yeast, tastes of hefe yeast with a bit of wheat character, not as malty as I expected, a lot like a helles wheat beer but darker in color without the roasted malt flavor.

50cl bottle from ABC Liquors North Tampa. Pours a cloudy amber color with a thin white head that laces the glass. Aroma: Sweet and malty, caramel, sticky, doughy scents that are pleasant to the nose. Lively carbonation with sweet flavors and malted barley throughout, some tastes of banana, slightly watery with a dry finish. Overall, nice wheat ale.
