A- Dark hazlenut in color this brew has a nice 2 1/2 finger pillowy head that is off white in color.

S- Smell is of indistinct dark fruits and sweetness. Not too pungent, but not necessarily bad smelling so ill give it the benefit of the doubt.

T- Tastes very brown ale-esque with a hint of banana.

M- Mouthfeel is thick with just enough carbonation to make this an easy drinker.

D- Fairly drinkable. Leaves a sticky sweet coating in my mouth that I dont like so much but other than that I could drink a few on a hot summer day.
Nice brown color, small head. Phenolic and spicey aroma of banana. The taste is smooth, some roasted and caramell malt, light citrus flavour, little overcarbonation. I expected more.

Draft at YardHouse in Irvine.  Banana and wheat twang first thing on the nose from this murky brownish yellow pour.  Decent head too.  Some spice on the nose as well.  Similar flavors with more wheat twang than before.  Not too bad.

Wonderful banana bread, wheat, light fruit, and slightly estery aroma.  Light amber appearance, quite clear for a weissbier.  Suprisingly complex caracter in flavor.  Featuring bread, malt, banana, slight circus peanut, just a hint of candied fruit on the finiish, light spicyness, highlights of malt, and yeast.  Wonderful mouthfeel, quite lively yet a nice body to this bier, not thin.  Overall just about as good a thirst quenching bier as one could have.  Well made.
Bottle, 500ml. A cloudy brown colour with a small head. A sweet, malty cocoa aroma. Taste is cocoa, wheat and bready malt. High carbonation. Somewhat watery body, but still quite tasty.

Deep brown in color with a whitish head. Definite weiss nose: malty, fruity, bananas, cloves. Flavor is fruity and malty with some roasted malt character. Not bad, but a little less robust than I wouldve liked.
I really like this, though not as much as the hefe weiss.I would still happily drink a case of these!  Lovely light brown murky color and a decidedly yeast filled flavor.  Yum!

I prefer their Wheat a little more. This pours a gross looking hazy amber color. Much like that of dirty, sewer water. Nice thick white head though. Taste is sweet and fruity, that of bananas and vanilla flavor. Some mild malts in there but fruitiness is the main taste. Its alright but nothing too great. Price was pretty good though. Once the beer settled down the appearance was a little well, more appealing but at first it wasnt something I was excited to drink."
pours brown nice white head,banana,clove yeasty citrus on the nose.bready malty with hints of banana,sweet.quick dry finih.nice easy drinking beer.

Bottle from the cave. Aroma is banana wheaty clove, biscuity almost caramel sweetness, seems a bit minimal. Tasate is wheaty but quite floural, yeasty fruity esters, the roasted malt seems quite lost in here.
Pretty color. Big Bottle! One problem, I dont taste anything. bottle. pours a hazy light brown with a nice tan head. smell is sweet and citrusy, a little bit of spiciness is noticeable too.
Pours a hazy brown with very little aroma and a mediocre head. Tastes malty with notes of biscuit and a slightly sweet touch. Kind of light on the palate.

bottle. pours a hazy light brown with a nice tan head. smell is sweet and citrusy, a little bit of spiciness is noticeable too. flavor is a sweet doughy yeastiness. feels spritzy on the palate. pretty good beer.

cloudy brown with white head.  aroma is sweet and grainy.  tastes pretty yeasty, with a little wheat.  the fruit at the end is nice (banana?), i hate beers that have the aftertaste of a bowl of wheaties

This one is pretty dark in the glass.  The aroma is a little weak.  Mouthfeel is surprizingly thin and not what I expected.  Taste is very much bready and malty but nothing to really write home to mom about.  This one was just alright to me but still very drinkable~
...have had both draft and bottle, draft always better.  Nice dark color, and cloudy.  I personally like the Hefe better than this, its just not that great.

500 ml bottle. Pours golden brown with a big billowy slightly off-white head. Taste is much like the lighter variety but with less accented esters and a bit more malt. Not really doing it for me, it either needs those esters back or a much deeper malt presence.
A barna ferences barát is nagyon kellemes szomjoltó!Megvan benne minden ami kell,kicsit édeskés íz kellemes fanyar felhangokkal és fűszeres utóízzel.Bátran lehet ajánlani mindenkinek!
Murky amber, white head. Grassy aroma with some yeast... Flavor has malt, banana and grass. Feels a little dry, nonspectacular mouthfeel. I was somewhat disappointed.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2008 Bottle. Pours hazy light brown, with big tan head that sticks around. Aroma is bread, yeast, hint of banana. Taste is bready, malt, with a faint hint of banana on the back end. Palate is a tad watery.
On tap at Tanks Tap Room.  Draft pours a thick, hazy, golden-brown color with a foamy tan head.  Very aromatic yeast, wheat, spices, and banana.  Nice smooth flavor of sweet bread and roasted malts.

0.5 l bottle. Hazy yellow brown color with thick head. Bready and clovey aroma with some banana as well as hint of chocolate and vanilla. Slightly sweet bready and clovey flavor with notes of caramel, rye and vanilla. Im not a big fan of dunkel weizens but this pint certainly made my sunday afternoon!
Hazy Deep amber with large white head. Yeasty aroma with banana and yeasty notes. Soft mouthfeel. Flavor has sweet fruit, yeast and caramel notes.
Heazy brown colour, foamy thick head, some wood burn, and shinken pork, some fruits and raisin, very nice full charactar one!
Bottle at the Viking.  Hazy brown colored pour with medium sized white head.  Fruity, hoppy, nutty aroma.  Sweet roasted malts with fruity hints.  Not bad.
Pours a cloudy aber-brownwith a foamy tan head.  Familiar Hefe aroma with some roasted nutiness added in.  Smooth and drinkable, but a bit watery on the finish.  Refreshing.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2008 Bottle 0.5 l. Pours cloudy mahogany brown with small-for-a-weizen, but persistent head. Nose is strongly fruity, especially banana. Flavor is fruity, bit sourish and only slightly roasted. Caramel, sweet. Body is smooth with a strangely watery finnish. Light for its kind and alcohol content. Still enjoyable. Re-rate: This time I found it much more enjoyable. Fresh and even surprisingly bitter rather than sweet. Didnt notice the body to be watery either. Much better than the original tasting (6/4/63/10:2.9).

Bottle, split with after4ever. Pours hazy brown with a fluffy white head. Medium body and light carbonation. Nice nutty flavor with a touch of banana. I think we should have led off with this one rather than letting it bring up the rear.

Pours a dull milk chocolate brown with a large foamy off-white head.  Wonderful aroma of banana-bread and cinnamon.   Flavor is not nearly as  good as the regular Hefe.  Something about the sweetness just really overpowers the dark malt... and without the dark malt what is the point of a dunkelweizen?  This beer frustrates me, because I really want to taste those roasted malts...bah.
12oz bottle... cloudy with a nice head.  slightly alcoholy smell.  dont let this get warm as it gets bad fast...
Tap. Cloudy brown with thick white head. Nice spicy fruit aroma. Thick spicy fruit taste, gorgeous body. Pleasing aftertaste. A fine dunkelweizen.

Thanks to Salü in Wolfsburg, Germany! Cloudy deep amber coloring with a two fingers of head. Sweet, smooth, tasty. Easy on the palate. Easily has a taste of banana. In parts of Germany it is not uncommon for this beer to be drank with banana juice poured into it before being drank. Quite tasty.

Nice cloudy deep amber brown, with three fingers of rich foamy off-white head. Aroma is bright and yeasty, with a touch of caramel. Flavor is wheaty and malty, mostly on one level. Fairly one dimensional, but sold with good rich sugars and creamy yeast notes. Palate is watery, but lingers with a touch of honey. Highly drinkable

The very definition of a dunkleweizen, this beer is exactly what youre looking for if a sweet, aromatic, smooth, dark wheat beer is what you crave.
One of the best things about this beer, you can buy it almost anywhere in the US.
You see, there ARE good things about mega beer distributions!

Pours dark amber/brown very cloudy. Large foam head, lasting. Aroma of dark wheat and, hops, and a tinge of alcohol. Mouthfeel is sorta thick. Flavor is dominated by apple, wheat, and banana. Very fruity.

Pours a cloudy dark apple cider color with a small white head.  A strong nose of bitter banana liqueur and spices.  A very sweet artificial banana flavor and finishes with a ton of clove.  Medium bodied and refreshing.  Not my favorite style, but pretty tasty.

Pours a deep amberbrown with a big foamy head. Smells of wheat bread and malt. Maybe a little alcohol. Tastes more of the same, caramel malt and a brief hop finish. Tatses a little like flat coke. O.K. but I wont drink again unless paired with the right food.

500, capped and foiled. Pours slightly hazy dark brown with a thick, moussy tan head. Intermittent lace above. Nice brown bread nose. Medium body, a bit on the light side, with very little palpable carb. Mild sweet brown bread and nuts shine through. Brief bready finish. Tasty, understated, but capable of surviving the transatlantic journey.
Brown clear colour with a large foamy head. Nice wide malty taste with roastiness. Aroma has some spices and chocolate. A slightly light body. Very innovating, indeed.
Bottled. Much better  than the usual Franziskaner. CLoudy brown with a citrus taste, inter alia.

Poured from 1 pint 9 oz. bottle into a stein. Poured a very big head and a nice citrus aroma. It was a nice light brown color on pour. The citrus smell was nice original taste is very nice and smooth but it doesnt stick on the palate long - in that is the let down.

Murky brown, medium head (as for weizen standards). Aroma of lemon, apples, cherry bubblegum, caramel and yeast. The flavor is less intense than expected, a little lemon-like acidity (wheat) and a touch sweet (caramel); nothing riveting here. I miss the freshness of weizen I enjoy so much. As for the palate, a bit watery. I suspect this sample is not young. Ive had better dunkel weizen, for instance Weihenstephaner...

500ml - Red liquid under light tan head, smoky like a Rauch.  As for flavor all I could picture was a pulled pork sandwich, but not  totally dominant as there was also some banana present.  Texture was oily.

Bottle. Tanx to Tjalve!!
A brownish body and begie head. Aroma and flavor is yeasty and sweet. Also some candylike malt. Also some burnt sugar. Thin.
Its darker than the original. The aroma is yeasty with some spicies. The flavor is similar to the original - I couldnt find any noteable changes besides the colour from the original.
Bottle. Pours light brown with huge head. Banana in aroma with some candy and spices. Banana, wheat and maybe a little caramel in the mouth. Great mouthfeel.

500 ml. Translucent darkish brown with a large head that lasts forever. Earthy spices,  mellow banana, and some tangy-spicy citrus in the aroma. Flavor is big banana, clove, cinnamon, and caramel with some finishing touches of lemon juice and spicy bubblegum. Light-medium body is astringent, dry and tingly.
Flaske. lot skum på en klassisk dunkel. Kraftig duft af banan. Smagen er også overvejende banan, men med en friskhed og bid fra karboneringen gør at den fungerer rigtig godt. Dejlig øl.

Had this at The Spaten Brau Stuberl, Munchen, Germany, 24-01-08   Poured murky brown with large off-white head. Yeast and banana on nose and also yeast and banana in mouth but allied to the yeast and banana fest there is also a real good yeasty and fruity flush, quite enjoyable.

Bottled poured into a weizen glass.  FH-WD pours medium to light brown with a large head.  The beer is murky but I dont see any beer pulp.  The aroma is heavy on the malt with a very faint banana smell.  This is a surprisingly light tasting beer for a dunkle.  It has a great refreshing flavor of pears, apples and bananas.  The malt tones down the fruitiness of the beer to something that is delightful and thirst quenching.  The body of this beer is light and quick to leave the mouth making it water for more.

Boa dunkel Cheiro frutado - mangas verdes. Aparência boa, caramelo escuro com boa formação de espuma. Leve doce no sabor. Um pouco aveludada, caramelo no sabor e um pouco frutada (novamente mangas verdes.

April 2006 - Trying to salvage a bad beer evening by going to something reputable. Beer poured a dark rusty color with a freaking beautiful big brown head...nice lacing as well. These dunkels are growing on me. The aroma and flavor were wheaty and malty...malt-ball type malt, not generic beer sweet malty. Clove, pepper and other spices were there. The flavors blended much better as it warmed. I prefer the Hacker-pschorr dunkel, but this was good...and it salvaged an otherwise disastrous beer session with my dad.
pretty tasty.  had in 17oz bottle - nice color and interesting flavors.  not as good as i expected but i still enjoyed.  Would like to have this on tap.  Spaten Co made beer
On tap in Innsbruck 25 Jun 07. Unclear. Grayish-brown color. A small bubbling head. Aroma of citrus. An OK wheat beer.
Dark pour, Well defined palate and lighter than I thought it would be. Slight smokiness to the malt, and some nice fruitiness in the flavour. Rich finish but clean. Much better than I expected.

Bottle in Germany. I think this was my favorite beer I had in Germany. Pours a dark golden hue with foamy off white head. A bit stronger than most with a sweetness that hits home. Rich mothfeel and semi sweet finish rounds off nicely.

Rated first time: 25 November 2006; second time 5 December 2006; third time 27 December 2007. 
Bottle 500 ml, brown, no info about the extract of wort. 
After rating it three times the worst dunkel weizen Ive ever had for sure and the thinest. Poor job of Munchen. 
Appearance: Pours reddish brown (but more towards brown). Munich dark malted barley in colour, cloudy-hazy body with medium, definitely not lively carbonation, manifesting itself in a weak grey and really small, hopeless head, quickly and almoust completely disappearing what is surprising in a negative way as for that style of beer poured into a properly prepared weizen glass. No lacing, forget it !!!
Aroma: As compared to Schofferhoffer Dunkelweizen aroma is less intensive, rather weak, some hidden notes of toasted barley malt, Munich dark malt, weak aroma of burned suggar and some yeasts. You really have to do your best to find out what this faint aroma really presents. Much more simplified aroma than for example Schofferhoffer Dunkelweizen being also very far from the best. 
Flavour: Very weak and  generally wattery, some sweetness from white sugar and Munich malt, weak and poor, boring and uninteresting, some notes of vanilla, dust, reminding a cheap plonk among beers in its simple and strong effervescence and accidity and poor palate. Very flat and short finish, flat and withought character. 
Palate: Body is light, texture is wattery with unpleasant notes of simple white sugar sweetness, almoust like a tap water containing melted white sugar, a bit dull and heavy. Definitely NEGATIVE. Palate apart from veak banana hints in nose is practically non existant, again like palate of carbonated mineral water with sugar. Still drinkeable (when you have only one) and NOT REPULSIVE, serving an interesting experience what a dunkelweizen can be.
Draft at Yard House.  Brown color with some off-white head.  Banana, sweet malt, and wheat in the aroma.  The flavor is the same, a little bit roasted, but mostly sweet.  Good beer.
Dark and thick pour with a predominate banana/wheat taste. Malt accents. Wheat bears are not my favorite, but this was decent.
Creme marrom-claro, persistente e consistente. O aroma segue o sabor típico de mel, banana, cravo e fermento. Final longo, doce e lupulado. Presença de malte torrado. Ótima.

Poured into a stein, so cant comment on the appearance too much.  From what I can see, nice head formation.  Very foamy and decent lacing.  Aroma has banana notes, somewhat wheaty.  Very similar to the original.  Spicy flavor, tastes very much like the aroma with a sickly banana finish.  Very strong finish (and not in a pleasant way if you dont like the wheat taste).  Did not like this beer.  May be good in its style, but its nothing Ill drink again.
Dirty brown with a nice head. The aroma has notes of wheat malt. The flavour is slightly sweet with discrete notes of wheat, caramel and fruit. I prefer the original version.

Used to drink this all the time. Id go down to Kaufland at the Potsdamer Hauptbahnhof and get it for like 60 cents a bottle. I love this beer and it brings back some good memories of my time back in Deutschland.

Drank a lot of this over a period of three weeks in Berlin. Bottle: like the set-up: the slow pour crusty thick head. Didnt like as much when I bought it in the States though. Fruity, slightly smoky and of course a bit wheaty. Cleaner than anticipated. I can drink this all day.

Slight spiciness, banana, clove and pepper aroma. 
Taste is creamy banana and touch of mild white pepper. 
Lingers with sweet banana and pepper.  
Decent, but not amazing.
Bottle - pours a dense brown color with a thick white head. Medium-bodied with a soft mouthfeel, wheaty flavor, slightly dry finish, slight banana character. Smooth and OKAY.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2008 Ahhhhh....there it is...I miss you....Loved this beer...Had it at one of my fav. German resteraunts....After watching the bar maid poor I knew I was in for something I had been waiting for.....Poored a deep hazy copper with thick head. I started drinking....nice hints of clove and bannana with a great dark malty taste with hint of slight citris....I think it had terrific flavor and bitter hops...Highly recommend this beer.

It pours and very good, frothy head. It looks dark and amber brown and very inviting. Smells like a good hefeweizen with hints of orange mixed with the roasted dark barely malts. Mouthfeel was very good. Its drinkability wasnt quite as good as its counterpart-the regular hefeweizen. Still very nice.
Ein super Bier, das muss ich sagen. Vom ersten bis zum letzten Schluck ein Genuss. Würde ich sofort wieder trinken.
a tasty brew... labeled the "banana bread beer" by friends, the aroma and color are instantly inviting. head for days and days. saliva-inducing leaves you wanting more.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2007 Bottled.  The aroma is sweet & roasty.  The body is amber in color with the head having a banana like color.  The flavor is nice and balanced a bit sweet with many different notes coming thru with a cider-like aftertaste.  It looks like it would be thicker & creamer as it rolls over your tounge but is actually watery.  Overall a nice beer that will not bloat you if you have a couple of them.

Bottled. Turve brown color with a nice fluffy white head. Fruity aroma with bananas notes. Flavor is fruity as well. High Carbonation and a little bit watery. Mouthfell is Sweet and spicy.Portyguês: Cerveja Marrom turva com uma excelente espuma branca e duradoura. Aroma frutado com notas de banana. Sabor frutado também e com alta carbonatação e um pouco aguada. Retrogosto é picante e doce.

Another one as part of a BJCP training session that I was somewhat surprised to see I hadnt rated.  Hazy deep amber.  Bready and clove aroma, some toast.  Flavor is bready with balanacing notes of clove, banana, vanilla, and faint bubblegum.  Perhaps not the most over the top beer, but enjoyable.
Good beer. A little bitter and soft on carbonation. Nice color and creamy head.
Pours a gravity defying head on a rick copper red concoction.  Bananas and cloves and a little sweet.  Marvellous.
[Sampled in 2004.] Pretty good in the heat, but not that bad a beer althought betterones can be found round the corner.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2009 500ml bottle. 
Reddy brown, self-supporting head. Sweet malt and molasses backdrop to the aroma - details of orange and other fruits. Pleasant carbonation.  Smooth succulent palate. Taste of rich malts, molasses, very drinkable.

Full bottle poured into a Weizen. Pours a hazel amber with a tight woven fluffy off white head of epic proportions! Aroma is slightly malty, esters, cloves, and bread. 

Taste is near identical with a touch too much carbonation which causes my mouth to become watery. Slightly banana with an overtone of clove, spices and bread. Yeasty aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a hazy caramel color with huge frothy head. Aroma is doughy with some sweet yeast and sweetish malt. Flavor is very lgiht with a hint of grainy malt. Some astringent bitterness and sourness in the finish. Mouthfeel alternates between cream, bubbly and watery. Not my favorite rendition of the style, but an ok beer overall.
Heavy malty aroma. Huge creamy, off-white head. Excellent lacing. Fully lasting longevity. Cloudy yellow body. Light bitter initial flavor. Light to medium palate and a watery texture.

(bottle): Pours a medium brown color, cloudy. Big foamy creamy head, cream colored, very lasting. Malty sweet aroma, light, some roasted scents. Light fresh taste, malty, sweet. Somewhat a floral taste & aftertaste.
Dark brown color w/beige head.  Aroma is fruity banana, cloves.The flavor is a banana, yeasty and fruity. Yeasty finish, quite nice.

Bottle... Poured an unfiltered, milk chocolate tone with a nice frothy white head.  Roasted malt aroma.  Smooth body with the refreshing wheat beer characteristics, but with the tartness from the added malt.  Almost like candy.
Pours a muddy brown with a thick cream-coloured head. Low estery aroma. Wheaty estery palate with a little bread crust.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bttle brought back from Europe. Poured into a weizen on 08-07-07. 2 finger creamy tan head and a dark cloudy brown gold color. Big wheat smell with coriander and light banana to compliment it. Lemon with malt and wheat initially. More lemon, a light chocolate malt presence afterwards. Decent carbonation and a bit watery on the body. Very drinkable...not terribly exciting. I prefer the original to this.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 A little olfactory off on the lid pop. Clears to a rather atttractive alky candy smell in the glass. Big 16.9 oz bottle, nice serving size as a sample. Unfiltered swirling hypnotizing hazy  pour. Beatiful and desirable in appearance. A little browner and more opaque than iced tea. Big foaming head that does not subside apon empty bottle. Initial flavors of numbing soda pop. Crispy grassy tang. No bitterness can easily be found. Very refined, fun and friendly. Towards the end of the session some farmhouse impact coats the back of the palate. Enjoyable, friendly and easy going. Nice! This beer is a good example of what beer can be without the bitter attributes of hop or malt. .
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: UPDATED: AUG 18, 2010 explosive head that rose tall and settled dense and creamy. hazy brown with soft clove aroma. salty undertones light bodied simple  081810  Poured much better this time, looked great.  Ripe squishy banana aroma, little roasted as banana bread.  No off flavors, smooth and continues with the dark wheat and subtle banana, little spice in the finish.
From a bottle poured a dark hazy amber color withlots of head.  Good citrusy hefe flavor with a more malty flavor.

500ml bottle: I didnt see how the head was, because the bartender did poor job when pouring this berer :-/. Colour is dark copper, blurry. Aroma is sweet with dates and banana. Flavour: Also sweet with banana, raisin... very fruity beer. Aftertaste is watery tho

The Franciscans know how to brew beer, but dark beers are not my favorite.  Nevertheless, this beer has a good flavor without overdosing with the burnt malt like many dunkels.  It does not have the usual complexity of fruity notes in the flavor and nose that paler hefe weizenbiers have, but it is tasty and pleasing with a pretty strong aftertaste.  It also has one hell of an ivory-colored head.

Very dark copper in color. Strongly carbonated with a full and frothy white head. Typical hefe aroma, but more pronounced. Lots of banana, apricot, and pear with hints a caramel and fresh yeast. This is not my favorite style, but a good fall hefe and an easy drinking brew.
Not as good as their regular version. Maybe slighty bitter compared to their other Hefe.
user_location: Heart of the Rockies, Colorado, USA

text: OK, now Franziskaner Hefe Weisse is my favorite beer right now.  But this one is not quite as sweet and savory.  This beer is, of course, dark and brown.  Pours and looks like a hefe.  But the sweet banana is not so prounounced.  The feel is more carbonaton and malt going down, and a dry finish.  Good beer, but next trip to the liquor store, Ill pass on this one, and get the plain Franziskaner Hefe.  For my money, I prefer the Schneider if I have to have a darker hefe.
Bottled. Hazy oak/brown colour, white thick head. Aroma of raisins and tobacco. Taste fresh of fruit, banana? Meidum-strength finish.

purchased at red apple in bremerton, washington.
pours a cloudy brown with a tint of orange, 3 fingers off-white foamy head, the foam stays around and craws up the glass.
smell is of fermented grass, yeast, some wheat, alcohol, 
taste is wheat, caramel, bar-b-q banana, roasted malts, leaves the mouth with a creamy feel.
Pours with a massive ice cream liek head and smells of cloves, cinnamon, and caramel...nice rough mouth feel and good malty finish,
Would not reccomend this brew. Very watered down yet sour. Had a very hard time finishing this one.
Cloudy, cocoa brown color; head remains; aroma of hefe(bananas); flavor is grainy(wheat) w/ some hint of fruity tartness.  Flavor fades quickly.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2008 Bottle up sweet wheat bier, some extra malty goodness with a touch of banana and yeast and youre ready to fire down Bavarian-style.  Franziskaner is one of my favorites.  Ive re-rated this because I found it on tap at the Gnome last weekend.

Bottle from Country Club Liquors; Nose of Wheat, caramel, and my favorite hefe fruit, banana; dark copper with a bigbeige head; flavor of pepperiness, caramel, and fruitiness (mostly banana). Enjoyable session brew!
nice brown yellow color on the pour with a little bit of lacings.  no real smell in the bar.  very good taste, sweet but not too sweet.
Pretty good. Much more malty and less spicy than the regular hefeweizen which I like better. Mostly roasted caramel malt and wheat flavor. The flavor was a little boring.

Pours a cloudy/opaque full brown color with a milky white head.  The roasted malt taste definitely comes through alongside the yeasty-wheat taste that is to be expected of a hefeweizen.  Had this one alongside a German sausage... delicious.

1pt. 0.9 fl. oz. bottle.

A nice dunkelweizen from the country who invented them. Aroma of wheat and banana. Pour was a nice deep brown with just a tad of an off white head. Taste was just like a hefe. Banana arom comes in as you sip and the air is thick. Taste was mostly wheat with a tangy yeast taste in the aftertaste. OK dunkelweizen
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Tap at random resturant while taking a break from random Munich wanderings on 9-29-07.   Might have been the proper weizen glass, but this looked way better than the regular Franziskaner weissbier -- dark cloudy brown with a fluffy white head.   yeast, banana, and tart aroma.   Cleaner, crisper taste too, with more roastiness in combo with the typical banana sweetness.   Thicker, heavily carbonated body.   Refreshing slight bitterness.   German weissbier is rekindling my fondness for wheat beers.
Large foamy white head, cloudy unfiltered red brown body. Sweet odd aroma like cooked vegetables. Taste is sweet with some hop bitterness as well as some friut and candy.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2008 Garrafa. Coloração marrom/âmbar, muito turva. Creme bege consistente e razoavelmente persistente. Presença de "berlotes" depositados no fundo do copo. Notas de cravo, canela e banana. Carbonatação média. Refrescante.

Smells wheaty with some banana.  Looks really murky with a nice white head with big bubbles.  Tastes quite a bit like the regular Hefe, not much more malt or roasted flavors or anything like that.  Less fruity than the Hefe, kind of more subdued.  Not as carbonated or refreshing, either.  Not bad, but kind of disappointing.

Aroma of biscuit, wheat, banana, spice. Hazy ripe stone fruit color (reddish amber?) with a head that filmed quickly. Full bodied with creamy carbonation. The yeast seems to be clove, with perhaps a bit of cardamom. Theres banana in there, as well as wheat, and something darkly malt - but probably dark wheat. It feels great. The finish is smooth, clove, darkish wheat malt. Not crisp, but very clean. Its wonderful.

Hazy light brown. Small, creamy, light tan head. Aroma of lightly tangy wheat, bready and toasty malt, lightly zesty yeast. Same flavors. Bready malt drops off in the finish leaving just the zesty yeast character. Would like a little better follow through on the end, but its not a big deal. Medium body. Well carbonated while remaining very soft and easy to drink. Pretty good.
Pours out a cloudy light brown color with a thick beige head.  Aroma is grainy and like bread.  Flavor was sweet and spicy with a bit of bannana to it.  Over all a nice refreshing beer.

The Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel is a damn fine dunkelweizen! Its got that nice, murky, brown gravy look, quickly dissipating head, and thick yeasty/wheaty palate. The finish is nice and sugary with some tasty estery qualities, mostly spicy cloves, but the banana cant be counted out. The Franziskaner dunkelweizen is still crisp, but maybe not as much of a summer beer as a straight-up hefe. Of course, who cares? This would be good summer or winter.
Bottle, 50 cl. Thx to Leen. Hazy amber-brown color, with white head. Aroma  malts (littles roasted), yeast. Medium body. Taste bit spices, caramel to, malts.

Unfortunately the cloudy brown appearance looks like sewer water but thats the only negative thing to say about this beer. Aroma is sharp & spicy with a little sweetness coming through. Taste is sharp and refereshing and is well balanced by the malty sweetness that is also present (although less prominent). It feels great in the mouth and would make a great session beer.
Brown colour with big head.Looks muddy and has some taste of rosted wheat and note of banana.Fresh finish.

Pours a very muddy murky red brown. Aroma of a little roasted wheat and a little clove. Not too aromatic. Flavor is a nice sweet roasted wheat with a little chocolate, a little banana, and some clove. Definitley yeasty. Rather thin in body. Very carbonated. Rather refreshing.

bottle. pours hazy auburn with small white head. nose is very yeasty and bready, bananas and biscuit. flavor is bready, bananas, and yeasty with a biscuity finish. mouthfeel is watery but palate is long, a pretty solid dunkelweizen.

I like this even better than the regular helles - typical Bavarian weiss cloudy with a nice yeasty head to it.  Even nicer spicier taste - cloves, bit of banana, etc.  Some might consider the taste a bit odd for a beer, but give it a chance.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 
Name: Franziskaner Dunkel
Date: January 01, 1995
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting
Appearance: big head
Aroma: light wheat aroma
Flavor: rich wheat flavor

Name: Franziskaner Dunkel
Date: November 17, 2004
Appearance: opaque dark amber with rusty highlights, whispy head
Aroma: slightly sweet yeasty aroma
Flavor: light malt flavor, touch of clove, barely a hint of banana, no chocolate
Overall: tasty but not exciting

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20
Rating: 2.7/5.0Score: *4

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Draft@ Fox and Hound, Philly. Murky  brown body, capped with a tall, frothy off-white head that filled the hefe glass. Aroma of wheat, malt, orange, and spice. Wheat flavor with some malt, orange, banana, and spice. Really nice dunkel weisse; very refreshing.
500 ml bottle from Bevmo.  Copper brown with a fizzy white head.  Sweet wheat bread aroma.  Slightly sweet banana bread taste, refreshing.

I poured this into my 50cl glass to reveal a brown-dark red ale that had a good head o top and a wavy skirt of bubbles below. The first taste had a roundness to it that just rolled off my tongue and the caramel elements were up front. This was pretty good and on tap should be better.

Poured a cloudy brown with a large head.  Detected a spicy sweet aroma like the scents you would smell during Christmas.  Flavor is yeasty with an aftertaste of gingerbread.  As it warmed it developed a bananas and brown sugar flavor.  Totally awesome!  Overall, this beer is great but better consumed during fall/winter seasons.
Bottle.Cloudy brown with off white head.Aroma of bananas and brown sugar.Spicy semi-sweet and bitter finish.Medium body.Ok.

.5 L.     Dunkelweizen...   ok the wheat is there it looks like a wheat beer should in the glass yet the semi sweet body somehow misses the mark.  It is not thin but lacks the Umph that expected from Franzisakaner.  The head rolls with gusto and gets into place fast but fails to enthrall my nose.

Bottled 50cl. It pours a hazy orange brown beer with a rather big and nicely lasting slightly tanned head. The ABV of my version was 5.0 if Im not mistaken. The aroma is of yeast, cane sugar, syrup and malt. Some bubble gum and mint. The taste is very smooth, highly spicy, quite wheaty and corny with a decent amount of lemon. Caramel. Some cinnamon and nuts in the finish. Slightly sour.

Hazy brown with thin white head.  Aroma is spicy and sweet with a bit of ginger and bready yeast.  Taste is same, but somewhat thinner than I expected. Cut back on the H2O, and this would be a fine product.  $3/16oz

Bottiglia da 50cl comprata allIper di Serrapalle Scrivia; versa birra maron con usuale schiuma abbondante di colore beige chiaro. Aroma simile a quello della hefe normale, lievito e banana anche nel sapore, mentre gli aromi scuri cioccolatosi e tostati sono troppo in secondo piano. Molto piacevole ma meriterebbe un po di coraggio in più.
Very drinkable, very smooth.  Purchased the bottle in the picture for a mere $1.79.   Whats not to like about that?

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2007 6/30/07 On draught at the Seattle International Beerfest.  Aroma is sour wheat malt forward with orange and light pepper.  Appearance is a cloudy medium brown with a good off-white head.  Flavor is sour, peppery esters forward followed by light wheaty, bready malt.  Mouthfeel is low/medium bodied with a low carb feel but a good, solid grainy texture.  Overall, theres just nothing really here to object to, its easy drinking as always.  9/12/07 From the bottle. Aroma is peppery esters forward with malty sweetness and light toast, followed by light vanilla and banana tones.  Appearance is hazy brown with an off-white head.  Flavor is banana/bubblegum forward with a good graininess and light bittering.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a solid carb feel and a light creaminess.  Overall, a very good brew that is both easy drinking and has a bit of everything.

Bottle, bought at SKY, Süderlügum, DE. Pours a very muddy greyish brown with a relatively small yellowish creamy head. Aroma has lots of banana, a little cocoa and caramel. Nice, creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, some roasted caramel with some distant chocolate. A little sharp bitterness at the end. Nice.
bottle:  Nice malty smoothness to this one.  Full bodied as well.  I am starting to like Dunkels.
Bottle. Cloudy, medium brown with a big off-white head. Yeasty aroma of cloves and toffee. Flavour was of bananas with a grainy mouth feel. A bit dull.

500 ml bottle. Poured an unfiltered cloudy dirt brown with an ample off white head that dissapated slowly. Aroma was distinct with sweet cloves and earthiness. Flavor was complex with bananas, cloves, cinnamon, and wheat. Mouthfeel was full and soapy. Finish was a bit too filmy and sticky for my preference. Overall this is a very interesting beer.
Nice wheat - yeasty but tasted a bit dated (a rather dull yeast, but not unpleasant - could be the shelf life in the store) - worth the $ for a summer evening...

Bottle as shown. Poured a cloudy orange/brown color with a thick off white head. The aroma is banana and malt. The taste is about the same as the aroma, malty and banana. Not as good as some other dunkels ive tried but decent.
scura note tostate calde nota di lieviti molto frizzante meno rinfrescante della versione chiara
Bottel.50cl. slite alkohol aroma, and pepper. Small amount of maltyness too small. I have had better.

A little disappointed with this one.  I mistakenly grabbed a dunkel instead of the regular hefeweizen.  Fairly dark  in color - light passes through it.   Decent on the palate.  But nothing really distincitive about this one as far as taste goes.  A bit malty. Their regular hefeweizen is an awesome brew - one of the best for the price.  This dunkel was a bit on the sour side as far as after-taste goes.  Drinkable but not a special experience.
Pours cloudy amber with a small white head.Very nice nose like aproicot.Sour flavor with a very nice effervesent palate.

Pours a cloudy brown with an off-white head.  Aroma of chocolate, citrus, and banana.  Taste is the same, with a somewhat dry aftertaste.  Flavor on the whole is weak; this is definitely not in the same league as their wonderful hefeweizen or other dunkels Ive tried.
500 ml bottle.  Pours a nice deep orangeish-brown with a big off-white head.  Flavors of wheat/yeast, and spice.  Nice refreshing beer for after work on a Friday.

16.9oz bottle served in a Weizen. Pours a cloudy amber brown body with a big, pillowy light tan head. Head resolves to a ring that stays around the length of the beer, no lacing to speak of. Aromas of malts, yeast, dark fruits, figs, pears, biscuit dough. Flavors of clove, banana, dark fruits, malts, dough, caramel, yeast. Finish is a bit watery, medium length, and sweet. Palate is a bit thin as well, medium carbonation. Light to medium astringency. Solid.
on tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. Pours an unattractive cloudy light brown. Maltier version of their hefe. bit more banana & bready flavor than the hefe but overall pretty good
50cl bottle, brought back from a trip to Spain. Pours a nice cloudy brownish colour with a big foamy head.
500ml bottle-pours an off white head and cloudy orange/brown color.  Aroma is dark wheat, secondary spice-banana, clove.  Taste is dark wheat, secondary spice-banana, clove.
Pours the same color of a dunkleweizen. Tastes very similiar minus the banana taste. Big foamy head that persists throughout. Very yeasty and has a watery finish. Weak.

Pours Chustnut brown with GIANT pillowy, foamy head.  Yeasty wheat aromas on the nose, as well as subtle hints of banana, vanilla.  Smooth, rounded taste, bready/wheaty on the palate, with definate notes of banana.  Finishes well with a litght echo of spicey pepper at the end.

Aroma is nice and strong and malty, some hints of yeast. Pours an interesting orangy-brown amber with a fairly thick and persistent head. Flavor is well-rounded, malty and wheaty with a strong undertone of lemon. Very smooth and refreshing, one of the best hefe-weisses I have ever tried.

Big bottle.  Brownish-orange pour with fantastic creamy head.  Aroma and flavor of toasted malt, clove, and banana.  Only had one other dunkelweizen before and wasnt impressed so my expectations were low, but this was one fine tasting beer.  Definitely recommend.
Im not a big fan of dark hefe, but this one is superb. Those monks were on to a good thing. My second favourite German beer only behind Paulaner Weissbeer.
UPDATED: JUN 26, 2007 decent dark hefe, the bananess gets kind of annyoing after youve had a few and makes it very taste specific
a brown orange with a light head that slow dissipates. smells of maple orange and grain. has a bizarre flavor of burnt, smoked oysters. not bad tasting just interesting

Pours a cloudy brownish orange with an average creamy/bubbly off white head that left some lacing.  Aroma of banana, clove, some toasted malts.  Flavors of the same...sweet and lightly toasty.  Very well done.
Bottle. Unclear brown colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt and fruit.
Hazy brown color with a medium white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Malty with lots of fruit and some sweetness. Medium body with a sweet finish.

Bottle.  Warm June day- perfect for a weissbier.  Smooth, sweet, nutty.  Nice brown color with cream white head, which remained entire time.  Not as tart as a non-dunkel hefe- definately malty-er.  Really nice beer.

On tap at Hessen Haus.  Pours a murky brown with a thick lasting head and very good lacing.  Nose is banana with roasted malt and some yeast.  Taste is wheat a banana.  Mouthfeel is lively with a nice chewiness.  Finishes a little dry and somewhat bitter.  Great session brew!

On tap @ the Saloon in DC. Colors a milk-choco brown with a thick, off-white head that aint goin nowhere. Serious aroma of chocolate malt and ripe banana, wow. More bananner in flavor, roasty-malty with some root beer notes. But its a touch sour instead of sweet or bitter, and it finishes a bit dry. Really enjoyed this beer a lot.
Bottle.  Pours a muddy brown with a good head.  Smells of wheat and fruit, especially banana.  Tastes too much of banana but not as overpowering as their hefe hell.  Smooth.
Bottle. Pours a brown bod with a great head. Definitive aroma of yeast and solid interesting taste. I prefer other franziskaners to this one.
Bottle at Corroboree, Berlin. Mud colour. Tall foam. Spicy, oaky aroma. Lemony and bananas. Full-bodied Dunkel.

Pours a cloudy root beer brown with a large  rocky head. The aroma is a strong banana and roasted malts. I have never sampled a beer that smells more like ripe bananas than this one. I like bananas. The mouthfeel is light, slick and soft. Very nice. The flavor follows the nose: sweet roasted malts followed by bananas and light wheat. The finish is smooth and sweet. Quite tasty.

Bottle.  Beautiful muddy brown; unfiltered.  Huge head.  Nice aroma of honey, banana, and spice.  Beer is fizzy; found it too much so.  Refreshing with some present alcohol astringency.  Definitely a quality Dunkelweiss.

Lightish muddy brown pour with an impressively rocky head of suds. Slightly woodsy snout with hints of toffee and banana. Buttery malt sweetness, toffee apple, banana and a pinch of clovey pepper in the finish. Faintly smoky as it warms. Quality Dunkel.

Aroma is spicy, sour, and grainy. It pours a cloudy brown. My son says it looked like diarrhea. Thick pale head and light lacing. Taste is sour with vanilla notes. There was a biting aftertaste that was akin to radishes, but with some decently balanced hops. I expected much more.

Rather highly carbonated and of a hazy cider appearance. Zest wheat aroma and pleasant, but subdued yeasty notes with lightly playing sweet banana and musk. Medium-bodied with easy meld of wheat clove flavors that is quite enjoyabl.e Balance is decidedly tipped in favor of the phenolics (cloviness) rather than banana.
Pours a dark opaque brown with a off white head. Has nice lacing. Has hints of roasted malts, caramel, spices, citrus fruit. Finishes with a nice malt and spice flavor that sticks to the tongue.

Bottle.  Pour is an occluded wood brown with hints of dark orange around the edges, with an almost white head.  Good balance of the hearty grain flavors of wheat  and dark malts.  Reminds me of autumn trips to the farmers market.  Excellent dunkelweiss - which I would expect from Franziskaner.

Hazy brown pour with a tall rocky head.  Fruity, wheat, banana, yeast aroma.  Wheat and sweet malt body with a nice dry banana finish.  Medium-full body, very creamy.  Would make for a nice slightly heartier version of a hefe for the summer.
Very good but not as good as the hefe-weiss.  Still a good caramel flavored weiss that has the bubblegum and banana flavors I love in a hefe.

Bottled. a cloudy red/brown beer with agiant and persistent beige foam. Fruity and yeasty aroma. Light acidic taste with notes of cloves. Not a very strong body. Quite good, but I prefer the pale version.

16.9 oz. bottle. Powerful bubblegum aroma. Lemon and toffee scents. Yeasty smell. Pours a hazy, light brown with a large amount of thick, frothy, fluffy, cream-colored head. Sharp lemon and milk chocolate flavors. Not very complex but good nonetheless. Little aftertaste. Light to moderate body. Smooth and soft on the palate but lively on the lips. Refreshing and easy to drink. A bit too watery and undercarbonated, preventing a perfect palate score. Like the regular Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier, the dunkel is very satisfying, although I do prefer the paler original. Better in total than the sum of its parts. A feel good beer even if a simple one.

Bottle. Beautiful, dark brown, caramel color. Aroma is much like their helles weiss but, maltier. Nice, fluffy, off-white head. Flavor is also much like the helles weiss but, with a maltier, darker taste. A very good dunkelweiss.

500 ml bottle from Sams Wine and Spirits (i think).  Pours a hazy amber color with a tall fluffy beige head.  Yeasty esters raisins red fruits, brown sugar, pretty decent.  Similar on the tongue raisins, red fruit, with chocolate, carmel, and bread.  Lightly carbonated,  decent beer.

the banana and the gummy candy touch with the slight astringent seperator makes this a tasters brew. makes you easily want another. the cloudiness adds to a german mystery. good body and the slightly chalky mouthfeel works well in this beer. really, someone made a truly eloquent brew here.

Malty, with an aroma of toffee. Creamy and satisfying at the palate, with a peppery - cinnamon finish... One of my all-time favorite wheats. (And it is 100% fabulous on tap, too - way better than from the bottle!)
500ml bottle from Munich. Excellent fruity/spicy hefe aroma. Chocolate malt notes in aroma and flavour. Similar to Weihenstephan. Great beer.

500 ml bottle in weizen glass. Nicely dense off-white head. Strong banana-clove aroma atop a cloudy honey-gold color. Flavor is mostly a banana bread push with a strong citrus element. The only problem is that the body is really lacking for a dunkel. Were this a straight hef, I might rank it higher, because its quite a tasty brew, but I was hoping for more from this one. The price wasnt bad at the local Tacoma Boys market, so I might try it again later in the summer.

500ml bottle.  Poured into a small weizen.  Cloudy deep amber with a huge almond color meringue head.  Cereal malt aroma with underlying banana yeast note.  A trace of spice on the nose as well.  Dark bread malt and banana flavor, with a bit of lemony tartness. While there is fair bit of fine carbonation, it tastes slightly  watery in the palate.  Underwhelming.
Nice big head with a wheaty aroma and a nice soft taste with a lingering aftertaste, a very surprising beer as I didnt think much of it when I bought it

Pours with a dark gold honey color and a head that be be very large depending on the pour.  An aroma that loses something from the roasted malts as they tend to dominate.  Some spices, bread, light body.  Not bad but I prefer the regular Hefe.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2007 This beer looks like a typical hefe-weisse, only darker. Aroma is heavenly, with fruits, spices, yeast, and chocolate malt all present. Flavor is much the same. This is somewhat bitter up front. Well carbonated. Dry finish. Not my favorite, but a great wheat nonetheless.

Poured in a weizen; a murky, orange tinted brown.  Large creamy off white head.  Aroma of yeast/bubblegum, banana, clove, some malt; maybe a little soapy.  Flavor was much of the same, but with a pronounced roasted malt.  Refreshing flavor, crisp; perhaps a little watery.  Good value.
Good beer. nice and sweet, very malty.  Would definitley like to drink this again.
user_location: New York City, New York, USA

text: A great beer, this dunkelweizen has a great aroma of wheat and malt.  For a malt fan, this is a good beer.  It creates a nice off- white head, amber in color, you smell nuts and get a fruit aftertaste.  Basically an excellent wheat beer with a little more flavor.
Excellent beer. Pours a dark hazy brown color with a good head. Im in the mood for one right now. Reasonably priced for all the flavor you are gtting.

Just as the blonde one, be careful when pouring this, or youll have just a lot of foam. Creamy a bit  brownish head, with lot of chunks that go straight to the bottom of the glass, with very long retention, but it doesnt leave lace. Cloudy dark orange colour. Aroma is similar to the blonde, banana, clove, peaches, but with a hint of chocolate, specially if you pour the sediment, and hints of dark fruits. A bit of sweet fruity flavor, taste is similar to the aroma, banana, cloves, peaches, chocolate, dark fruits... and some coriander. Not very strong body, very refreshing and drinkable.
Draft.  Pours dark orange with a large white head.  Smell is clove, yeast, banana.  Taste is that normal hefe taste but a bit watery.  Refreshing and crisp, lacking flavor.  Ordinary but good.

Bottle. Head was large frothy white and was mostly lasting. Good lacing in glass. Body was light cloudy with partials in flow. Color was golden brown. Aroma was wheat, citrus, clove, coriander, banana, caramel. For some reason I felt that some of the malty notes were kind of missing from this Dunkelweizen Light to medium bodied and an average carbonation. Light sweet finish.
Bottle, a very cloudy brown. A yeasty aroma with sweet fruit. A pleasant fruit and wheat flavour.
Pours a dark plum color with an off white 2 finger head. Aromas and flavors of dark fruits, and cloves. Medium to thin palate that was crisp and mildly carbonated.

Hazy brown hue, with a rocky beige head, leaving laces, yeasty, toasted and wheaty malt nose with a fruity accent of fig, raisin an caramelized ripe apples, with some spicy notes of cinnamon and clove, with a subtle fruit wineyness in the arom follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, fruity wheaty character, some toasted and caramel malts, with a hint of smokiness, cinnamon and clove spiciness, with a mellow fresh mouthfeel, with a faint chocolatey accent, and notes of fig, ripe apples and raisin fruitiness, leading towards a wheaty, spicy, mild hop bittering finish.
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2007 Brown/red colour ...  slightly clowdy... big foam head ... banana wheat ... louch of light malt ... very banana fruity ... mellow wheat ... little bubblegum
Cloudy light brown.  Dirty fruit aroma. Dry bland with a slight bannana but not enough. Very lightly spiced flavor. Wouldnt get this again.

Sampled last weekend. Compared to the regular Franziskaner, taste is a lot more sweet. Aroma is similar but appearance is a lot darker brown than normal. Mouthfeel is smooth and consistant with the regular brew. Flavor is more sweet and a little more malty. A great brew but I would probably stick with the regular if I had my choice.

Bottle. malty aroma and a large off-white head. Nice fresh wheet flavor.
Very good weissbier

Sweet, ripe banana in the aroma perhaps even some nuts and... sweet pastries? Surprisingly transparent and much less cloudy than the blonde variety.

The taste reminds me a lot of ice cream I often had as a kid: banana, chocolate and almonds. Really! Might be a slight hint of citrus there too.

It feels a bit thin on the palate and the complexity isnt off the scale, but still, it feels like theyve hit a pretty good compromise between an easy drinking and refreshing brew and something you can delve into.

Solid and pleasant if not great or spectacular.
Pours nicely. But i hated the smell. I hated the taste. I just couldnt bring myself to like it.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2007 By far not the best Dunkel Hefe that I have had and for me this lacks the body of other examples.....but dont get me wrong this is drinkable. Page 169 of Michael Jacksons Great Beer guide only 408 out 500 Classic Brews to go.
Butterscotch, molasses, and fruits in the aroma. Muddy brown appearance with small lasting head. Starts with foam on the palate finishes bitter.

Pours Dark Murky brown with biscuit large colored head. Very malty aroma, mainly a roasted nutty scent. Medium body and smooth going down. Strong flavor of malt - very complex, with banana and spices.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 Bottle - Pours coudy gold, soapy white head. Yeast in the nose with banana and wheat malt. Flavors of fluffy pancakes, bananas, cloves, bubblegum, yeast, fruity, with a mild hops ending. Cest bon!

Bottle. Cloudy dark brown with a beautiful big creamy fully lasting off-white head leaving a very nice good lasting lacing. Aroma of wheat and some roasty maltiness, spices, some caramel. Flavour is fresh, good wheat, dark malts, some banana, good spices. GREAT brew!
Poured dark brown with a tan color head, that was and inch and a half tall.  Bitter malty/bready taste, with a smooth mouthfeel.  Tasty.
Very malty and bready with definate yeasy phenol profile. Very nice that it wasnt to overpowering on the hefe side.
Pours deep amber into a Weizen glass.  Off-white micro head with excellent retention.  Roasted malt aromas.  Dry and crisp with slight clove finish.

Bottle Pours a hazy deep carmel color with a nice head and sturdy lacing. Aroma of malty wheaty bananas. Flavor was a soft unfiltered german hef, but deeper and darker.  Nice combination.  Pretty light on the classic german hef yeast notes. Quite drinkable.  Yummy.

First tried on tap in a Bavarian Cafe in Sydney.   Very nice toffee caramel taste with a hint of banana.   My first Dunkel Weissbier and definitely not my last.  Having a hard time finding this in Minnesota.

.5L Bottle.  Poured medium brown, with good carbonation and a foamy head that settled slowly.  Great flavor and a nice beer overall.  Would recommend this dunkelweizen as a good representation of the class.

Pours a delightful cloudy medium brown color with a thick foamy head that dissapates rather quickly.  A nice light mouth feel with plenty of lasting carbonation.  Yummy mild nutty flavors with hints of pine and lemon.  Light and easy to drink.  Very tasty.

$2.10 for a bottle of this... its a steal... I enjoy this one out of the bottle in the summer, and Im enjoying it now on the coldest day of year.  The carbonation is high and the brown surgar and alcohol flavors dominate. yummy

A nice smooth, dark, rich weissbier.  The color was a deep rich brown.  The flavors were nice, with the tanginess expected from weissbier.  The mouthfeel, especially, was pretty much perfect--thick and creamy without lingering too much.

This bee pours a deep cloudy brown with a tall tan head leaving good lacing down th sides.  On the nose this is a strong spicy wheat aroma like most of the dunkelweizens.  The flavor emulates this, it is very rich smooth and good.  I like this beer, it is very drinkable.  Not very complex, but drinkable.  Cheers!

Pours a cloudy dark brown, with a thick two finger head. The head settles slowly to a thick cap, leaving behind a thick sheet of lace.

Smell; this has a very strong wheat profile, with some mild banana notes. Theres a sweet caramel malt presence that kind of overrides alot of the smells I usually associate with a hefe-weizen.

Taste; the caramel malts are there but not quite as dominant as they are in the aroma. The yeast and wheat flavors come out as well as the typical cloves you would expect, but its a little lacking as far as any banana flavors go. Dont get me wrong, the bananas are there, theyre just weak enough that you have to search for them a bit. Mouthfeel is creamy and medium bodied, and would be easy to put down a few of these.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: (draft @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Cloudy brown pour with a mound of tan head. Aroma is lots of wheat with some roasted malts. Flavor is very sweet and smooth at the beginning with the obligatory wheat and grainy texture in the middle. Very clean finish.
Goood sweet notes, plenty of wheat taste to drink down, I was brewing a dunkle so I   made it my offering to the beer gods. Good dunkle though pretty tasty nice color and sediment.

Ah yes, the Mad Monk.  The first Hefeweizen I tried and indeed the first "good" beer Id ever had.  I was tremendously impressed by this the first time I had it, but have had better Dunkels since then.  Not bad and available almost everywhere.

Pours amber with a big white head.  Smells of roasted caramel with a hint of yeasty hay smell.  Taste is almost entirely malt but not that complex or intense.  The wheaty taste comes in in the aftertaste and is nice.  I enjoyed this beer a good deal.
50 cL. Poors unclear brown. Creamy off-white head. Clear smell of yeast, some malt. Slight caramel notes and slightly watery. Carbonated.

pours murky medium brown with a large off-white head.  Aroma is malty of carmel and yeast notes of leather.  Flavor is sweet and carmel but balanced finishes on the bitter side and short.  Light to medium bodied, watery and livley with a clean finish.

Hazy caramel color like a frappe coffe with a medium-sized off-white head. Typical aroma of a hefe-weissen, fruity with notes of banana, bread and honey. Flavor was a bit tart, of lemon, watery and flatly carbonated.Bottle shared with <a href=http://ratebeer.com/View-User-30044.htm>Pa />

Pours a hazy light brown/orange color. Head is big creamy white with medium retention. It laces pretty well.
Aroma is typical for a Hefe-Weizen: full of fruity esters. It shows notes of banana, vanilla, wheat and light spices. Enticing.
Taste is sweet with a slightly tart finish. It has smooth banana and vanilla flavors with soft herbal notes and a cidery hint in the end.
Very smooth, velvety mouthfeel. Finish is a bit chalky. Low carbonation. Alcohol unnoticeable. A good Dunkelweizen but probably not the best bottle.
Bought in Mendoza, Argentina
Shared with <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/View-User-31163.htm&g />

Standard issue to look at  light chocolate brown with no head to speak of. Sweet wheat beer notes on the nose, quite attractive. Thins out a touch in the palate as some drying characters take hold. Very similar to the Schnieder in this respect but the beer remains very drinkable.
Hazy unclear brown with fine creamy lasting head. Sweet malty taste (roasted) and aroma. Yeasty - wheat. Banana.  Medium body. Easy sweetness and light hops. Very pleasant!

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2007 Pours a cloudy light brown with tints of gold and amber.  Head was off-white and nice and thick.  The aroma was yeasty, spicy and even slightly herbal.  The flavor was spice and herbs followed by a mildly sour finish.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2006  avarage for a dunkelweisen forth, cloud and chestnut brown colour. mild, worse than its light brother. yeasty and sweet(ie).smooth

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy tawny with an average sized frothy off-white lasting head.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, straw, nutty), light hops (grass), average yeast (dough, musty) and banana.  Short duration, light sweetness, acidity and bitterness.  Medium bodied, slick texture, lively carbonation.
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2006 Dark, cloudy amber pour with one of the best heads ever (see photo... ).  Very clean, light spicy flavor.  Cinnamon and nutmeg hints.  Maybe my favorite dunkelweizen.
What I would expect from a dark hefeweizen.  Follows through with solid taste all around.  Medium-heavy body.  It is refreshing with slight roastiness.  Rather decent.

Dark brown with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of shiraz grapes, yeast, banana and sweet caramel. Overcarbonated, but otherwise quite smooth in the mouth... flavours are malt driven, with some spicy hop and brown bread syrup. Medium/long dry, almost sour finish.

Cloudy brown colour with a dense caffe latte head and great retention. Aroma of yeasts mainly, although some notes of roasted malt and banana are well perceived (specially in the beginning).  Medium bodied  with a smooth palate.  Well balanced flavour of wheat roasted malt, caramel, banana and some notes of chocolate. Some watery finish. Easy drinking.

I was walking down the grocery store aisle and i looked over at this two dollar bottle, wow, very very good for two dollars, nice head , but i wouldnt pay more for it, well, if it was on tap then thats a different story!
This is a great beer with a true Bavarian Hefeweizen style.  Great flavor and very rich!
Excellent color, thick head.  Smooth taste with a hint of malt.  Definitely would drink again.

Bottle. Poured with lots of carbonation and looked murky brown with fluffy off white head. Aroma of sweet wheated malts and citrus-lemon. Pretty even flavor right out of the shoot. Not as sweet as I remember. Taste has light malts, wheat, sweet fruit and some lemon.

Quality German dunkelweizen. For once I had exactly the right glassware because the nice bloke at Camperdown Cellars chucked in a free Franziskaner half-litre stein when he realised I was serious about beer. This presented beautifully: muddy brown with a lavish caffe latte head and great retention. Lots of yeast in the aroma, plus cocoa powder and some hefe bubblegum and banana. Medium bodied at the front of the mouth but slimming in the swallow. Generally smooth but perhaps a bit spritzy for the style. Very quenching. Restrained flavour mix with wheat malt dominating. Theres chocolate and banana, followed by pepper and very pronounced clove finish. Very easy drinking and very sessionable, Id wager. (500ml bottle from Camperdown Cellars, Darlinghurst. Best before Feb 07)

Sampled today (on draught) at Mecklenburg Gardens in Cincinnati...

Cloudy dark brown color with a large, dense ivory head.  Aroma is roasty malt (caramel) and a bit of orange citrus.  Flavor is caramelized wheat with a little orangy banana and clove in the background.  The carbonation is a bit more reserved in the Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel than it is in the regular Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier.  Mouthfeel is quite smooth.  This is a very satisfying beer and an excellent mix between a wonderful German Hefe and a rich, malty dark lager.
Nice dark brown but you can tell it does not have the heft of a  porter or stout.  A nice twist on a wheat beer.  The malts add some great flavor but it still retains the hefe refershingness.
Draft at Ludwigs Garten in Philly. Solid beer. Tasted what it should  be.
Bottle. Mostly banana throughout, but theres also a nice progression through a whole bunch of spicy malty flavours.
Pours a murky brown colour with a longlasting off-white head. Roasted malty aroma with some hints of bananas and yeast. The wheat flavor is abundant without being overpowering.
UPDATED: OCT 14, 2006 Nice dark color with a rich, persistant head.  Malty/wheaty flavors with lower levels of all the esters(banana and clove) of the original.  Nice D-Weiz.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2006 Poured a medium orange color. Good strong thick head with good head retention. Aroma was a bit of a rusty wheat smell . The flavor was spicy with a hint of fruit. A good dark(dunkel) wheat(weiss) beer.

Bottle from BOTW. Pours cloudy copper with decent whitish head. It has a big wheat and yeast aroma with a bit of sweetness. The flavor is yeast, plum, dark berries, wheat, and dry hops in finish. Pretty good stuff.
Very enjoyable.  Yeasty aroma.  Very thick head on a murky orange-brown beer.  Refreshing high carbonation spritzer-like taste.  Spicy palate, cloves and nutmeg.

Bottled - A hazy amber brown coloured beer with a large, lasting off-white head.  The aroma is caramel, nuts, some banana and a little toffee.  The taste is malty with a little nuttiness.  Quite thin really and lacking substantial body but its refreshing enough.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2007 Not bad for $2 on german beer tuesdays, definatley my #1 pick.  Pours a nice dark amber with a sweet aroma that matches nicely with the smooth full sweet flavor and mouthfeel.  This is an overall pretty good beer.

The quintessential dark German wheat. Youre greeted by a sweet, bread-like aroma with a pleasant cloudy appearance. The wheat flavor is abundant without being overpowering with a sweet, borderline orgasmic finish. Without any doubt the finest dark weiss, if not the finest beer I have ever had the pleasure to experience.

Bottle.  High quality weiss!  Mahogony cloudy color with the usual banana and coriander nose.  Off-white foamy head that lasts and lasts and lasts.  Slightly sour with the addition of some nice malty caramel flavors.I consider this a perfect autumn beer.

Bottle. Pours a murky brown colour with a longlasting off-white head. Roasted malty aroma with some hints of bananas and yeast. Sweet malty and slightly roasted flavor with some hints of bananas and yeast. Roasted malty finish with some bitterness.
Cold 12oz bottle:  Pours a cloudy brownish amber color with small ivory head.  Aroma and taste are both mainly of roasted malt and yeast. Fizzy on the tongue.  Crisp and smooth.  Dry ending.

Bottle (500ml).  In my Erdinger Hefe glass.  Murky brown-orange, large lasting foamy head - wow that looks great.  Malty, fruity, spicy, yeasty aroma, sweet, very bready.  Taste is all malt, yeast, plums and banana, lightly spicy - nice.  Bodys a little soft, but nicely carbonated (light, just right), very quick finish, no aftertaste - very drinkable; oddly, I enjoyed it more than their regular hefe.
Cloudy opaque dark brown body, white head.  Raisin aroma with malts.  Thick mouthfeel, yeasty malty banana flavour.
Cloudy brown body with a large creamy tan head. Sweet malty aroma, quite spicy. Sweet spicy flavor with some light malt and hints of banana.
very cloudy caramel colored under a medium sized off-white head.  banana and spice aroma.  faint hint of roasted malt.  more smooth and malty than the hefe but not very robust.
Nice sweet flavor with a huge crown tha stills all the time, very good looking beer and not bad at all.

Bottle from the Liquor Depot in Avon. Pours a hazy amber-brown with a tall beige head. Flavor is mild, with a little hop tang behind the more prominent nutmeg, cherry, and other sweet malty notes. Enjoyable, would be better in the fall.

Poured a hazy brown with a decent head... Smells of bread and malts.. Taste is a slight sweetness.. with a clovey like finish .. typical of a German Weissbier..   Overall i like it better than the regular.. nice brew

Huge head that seemed to never go down, on a dark copper body. Strong malt flavors, the ones typical for Spaten beers. Fresh and good, but not exactly memorable. Too sweet for me, but I guess that is the style.

Not much aroma to speak of.  Light bready scents.  Light brown cola color with frothy full light brown head.  Opaque.  Sweet flavor with a sweet finish.  Honey like flavors.  Frothy in the mouth and chewy.  Thick and creamy. Pretty good overall.

Looks sensational - cloudy brown with a pillowy beige meringue-like head that lasted for ages. Unfortunately this meant I had to wait an eternity for the aroma to properly come through. When it did, it was a fairly meek clove with some toffee. Balanced flavour, with some mild bitterness in swallowing and bit of sweet chewiness. Quite easy drinking and easily quaffable, which is good considering it comes in a 0.5L bottle.
Cloudy; malty; damn good.  I need a minimum of 75 characters for my review, so here they are.
A solid Dunkel, much more flavorful than their regular hefeweissen.  Dark brown color, with thick head, cloudyness and present body.  Finish needs a little something added to lacked punch.
Bottle. Hazy dark brown body under a medium lasting off-white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Flavour of clove and banana.
Heavy wheat and malt aroma.  Massive head thats lighet than expected.  Very sweet, with a medium body.  Finishes a bit long and sweet.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: UPDATED: NOV 3, 2007 Draught pint at Sunset Grill on 8/5/06.Large, heavy cream-colored head recedes steadily to cover, leaving somewhat less lacing than expected as it goes.  Muddy body is a drab, olivine-mahogany, with a slight ruddy tint.  Plentiful carbonation rising upwards quickly.Muted clove, and bananas covered in liquid brown sugar, with a soft note of mushy brown bread.  A bit of dry, black pepper phenol on the end, and some highly nutty, dull yeast.  Seems quite dry, though, without any alcoholic overtone (no fusels).  Even some hops?  Herbal and soily, but still present.  You want to hate InBev, but theres nothing wrong with this aroma, quite the opposite.Soft, mushy fruits, in the flavor, of peach, banana, apricot and mango quickly meld with the medium-dry brown sugar and brown wheat bread.  A slight streak of light pepperiness clings to the side of the palate, while there is a touch of minerals (tin?) and then a very watery finish.  So not quite the sum of the aroma, but up front the beer is well-attenuated and full of dry caramel, bready malts and fruits.  No overworked clove phenols, nor are the dark malts over-represented.  Still, the dull, watery finish needs work, and I dont get any of the hop flavor, expected from the nose.  Alcohol is not present in the flavor.  Carbonation is moderate.RerateDraught at Sunset Grill on 10/6/07Better than when I had it before, with a chewy toffee-apricot-peach flavor and plenty of wheat for palate smoothness.  Nice, engaging carbonation, whisking the flavors about and then providing a curt ending that cleanses the palate with light phenols and touches of roast.  Well-attenuated and yet with enough sugars.  Banana and clove are moderate.  Good stuff.  Vaguely chocolatey.
very aromatic, strong malty taste with a bitter note in the finish, brown slightly muddy poor, very clean finish.

Moderate-to-heavy malty aroma (toasted, caramel) with light yeasty notes; notes of banana.
Brown muddy body with a huge, light-brown rocky head; mostly lasting with a good lacing.
Flavour is moderately sweet and lightly acidic at the beginning; after a while a moderate bitter nte grows up giving a light liquorice note at the finsh.
Medium body with oily texture; average-to-lively carbonation; lifht astringent feeling in the finsh.
Satisfactory beer; bitter note in the finish is quite pleasent and makes it more thirst-quenching the other beers of this style, even if less "easy" than the "hells".
Bottle.  Dark brown color.  Thick white head.  Fruity and toffee aromas.  Caramel and toffee with some spice.
Pours a dark cloudy brownish color with a monster white head.Has a fruity aroma with some malt backing.Nice flavor of bananas with some malt.Bitter finish.

Caramel and malt aroma, a touch of wheat, cloudy brown, pours a large toffee head, leaves a fine lace. Caramel and malt flavour, some wheat and lightly spiced. Medium bodied, pleasantly sweet. Very good.

Draft @ Café Klostertorvet, Aalborg, DK. Poured clody orange-brown with an off-white head. Yeasty and fruity aroma with faint burnt/smoked notes. Sweetish flavour with yeast and malt and sourish notes. 14-07-06.
Nice copper / brownish color with a smaller tan head.  Taste is a sweet blend of malts, roastedness, caramels, and some spices.  Cloves and coriander, mostly.  Easy drinker here...

Im usually not a wheat guy but lately I have been trying to branch out. This was one of the first wheats I enjoyed. Small aromas of yeast and wheat. Nice and crisp with some hop notes and call me crazy, but I got a bread pudding taste too. Either way crazy or not Im glad to have found a wheat I enjoyed

Little aroma of yeast and malt. I almost always give dunkel-weizens a 5 for appearance... I just think they look awesome in a weizen glass, and this one looks a little better than most. The flavor is wonderful- clove, yeast, bananas, apple/pear, bread. Excellent.
Rich, deep, hazy copper color.  MAlty aroma. Malt sweetness all through each sip.  hint of wheat through out creating a wonderfully dry finish.  this dunkel weiss was a treat.

Poured from a 22 oz. bottle to a hazy light-brown appearance with thick off-white head, that lingered through most of the glass. Good lacing. Aroma of malt, and a sweetness of candy. Flavor was mostly wheat, with clove and corriander spices becoming more evident at mi-glass. Palate was dry, and the only drawback to this beer was that it was also a little watery. All and all, a good beer.

Brown with a huge lasting tan head.  Aroma is wheaty, caramel, clove, banana and some corriander.  Malty flavour complimented with the clovey banana flavour makes this a banana bread like taste.  Finishes slightly sweet.

This one was a nice looking beer.  It had a nice big fluffy head  and a pleasantly medium dark body.  The flavor was similar to a hefe in that banana and  clove are clearly present.  But the dunkel style also comes through.  This is a delightful combination.
very very vevry clovey.  that means it tastes like your drinking boiled cloves.  with sugar.  i dont like.  looks good thick caramel head head lasts the whole way through.  tastes like cloves

bottle: aroma of rotten wheat and caramel malts. deep red with a fluffy long-lasting head.  flavor reflects the rotten wheat aroma described along with flavors of dark malt. all well balanced, with a nice aftertaste. definitely an acquired taste, but probably  closest to a historically accurate dunkelweizen as one can get.  im biased of course. i love this stuff.
Bottle. Beautiful big tan head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma is a bit vague and mostly malt. Taste is sweet malty.

bottle.  pours  a hazy dark brown with medium carbonation,tan head that quickly dissipates.   Aroma is roasty, banana, slight chocolate, especially chocolate milk.  Taste is sweet and malty along with phenolic fruit, caramel, spicy, with a slightly sweet then tart fruit and a constant hop bitterness through the finish.

Another fine one by Franziskaner, even if a Spaten product. This one poured a nice brown color with some cloudiness. The aroma was of light roasted bananas. Some cloves, but underplayed. Caramel malts came through in the flavor, moreso than in the non dunkel versions. Definite roasted character vs. the non dunkel. Not as dry as other dunkelweizens. A good beer.

A favorite.Imagine a banana spiked with cloves and baked until it comes out some klind of artisan, wheat bread. Surprising and please, especially in it looks and quixotic aroma. A workingmans beer with a cashmere mouthfeel.
Had fresh in Germany, nice clove, banana. Abit on the sweet side, very refreshing with my asian food, Im really liking Dunkelweizens!

Botlle, Light brown hazy colour, with a nice creamy foam. In this beer I got a hoopy gren colour blade in the glass.(nice)Aroma of a sweet malty nose and acitric(hoops) balance ending.  Lots of sweet maltyness, with a touch of cocoa and coffee. With a typical weissber ending in citrus and light banana  in the end.. Palate is og medium sweetnes and a nice bitter/citric finish,  and a medium body. Nice, but could be a bit stronger alchol in it, then it have a boigger body and finish. That´s my upinion. Nice beer.
(0.5L Bottle) Pours a cloudy dark brown with a tan head. Banana aroma and flavor is there, but not as much as the Original. A bit smoky, and goes good with food. Rich mouthfeel too.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2007 Bottle.
A very cloudy dark pour with generous head that can foam over. The smell is nothing overpowering but not too mild. Sweet malt characters.
The flavor is very malty with a little hop presence. Not bad flavor and goes down smooth.

A very strong and intense clove aroma is evident, followed by very fruity banana smell.  This misture gives it a pleasent overall first impression.  The color can be described as a deep copper brown, with a very thick, bubbly off white long lasting head.  The clarity is sligthly hazy and cloudy.  Flavor of banana and cloves is strong, but good.  High carbondation with no bitter aftertaste.  Goes down very smoothly, a very filling rich beer.  This will be a beer I will drink more ofton and will have my friends try.

I guess im not into dunkels.. it has a beautiful apperace, with a light brown pour and a huge frothy head. The problem for me is its halfway taste. It has a nice hefe backbone with some spices, banana and bread but that does not pair well with an artificial and  light chocolat and roasted foreground. Its also  a bit oily and simple. A smokey lemon and bland finish does not help this one either.
murky light brown color and frothy head.  estery aroma.  flavor is close to the hefe with the addition of some toasted bread.  good but not great.

Pours a cloudy light brown color with a good size head.  Has a light estery, spicy, and yeast aroma.  Flavor is also light and fruity.  Light body.  Hoping for a little more dark malt flavor.  Not bad.
Slightly hazy copper with a weak white head.  Wheat, caramel, citrus aromas.  Spicy.  Medium body, thin texture.  Slightly spicy flavor, lemony finish.

Pours a brown caramel color w/ a  tall creamy froth. Aroma of fresh bananas with slight medicine. Medium nectar w/ ample residual ffers. Flavors are bright and fruity w/ a defined banana tropshire. Slight clove. Crisp and refreshing. Overall: one of the best. Highly recommended.

Hazy caramel/amber color with a medium white head that lasts and laces the glass nicely.  Aroma is wheaty, mildly sweet.  Flavor too is wheaty with mild fruity/banana tones, mild sweetness and leaves palate cleanly (a little too watery ending).

500 ml bottle. Hazy caramel pour with a medium white head. Nose is wheaty and spicy, much like its yellow Hefe-Weisse brother. In fact, aside from a very light toastiness, it IS its brother. Good, but not great.
A definite fruity, banana aroma.  Flavor not as sweet, and a watery feel.  Color a deep amber.  Like it very much.

Bottle 500ml from Citymarkt Kaufhof in Stuttgart. Hazy dark brown body under a medium lasting off-white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Flavour of clove and banana. Watery mouthfeel and a bit too sweet for my taste (24.04.2006).

From Bottle.  Pour of grayish brown mud with a thin layer of white head.  Aroma of bananas dipped in molasses.  Some vinous red grape qualites are also present in the bouquet.  Mouthfeel is actually a bit more sharp than expected, with relatively thin and bland flavors.  Some toasted wheat bread makes a banana sandwich.  Final smack of green, under-ripe prune.

Bottle at Bishops Arms Västra Hamngatan, Gothenburg Sweden.Shady brown color, huge white head. Fresh scent, big difference from the "original light" one. Fruity bit a bit stale flavor. Much less fruitiness than the light version. Low bitterness.

Bottle 500ml. Wonderful chestnut-brown cloudy body topped with a huge and lasting off-white foamy head. Sharp malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty, spicy, citrusy and banana notes. Taste is mostly hoppy and carries herbal and clove hints. Ends with a dry yeasty finish. Good example of Dunkelweizen.

Pours hazy dark into the glass with a decent head and spiderlacing.  Aromas of banana and clove.  Banana from the beginning of the pull through the finish.... also some hints of clove are nice.  The smooth yeasty finish compliments the overall pour.  Not bad.
