Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head.Aroma is fruity banana with some cellar notes.The flavour is a combination of banana , yeast and some fruityness. Good banana and yeast finish.

Bottle.  Cloudy light brown beer with a large white head.  The aroma is very lightly coffee, banana and slightly milky, and the flavour is lightly yeasty with a banana after taste.  Overall a fairly average beer.

HUGE enormous head. In fact theres too much carbonization and foam doesnt have much flavor. Can definitely taste the wheat flavor in this one. Sweet maltiness is there but not too much so. Good beer but really nothing outstanding. Sort of macroish if that makes sense. Probabaly wont drink again but glad I tried it.

Bottle, bottle conditioned.  Pours a murky brown, but its light and definitely has some amber or read in there.  Huge (~2") creamy tan head that sticks around a long time.  Big lacing.  Aroma is good, spicy, wheaty, and makes me want to dive into this beer.  To my still learning palate and nose, the smell almost reminds me of a belgian dubbel.  Flavor is good, definitely has wheat beer character with a good amount more going on.  Some spice, hop bitterness and definite yeast characteristics that I dont yet know how to describe.  Palate is light and refreshing, carbonation is on the high side.  Finishes dry and crisp.  Very drinkable, and really tasty right now (its nice and warm here today).  I like this beer a lot, and I look forward to trying out some more of this style.

Poured a very hazy brown color.  Muddy water look to it.  Highly carbonated with a large head a first.  It settled down but had a lasting head for the whole beer.  I noticed a Belgian white aroma to it at first.  I dont get much from the taste other than a very slight chocolate and the spicyness of a Belgian white.  While it got better to me as I finished it I would not pick this beer out again as a retry.

Bottle. Pours murky brown with a tight bubbled tan head. Aroma is toast and chocolate with banana. Yeasty and somewhat sweet, the body is medium and the mouthfeel tingly. Not so much banana in the taste but it is roasty for sure with a mellow cocoa.
deep copper red color. light brown head on a cloudy body. flavor is a little bit of sweet and yeasty flavor. finishes malty and dry.

Pours cloudy copper with an off-white head.  Aroma is still bananas, but more spice and toastiness.  Light mouthfeel.  Good yeast and malt in the taste with a back of banana and fruit.  I like the hefe better, but still a good beer.

Thought I had rated this one before but apparently not.  Now that Ive had the original Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier, I will stick to that one.  This dunkel version is less flavorful, but still light and enjoyable.
bottle:  pours nice dark copper with large off white head.  toasty aroma with clove and bannana notes.  taste is fairly dominated by the clove notes
Murky, brown body with creamy, tan head. The aroma is bananas, cloves and cinnamon. The flavor is spice and fruit a touch roasted, but a little thin. Mouthfeel is soft and smooth.
Brown body, with small light brown head very fast disappearing; Very small, malty sweet nose; great carbonation in a watery, citrus bitter body; Long malty finish with a little clove.
Very cloudy with a lasting off-white head. The aroma is yeasty with some spiciness. The taste has yeastiness and a very slight  hoppy finish. Overall, though, it could do with a bit more body.
has a sweet malty with maybe a hint of chocolate aroma.  Cloud orangish brown.  Bit of a yeasty texture, not really any bold taste to it, fairly average.

1/2 L. bottle. Brings back memories. Nice big head fit great in a traditional Weizenbier glass. Cloudy amber in color. The aroma reminded me a little bit of a nice bourbon with vanilla or fruit undertones. Taste was a little disappointing as it only slightly matched the aroma, but still refreshing- lighter than it looks. Nice trip down memeory lane.

Draft - Pours dark brown with a substantial head.  The aroma is of yeast and a hint of bananas.  The flavor is fairly sweet and again the banana notes are noticeable.  The medium body is creamy, but too fizzy in my opinion.  The finish is dry.
pours a tan body with white head, goes down smooth with excellent taste. great overall beer. Very light very good

man i used to love me some franziskaner.  still a top dog winner to me in the hefe groups.  the dark version here is a bit more robust and toffee esque with some darker roasted malt tapped onto the original banana spice flavors.  light and refreshing on a summer day....keep those lemons outa there!!

Pours a nice dark brown-hazy amber color.  Foamy head.  Thick aroma of banana bread and light clove.  Creamy carbonated body with a dryish finish.  However, while the medium body is good, the taste is less than the aroma would lead you to believe.  Very light, with wheat and banana.  Nothing really good or bad about it, just kind of boring really.

Bottled. Served in a HB 0,5l weiss glass.  The apperance of this beer is incredible.  No beer can live up to this apperance. Huge head, of course, white with copper beads.  Hazy gold and white underneath.  Then a dark copper cloudiness in the middle again, til it lightens up again at the bottom. The taste is fruity, sweet plantine and fig.  Can really taste the wheat after.  Tingles on the tongue.
Pours a dark brown with a lot of head.  The aroma  is a little fruity.  Goes down smooth with less sweetness than the standard hef and surprisingly less taste.  Still a good medium body hef.

Mid to dark brown, very cloudy with a lasting off-white head. The aroma is yeasty with some spice and wet dog. The taste has malt and bread dough and a barely discernable hoppy finish. Overall, though, it could do with a bit more body.

Nice muddy brown, lots of lace.neutral aroma, creamy sourish moutheel, not too tasty or interesting . Fresh at Brick pub store in Atlanta Tingling carbonation, medium-to-light mouthfeel. i like their regular weisse

Øl (50 cl) købt i Tyskland.

Øllen er ufiltreret og orange brun. Skummet er højt hvidt.

Duften er let gæragtig, men typisk weizenbier agtig.

Smagen er dejlig afrundet. Let sødlig og let bitter. Tyk i smagen.

Er meget let drikkelig af en dunkelweizen.

im new to the style but thought this an excellent brew.  cloudy brown pour.  almost swamp waterish in color w/ a thick creamy head quickly diminished.   malty banana.  im not getting any chocolate but that weiss style is evident in the finish.  lots o carb. overall, im diggin it
Overall a great beer. Nice amber color,with a rich malty head. slightly malty taste with earth tones and a very smooth finish.
500 ml bottle. Hazy brown. Looks really muddy. Increadible thick persistent head. Yeast and noble hop aroma. Bready flavour with some subdued chocolate and roasted notes. Low bitterness.
.5l bottle.  Pours a slightly cloudy, deep amber with a massive head.  Smells of bananas, spice and malt.  Overall is very thin and watery.  Not a lot of flavor.  Very ordinary.
Dark brown with a thick light brown head. Smell of rich malt. Bitter at first with a nice spicy malt finish.

Has a hazy dark brown color, with a tannish head that disappates quickly.  Has a very light yeasty aroma, it was nothing special.  Mildly spicy flavor, its not too bad, although nothing special.  Kind of a light body, with decent carbonation.

Hazy almond brown with a stordy off-white head.  Some aromas of bark, clove, and a vinuous aroma coming off the hops.  Just a hint of caramel.  Thin and a little watery on the palate.  Dry, caramel finish is fleeting and light.  Rather tasteless compared to many dunkles.  Theres a little to the hops and bready yeast, but more of a quencher than a pleaser.

The aroma has toasted wheat, caramel, dark fruit, bananas, and yeast. The appearance is so nice. The head is huge and the color is a deep red brown. The flavor is not as impressive as the aroma and appearance but its still enjoyable. There is a mild spiciness to go along with plums, sugar, herbs, fruit, and wheat. The palate is on the thin side. The finish is coffee like with a dryer character than I expected. I think this is a pretty good beer to have with a meal.

Bottle. Pours cloudy copper with respectable whitish head. It has a big wheat and yeast aroma with a bit of sweetness. The flavor is estery yeast, plum, dark berries, wheat, and dry hops in finish. Pretty good stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2006  500ml bottle at Ship & Mitre, Liverpool. I was a bit disappointed with this. Not a huge aroma, some roasted malts, choc/coffee, and a bit of toffee, but over carbonated in mouth and the finish was thin on flavour.
Bottle. Good looking off-white lasting head. Amber / red-brown unclear body. Strange flavor of bananas and herbs. Spicy sweet flavor.

Bottle: Dark caramel, huge fluffy light beige head, very nice lacing, strong carbonation.   Semi-roasted malt aroma, slight wheatiness, not as Weizen like as its lighter brother.   Fairly sweet on the tongue, touch roasty, soft wheat malt, but neither really strong banana nor cloves shine through on this one.   Standard German Weizen qualities are subtle, replaced with a bit more sweet roasted wheat malt.   Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full.   Sweet finish, mildly roasty, but unfortunately it doesnt capture the essense of its lighter bretheren. &nbsp Good, but give me the standard any day.

Not exactly a show-stopper in itself, but I found this to be a far greater beer to its pale brother,  the hefe weissbier hell. Still really didnt rock my world, yet I could easily find myself downing a dozen or so in quick succession with the heat of this years summer. Upon cracking the bottle it became the 3rd Spaten brew to gush like a geyser. Once stable in the glass it looked fantastic; dense 2½" rocky beige head atop a highly charged, hazy chestnut body. Head remained for the length in its enormous guise and drabbed frothy rings down the glass. Milled, biscuity grains in the aroma; doughy and generously spiced with notes of cola soda, bready yeast and crumbly banana cake. Heavily subdued in the mouth despite the huge opening, and again (like the hell) almost watered down in feel. Unusually the carbonation was quite light allowing the light flavours to linger fully on the tongue. Biscuity and woody with a  tannic and tangy malt mix filling the mid-palate, and lightly drying malt and phenolic spice finishing it off in the back. Similarly tangy briefly after the swallow, or atleast until my next mouthful, which came in ever-increasing repetition until sadly it was gone. Light on, as I have found with the other Franziskaner beers, but easily the best of the lot. Sessionable!!! (50cL, BBE 04/06, Intl Beer Shop, W. Leederville)
Pours a cloudy deep orange color with a creamy, uneven head.  Aroma of yeast and some darker fruity malts.  A little alcoholic dryness on the palate.  Ive been meaning to try this one for a while.

Bottle.
Hazy orange coloured with an off white head.
Sweet aroma of fruits, bananas and yeast.
Flavour of fruits, yeast and spices.

My first Dunkelweizen.  Bottled.  Poured a super-thick off-white head, very frothy.  Typical fruit and wheat smell.  Malty.  Cloudy Hershey-brown coloring.  Watery, actually, too thin for my expectations.  Smooth.  A tad less banana in the taste, and a tad more malty sweetness, otherwise very similar to the regular Franziskaner.  Im unable to appreciate the "darker roasted malt", or to see the reason for buying this over the yeastier original.  Still, refreshing.
A good one. No banana or coffee or raisins vanilla etc etc. A hefe weisbeer dunkel.

"Pours cloudy amber color with awsome HUGE off-white head. Main flavors of a sweet fruit and yeast. Mouthfeel is thin, but smooth. Flavor is a little watery, smooth and yeasty. Overall, Franziskaners have impressed me."

Not really a wheaty aroma, but some faint banana. Dark, brown murky, body and a small, off-white head. Excellent lace. Served in a tall, straight weissbier glass. Very light in body but smooth and pretty good. Very pleasant and enjoyable with discernable banana notes.

On tap at Ludwigs Garten, Philadelphia, PA.  Hazy brown wheat beer having a long-lasting large white head with good lacing.  No discernable carbonation. Sweet malt aroma.  Medium bodied that starts with light sweet malt, clove, fruity, and smoke flavors.  Finishes with light malt aftertaste.  No discernable bitterness.  This is a good malty beer that goes well with Ludwigs wild boar special.

(bottle) Cloudy and hazy orange to brown hue with a big foamy off-white head. Dusty and yeasty, slightly sweet wheat-malty aroma with cloves and a very shy banana fruitiness. Wheat-malty taste, slightly fruity and clovy finish. Decent Dunkelweizen that offers the distinctive taste, but nothing more.
Bottle. Poured a hazy brown color with a large off-white head that lasted. Good sweet malty aroma. Medium body. Good well balanced flavor with a medium finish. Good refreshing brew.
50 cl bottle. Yeast in the bottom. Unclear brown colour with a rich head. Wheat and little sour aroma. Wheat flavour with hints of chocolate and little sour finish.

Franziskaners regular hefe is more flavorfull than this.  It pours a cloudy almost opeque brown with a thick creamy head.  It tastes kind of roasty with definate banana and clove notes throughout.  ehh...its OK.

Beer pours a brown color with a large creamy colored head.  I can already see lots of carbonation.  Aroma of wheat and banana and a faint bubblegum smell.  Taste was a watered down version of what a good wheat should be.  Pretty disappointing beer.

Poured with large creamy off-white head.  Beer is a dark murky color, but holding up to light can see orange/brown color.  Nose is of clove, wheat, and yeast.  Flavor is dry and slightly bitter.  Finish is very smooth and creamy and leaves a very plesant roasted caramel taste in the mouth.    Flavor is very good, but moutfull is a little watery.  Overall a very nice presentation.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2009 Bottled. Nice, thick, off-white head on top of a dark, orange, hazy beer. Banana and citric aroma. Cloves too. Taste is citric, fruity and light malty. Slight metallic hints in aftertaste. Rating: 6-4-7-4-15-3.6. (051108)Bottle. A hazy, brown beer with a creamy, beige head. Banana, some buttery notes, caramel, some hops and a faint note of DMS in the aroma. The flavor is sweet and bananaish, with caramel, and some bitterness in the finish. Some spicy cloves too. Effervescent and full-bodied. Long finish. A really fine dunkel hefe-weissbier. (090327)

A huge tan head took its time settling atop a thickly clouded, caramel/copper body. All the aromas of a good Hefe in an overall dry nose: banana, clove, incense, baked bread. Flavor was sour & dry... yeasts open up to malts then return to finish with overripe banana and spice. Dry & creamy with a hint of metal and a little on the thin side. Good, but <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Beer/weihenstephaner- takes the cake for this style.
<font size=-4><a href=
http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/illinois/elmh Sals Beverage World, Elmhurst, IL<font size=-1>
Considering the price this beer isnt too bad. Nothing fancy, but it drinks well.

Pours a medium hazy brown with a brown tinged well forming soft slightly deminishing head.  Aroma of soft citrus wheats.  Has a nice light citrus taste with a bready malt backtone.  Theres also a hint of strawberry in the backbone.  Has a lightly carbonated and fine grained mouthfeel.
Unclear red/ dark amber color. Big head. Aroma like banana and dark honey. Flavor more or less the same. Quite a lot of carbonation. Nice one.

What a great drinking beer.  On tap at Maders in Milwaukee.  (awesome German restaurant)  Perfect balance of wheat and malt.  Slight caramel taste with sweetness and roasted malt to balance.   Finishes smooth and clean.
UPDATED: NOV 1, 2005 Excellent beer! Even better than the regular Franziskaner hefe-weisse. In addition to bready malts, also has slight nutty taste.

Pours a cloudy brown with a large white head that lasts. Fruity aromas, although not citus like. Light on the palate with a slightly acidic flavor and definite notes of clove. Farily clean finish with mild astringency.

Pint bottle bought in Lincoln City Oregon.
Nice enough looking beer, murky dark chesnut coloured with a frothy/chunky light tan head.
The aroma was not as strong as I expected from a "real" German Dunkleweizen, all the regular components were there but very muted. fruity and peppery aromas.
I was really quite dissapointed with the taste weak overall..yes all the usual "bananas and clove" was there but extremelly weakened.
Palate was very thin and almost watery.
Overall i  felt let down by this one, below average for a German weiss beer

Pours brown with a nice straw like head.  Smells of banana and a bit breaddy.  Some mild pear and apple notes are also there as well as some spices.  Tastes of bananas and spices and is a bit on the bitter side (peppery).  Thick mouthfeel, but not as nice a finish as some others.  A bit metallic.  I may have to come back to this one again as the bottle may have been past its prime given some of the off aromas and tastes present.

On draft at Ludwigs...
Appears a mahogany red/brown color with a lush tan head that stays untill the last few sips. Light lacing is seen in this one.
Smell is of Bavarian yeast, bread, cocoa, light banana, roasty nuts, cream, and clove.
Taste is equally as good as the aromas.
Mouthfeel is decent. Seems to be medium bodied and refreshingly not to cloying. This would score a bit higher if it filled out the palate just a tad more but its nice, nonetheless.

The aroma is of banana and wheat malt.  Franziskaner is a mahogany brown with a fully lasting, creamy,  light tan head.  There is a light banana flavor accompanied by an astringent fruity tartness.  Carbonation is high and the mouthfeel is effervescent.

Sampled from bottle. Pours a murky, dark, tarnished gold-brown with an lasting off-white head. Aroma is bananas, cloves and hay. Flavor is balanced and tart with ripe fruit, banana and a medley of spices from the yeast, and perhaps some hops. Finishes clean. Medium-bodied, moderately carbonated. A slighly above-average hefe.
typical looks considering the style, dark cola brown with a fluffy head. A bit malt, cola and hops in the aroma. The taste is pure Franziskaner, very nice dunkelweizen, I must say

Muddy amber-brown with olive shine; brownish tinted head. Banana and faint clove, yet a bit grassy nose. Rather sweet, fruity with some clovey notes. Ends very liquorice-like. Sweet and dull-malty character. Rather well-bodied. Wheat impression. Superfluous, boringly dull Dunkel Weizen.
Sampled at Brew Ha Ha 2005:  Poured a dark yellow not as dark at the description.  It was very alive in my mouth - nice carbonation.

Long lasting head with a banana bread aroma and a murky brown, sparkling body.  Very mellow dunkel with a mild banana and apple taste, slightly sweet.  Lively carbonation.  Superb aftertaste with just the right amount of hop bitterness with wheat and spices.  An excellent beer (and cheap too, especially at Harris Teeter)

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2005 (500 ml bottle: $1.99 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA) Pours a cloudy, ruddy brown body, but the large, billowy head, over two inches tall, prevents me from tasting this beer for awhile.  Thats fine, it looks like this bottle of beer is reasonably fresh, not the easiest feat with imported beers.  Wheat and moderately sweet banana emanate from the glass, wheat easily being the dominant aroma, with some other estery fruitiness in there as well, perhaps some apple, and some light spices.  The restrained flavor is also very "wheat bread" in character, only mildly sweet, with a fair amount of banana, and a touch of indistinct spice.  Despite the mildly sweet undertone, the palate is somewhat dry, but very smooth and does not fatigue the palate.  Body is generally light-medium, trending toward medium.  And now that Ive finished the beer, theres still a sizeable head to this beer.  Its a very good beer, but not a great one.

Poured dark gold, slightly hazy  with a humongous dense foamy head that slowly faded, leaving very attractive sticky lace up the entire glass.  On the nose was a predominant note of banana over grain, straw, bread and yeast.  Tart, fizzy an refreshing with flavors of malt, an herbal spiciness full of cloves, ginger, cardamom and corriander, well balanced by a fair amount of hops -- lending both bitterness and flavor.  I like big, malty ales so Weisens are not my favorites, although we had some September heat here in NW Ohio so it was quite refreshing.  I kind of expected it to be a bit more Dunkel.

Fantasic appearence, fully lasting white head, dark amber colour, Cloudy ofcourse, Delicate aroma with hints of citrus, powerfull flavour, but only average finish duration. Better than regular Franziskaner weissbeer!!!!!!

On draught(?) anywhere in Schwerte: Reddish brown coloured, cloudy, big rocky head; yeasty and fruity (mainly bananas) nose, some malty traces; malty, but mainly fruity taste, light bitter flavour with a sharper, nearly tart finish. All in all very well quaffable, quite well rounded.

Big, creamy head with a very bubbly, dark brown body. Taste and aroma were pretty weak, with hints of banana and some mild yeastiness, but really nothing special. Flavor was maybe a bit asparagus?? Not bad, not great. A bit buttery on the palate was kinda nice.
Big lasting head, brownish opaque appearance. Tastes great - thick, smooth, nice malty & fruity flavour, very characteristic and typical of other Franziskaner beers. Very good dunkel.
Surprisingly mellow. Very smooth and malty. Good hop bitterness. A very good dunkel.
Poured a cloudy brown with a creamy head.  A little sweet, but a nice long finish.  Good beer.
A darker weissbier, this has a sharper taste, but goes down well.   Leaves a strong yet pleasent aftertaste.

Muddy dark copper, faint light brown head. Nutty, oily and roasty nose is hugely phenolic and procures blatant salmon notes that won’t leave my mind and pretty much cuts most other nuances I could get out of the nose. I won’t browse through 300+ ratings to get feedback on this, but I’m almost shocked that apparently no one else mentions this, not even in the form of a smokiness. Not so exuberant in mouth, but it remains very simplistic. Don’t search for estery richness in here, straightforward bready yeast procures more sourness than the wheat can dream of while the malt profile is dominated by dull roasted nuts. Herbal spiciness accentuates the enormous ultimately annoying carbonation. A rare feat: a weizen that is tough to finish. Burp.

Bottle.  Thick head that made it take forever to pour.  Complex flavors, sweet, bitter, yeasty, wheat.  It left a bizarre feel in my mouth, like when you wake up in the morning and your mouth feels sticky inside.  Overall, very enjoyable.  I cant comment much on the color because I used a green pint glass.
The flavour was like the aroma, very sweet and malty. The head was huge and lasting.
Bottle. Pours a light brown color with a big foamy white head. Nose is light malt and plums. Taste has a slight bit of chocolate to it, quite a bit of malt, and some sweet caramel and raisins.

Bottle.  The appearance was impressive, nice, cloudy, dark amber color with a large frothy off white head that lasted quite awhile.  The aroma had a faint banana, yeastiness to it.  The flavor, however, just didnt do it for me, too watery, the flavors just didnt come through as strong as I would have liked.
poured a murky caramel color with a thick white head, aroma was of wheat, citrus, and spice, & malt, as well as the taste, was really malty, but not bad, decent beer.

Tap.  Dark brown-orange beer with a thick white head and very loads of suspended yeast.  Very strong aroma of toasted wheat, banana, and clove.  Chewy, wheaty texture.  Flavour of banana, toast, and a bit of citrus as well.  Long wheaty spicy finish.  Nice spicy and toasty finish.
I thought that this was a great beer. Poured dark and cloudy with minimal lacing and a frothy head tastes like the hefe-weisse with a little less of the spice kick and more malt of course.

Nice cloudy deep amber brown, with three fingers of rich foamy off-white head. Aroma is bright and yeasty, with a touch of caramel. Flavor is wheaty and malty, mostly on one level. Fairly one dimensional, but sold with good rich sugars and creamy yeast notes. Palate is watery, but lingers with a touch of honey. Highly drinkable.

Pours cloudy light brown wit a substantial white longlasting head. Aroma of yeast and malt with notes of citrus and ripe bananas. Flavour reflects the aroma with an addition of lihgt clove and some  nuttiness. Overall not quite as flavourful as the light Franziskaner Hefe- weissbier. Very good and refreshing.
Red/brown color. Thick head that lasts forever. Typical franziskaner taste but to be honest I expected more complexity.
A great German beer.  I loved the flavor the color and the aromoa.  This is a great beer.  I had this on Tap at the PIB (Portland International Brewfest)  WOW I like this beer. A great Dunkel.

Dark brownish/reddish color, fairly hefty head that dissapates quite slowly.  heavy on the malt end of the spectrum.  sweet and somewhat nutty in flavor.  A very sturdy beer--nothing jaw-dropping but a very good dunkel all around.
Reddish color with a consistant, thick head that lasts and lasts.  Malty yeasty aroma.  Smooth mouthfeel, but it could use a little more carbonation.  Malty and refreshing.
A very nice surprise. Pour and wait... Strong wheat taste at first. Spaten never gets enough credit. This is a fine effort that rates better then 71.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2005 This beer pours with an absolute pillow of a head.  I could lay down and fall asleep just gazing at it.  Millions of miniscule bubbles raise to the rim of the glass before combining and melting into giant creamy mounds of foam.  Sorry, but this is the best head Ive ever had, errrr poured.  Anyway, onto the aroma.  Overripe banana, spice and dates offset the otherwise mundane, sweet dunkel nose.    More of the same in the body, but whatever flavors are initially present are quickly washed away by the overly watery middle.  This qualifies this as an easy drinker, but what about the flavor?
Tap.  Cloudy brown body with a thin white head.  Sweet banana bread aroma.  Spicier banana malt flavor, the carbonation brightens it up.  Slighlty weak mouthfeel.

Pours a cloudy light brown.  Has a banana nut granola malty smell.  Refreshingly moist with medium-high carbonation.  A banana nut malt taste that starts and finishes smooth.  Overall, an enjoyable beer at a good price. ($1.99/1pt-9oz)

Decent dunkel.  Nice long lasting head like most hefes.  Dark murky brown.  Smells like an ordinary Hefe with a little bit of molasis and malt.  Worth drinking for this catagory, but a little less worthy than a Paulaner dunkel

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2006 Dark brown body with a huge rocky head. Aroma is hard to pick up but certainly caramel and wheat. Some citric notes with banana as well. Flavor is the same, a little more interesting. Had a mass produced feel to it, really didnt think this was very special. Lacks complexity...
Brown with beige head. Nice Hefe aroma with a bit of a nutty quality. Typical Franziskaner flavor with some caramel/hazelnut flavors. Refreshing, crisp but a touch thin.

Reddish brown color, aroma of roasted malt,with just a tease of sweet banana, medium body malt taste,with a touch of chocolate and banana,Bold enough that is starts losing its thirst queneching qualities
Pours a cloudy amber with an off-white head. Aromas of malt, banana, and yeast. Flavors of roasted malt, bananas, and a touch of coffee. Crisp and refreshing mouthfeel.
Large frothy head (quickly diminishing), dark couldy brown body.  A light malty aroma.  The taste starts slightly astringent, but ends in a sweet bannana taste.

Cloudy amber pour with a creamy white head.  The head retention was really good.  Aroma had yeast, roasted banana, and roasted malt.  Perhaps some coffee as well.  Taste had good roasted banana, apricot, coffee and milk chocolate.  The sourness was nice on the palate.  The finish was a bit watery but not bad.  This certainly will make me look for more Dunkelweizens.
lovely. aroma:yeast, banana, malt(bit roasted). taste: banana, coffee, spices, milkchocolate. finish: bit sticky, banana, sweet(a bit) and sourrish. nice hefe!

This beer was introduced to me by my friend Tommy.  Together we are exploring all the beers that the world has to offer.  I dont like a lot of Spatens other beers, but this is perhaps the best Hefe-Weissbier Ive tasted, with a perfect yeast-malt blend of flavor.

To me, the ultimate in Hefes. The spent yeast in the bottom and all. Banana peel flavors and toasted maltiness. Thick, strong head associated with a well produced wheat beer. While I like its brother, the golden weiss, I prefer the toastiness of the dunkel. Finally found it on draught in the States for the first time in years while visiting Gingerman in Houston. It was just as I remember it. Not bad in the bottle, one of the few beers I can say that with. Best Hefe Weiss Ive ver had.

(Bottle 50 cl) Muddy brownish - like water from the Rhine.... Well, not completely unappetizing. Soft, with the wheat-esters not that pronounced. A bit shy for a Hefe-dunkel - turn up the flavours please. 100699

Beauty of a beer in its appearance.  Tanned/pink colored head that is fluffy and monstrous.  Hue of the liquid is a see through tea colored brown. And the aroma is also one of its kind.  Small but rich in ripe fruit like apple and pear and has background of sweet malt.  Flavor is subdued by a light presence of malt and hazelnut with a  pinch on my tastebuds of tiny profile of spice. A fair level of carbonation in the drink and finish is clean and quite dry too.

YUM.  Pouring a hazy light brown color with a frothy light tan head, this brew hits you with a melange of light, enjoyable scents - banana, caramel, cloves,  spiciness...  Its almost like, youve nailed your favorite hefeweizen.  Youre sitting in the shade, enjoying the light fruitiness of the brew, when the phone rings.  Some A-hole from the office with "IMPORTANT SHIT".  Do Something!  Get your butt in and..  and... and... Who cares?  What a light, enjoyable drink.  Let the "serious" aficionado waste land space golfing...  Let the "serious" aficionado discuss the delicacies of Bahia Cerveza Especiale... And.. the abrupt, chubby fellow tells you that your time is up.  Good brew, but you respond . "6/3/8/13/14."  Shut up, chubby daytime hall monitor.

Pour is a very cloudy tan with a tan head. Aroma is of cloves and a yeasty breadness.  Flavor is malt and cloves and you get some wheat and you get the banana you should in most hefes.  Very flavorful.  Very tasty and well worth the $2 a pint price.  Recomended!

Pours a deep hazy brown with a huge, fluffy, tan head. Smells of strident clove and smooth ripe banana.

Taste is of dark wheat malt, some banana and clove but muted and disappointing. Some hop bitterness in the finish. Light sweet maltiness. Very thin in the mouth and not creamy at all like it looked during the pour. Drinkable, yes. Fulfilling, no. Very disappointing.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2007 Flavours of cloves, banana and spice, all contained within a dark mellow beer, one of my favorites. The combination of roasted chocolate malts and the hefeweizen yeast make for a delicious beer.

Pours a hazy brownish amber with a pretty substantial foamy head.  Aroma is floral and malt.  Wheat and yeast dominate flavor.  I thought that the flavor could have blossomed a little more, but it seems to stop short of a true fullness.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle from Whole Foods, Cary, NC.  Poured into a pint glass, and I can see i should have used a Chimay grail.  Brobdingnagian head and a hazy diarrhea colored pour.  Aromas of huge malt, citrus, some hops, big banana and cloves, caramel, port.  Tastes malty, with some hopcit, clove, banana, and raucy finishing elements.  Very good.  I did not know that Buck Dichs icon was from this beer until now.  Ill be gettin me sommora this tomorrow, Ill tell ya what, lookie here (thats Southern speak for those who dont know).

Scent of chocolate and fruit when poured. Head lasts forever. Does not burn your throat at all when you drink it quickly. Paid 2.75 for a 16.9 oz. bottle of this. Not bad at all. One bottle got me buzzed because its so easy to put down.
Es una buena cerveza de trigo. Por supuesto alemana. Mejor que loa normal. Lo que no entiendo mucho es porque tiene la misma gradacion alcoholica que la que no es doble

Cloudy brown with a surprisingly white head for such a dark colored beer. Tart and yeasty in aroma with some smoke and leather. The chocolate and banana in the aroma come together in a strange chemical like smell almost like spray paint or magic marker. That aroma comes through in the flavor also. Thin in body with some chalkiness.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2010 Bottle:  The aroma consists of caramel, roasted malts, grain, and a hint of citrus.  It pours a cloudy orangish-brown with a moderate off-white head that fades to a thin cap of foam.  The flavor starts with caramel, roasted malt, and grain.  The finish has light citrus and wheat notes, coffee, and the slightest hint of banana.  Its medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.  Not bad, but a little too much on the roasty and grainy side and not enough weizen flavors for my preferences.

(bottle)  Pours a light walnut brown.  Develops an immense, lasting, light-brown head and a deep, almost opaque mahogany hue (the color of a sunset through a sandstorm) in the glass.  Aroma is yeasty and wheaty, with undertones of sweet fruit and slight hints of nuttiness and coffee.  Overall, though, the flavor is watered-down, weak and disappointing after the inviting smell.  Taste is initially a little sweet, then a touch doughy, before finishing with a burst of sweetness that is somewhat sickening.  Palate is creamy and a tad watery; it fills the mouth and slides easily to the throat.  Overall, it feels nice to drink this one, but the flavor could definitely be more diverse.
swampy/murky dark brown with a cream head.the flavor and aroma contained metal,smoke,bananas,and malts.

The pour is a cloudy wheat brown that I recollect as being slightly "gray".  The nose was pleasant and along the lines of a wheaty bock.  The front of this beer is superb as the mouthfeel is nice and the carbonation average but very smoothe.  Theres a bit of a bite.  For my taste it was odd to move from this sweet bock-ish beginning into the hefeweisen lemon/banana-pepper middle.  Its the "clove" part that bothers me the most.  Also, I was disappointed in the "dirty" alt-beer finish.  Overall, however, this beer mixes some good malt and wheat qualities and it is certainly smoothe textured.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2006 Bottle.

Pourse brown with a nice beige head. The flavour is fruity ( maybe bananas and lemon??) and somewhat tart, but not too much of either. Really quaffable and enjoayble, i think it lives up to the expectations for a Dunkel. One interesting note is that everytime i had a sip of it the head seemed to recompose itself till you could see it in the bottom of the empty glass!!
A fairly decent offering by the Germans. I could have used a little more "Dunkel" but I enjoyed the "hefeweissbier". Wow, this stuff will get you drunk.

Whats not to love about this bier?  It is incredibly smooth, has the flavor of a rich heffeweissbier, and is not too acidic or lemonady.  Also, this is one of the few beers that I cannot pour with zero head which makes it a fun challenge.  Its pallate is a bit thin in some ways but thats, I think, mostly because there is no one flavor dominating it - as Ive said, it is smooth.
An interesting combo. Pours a deep, ruby-brown color with an orange tint. Huge rocky off-white head. Sorta bland yeasty bannana aroma. Very earthy taste. Smooth, malty finish. Enjoyable brew.
Bottle:  Dark brown, a few shades lighter than a mahogoney.  Some yeast in the aroma.  I got some clove and banana also.  Some floaties.  Tastey.

Brown with hints of red and an off-white head of foam.  Aromas are wheat with an acidic edge, also has light chocolate and banana notes.  Flavours are chocolate and wheat - it could be a childrens breakfast cereal.  Hints of berry sourness is also evident along with  lemon near the finish.  Has a fairly dry finish.  Decent but I was hoping for more depth.

This beer has a orange body - hue apperance and a coarse white scum collar. I have drunk the beer from the bottle and it had not much carbonic acid. The initial flavor taste is moutig with light moutig afther tast .

Like the standard Hefe-Weissbier, I sampled the 0.5L bottled variety, which pours hazy light brown in color and with a huge off-white head that left some decent lacing.  Like its sibling, the subtle aroma points to light citrus, floral and overripe banana.  The initial palate is refreshingly zesty, but departs from its counterpart with the presence of a lightly caramel sweetness.  Still the expected lemony, orange, banana and clove spiciness develops by mid-palate.  The carbonation level is superb--crisp and refreshing--but not overdone.  The finish, too, is strong and, again, pleasingly refreshing.  Like the Hefe-Weissbier , Im rating this beer high, but just a notch lower.

Aroma is a very nice array of banana mush and banana bread laced with tangy mango, slight caramel, spritzed with lemon, and the perfect amount of typical clove hefe yeast spice.

Beatifully clouded dark leather brown color with a miraculously tall cap of finely whipped tannish cream that creeps and murks its way down to a hefty skim. Laces in one big drippy sheet.

Taste is a lightly softened tangy and smoothly clean delight of lemony bananas mixed over a pretty solid caramel malt backing. All the while maintains a more dryish malt character and softer clove spice underneath the sweet tang and fruits which floats through consistently right on to the finish where it stays dry and kinda dullish with a pale tang undertow of lemon meringue and a ghostly chocolate roast.

Feel is quite clean with a boastful little shot of carbonation within a semi-soft, steardy, smoothened, creamy medium body. Softly tangy and fruity while dryish over the top and not overly spiced with too much clove; which I like. Mends into an earthy dryish tang in the finish. 
This grew on me by leaps and bounds as I continued to enjoy it more and more after each sip. The softer smooth body is more to my liking compared to most weizen type brews. Quite smooth and nealry chewy with the perfect tang and spice. A solid dunkel.

had never seen this bottle before, had to give it a try.  aroma was yeasty, with typical hefe aromas (banana/clove/etc).  big tan head, with medium brown color.  flavor is sweet and.....sweet.  a little banana in the flavor as well.  kinda unimpressive as dunkels go, especially since i like most other spaten offerings quite a bit.

1 pint 0.9 fl oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy light brown with thick light-tan head.  Some effervescence.  Aroma is of light roasty chocolatey malts along with the yeasty combination of sweet and sour fruits.  Cherries are present in the nose.  Taste has a nice balance to it.  Starts with some solid malty sweetness and finishes with some tangy yeasty fruitiness.  Medium body.  Smooth yet crisp.  Nice beer.

[on tap at Sunset Grill and Tap] Cloudy medium brown colour with nice, white, foamy blanket thats clingy and patchy.  Clovey, lemony aroma with not too much else.  Musty and clovey taste with citrusy, lemonade aftertaste thats refreshing and not unpleasant.  Some barely perceptible bittering and a weak caramel note.  Light to medium body with a clean, crisp finish.  Ive had this beer from a bottle and liked it much more--may have to re-rate.
A marriage made in Beer Heaven.  The union of Dunkel and Hefe-Weisse bring forth an offspring so pure and good it should be Sainted immediately.  Good, good, and good.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottled. Brown, cloudy and huge white head. Wheaty, malty and pretty sour aroma. Taste of wheat and sweet malt, with a bit bitter finish.

cloudy brownish color w/ a big buble big head of light tan color w/ good lacing aroma was very light a bit malty the palate was a nice medium body lightly carbonated and a little creamy.  The flavor was of light malt and banannas.  Overall i liked this beer.

Cloudy copper colored beer with a nice creamy head.  Pleasant yeasty, malty aroma.  Nice smooth flavor, a little light in body but very refreshing.  Flavors are less pronounced than some dunkels I have had, but good nonetheless.   Slightly tart lemony finish.  Pretty good, but not a standout.
Best dunkel yet.  Didnt have the biting palate that Ive come to expect from German wheats.

Bottled
Sweet, sourish aroma with notes of raisins.  Giant creamy head, brown color. Sweet, toffe notes, tart lemon note. Light astringent finish. Not too complex, but pleasant drinkable.
Poured a very cloudy brownish gold color with a medium head.  fruity banana scent with a bit of yeast and hops added.  Malty and yeasty flavor with some banana and other fruity tones.
This is a fine beer that is commonly served too cold. If it has a thick full head, drink this beer, if its flat with little to no head, send it back.

Cloudy thick pour with a small white head, I almost expected to see some sort of chunks come out of the bottle. Spicy, fruity flavor with mild carbonation. I am not familiar with this style but would recommend it and will probably have it again.
Hazy amber, white head. Smoky aroma with malt and chocolate. Malty flavor as well, fruity from banana and with vanilla. Smoky notes.

Bottled. 
Muddy copper colour. Big banana nose along with a slight phenolic smokiness. Flavour is rich, fruity and sweetish, the banana comes late. Medium bodied.

This one is a true weiss beer. Has a very pleasant rich flavor. Has a non-overwhelming sweetness. It is not thick, but it is very flavorful. Ive tried other weiss beers, but this one does it best for me. I had it on tap once and its even better that way.
Very full head.  Has a nice flavor, but not nearly as strong or potent as it could, and should, be.  Reminds me of a Schniederwiesse and maybe a Belgian Ale together but simply not that impressive.

Bottle: Pub in Bremen, Germany. Hazy copper colour pour with a nice fluffy-creme head that lingered throughout. Nothing special, but very smoothe. Bananas, lemon, yeast is the biggest taste. Some other flavours, maybe toffe and cloves, but not very well represented. big up the fat guy on the front. Heäs livin it!

Pours a cloudy and mirky brown, almost like a big muddy puddle.  Small, grey head.  Smells strongly of bananas, vanilla and cloves.  Very carbonated.  Tastes sweet and citrusty.  Tiny bit spicey.  Mouth watering, makes you pucker-up a bit.  Somewhat thin for a dunkel - seems like its missing something.  Others say wheat and yeast - for lack of a better idea, Ill agree that it could use some more.  Once the carbonation settled down, I enjoyed the second half of the beer much more.
Hazy cobber color, big creamy head. Strong yeasty aroma. Taste , all yeast dominating.

Murky dark amber color with a thick, creamy off white head. Spicy, fruity aroma of banana, cloves and apple.
Mild malt flavor with hints of yeast, fruits and spices. Very refreshing and drinkable beer.
An okay dunkel, but not one of the best. Cloudy appearance, fruity aroma and lots of sweet fruit in the flavour. Lacks some yeast and wheat.
bottle.  cloudy, dark amber with very nice lace.  subdued wheat flavors but true to the style.  a very nice beer.

Pours cloudy amber with lots of creamy off white head. Aromas of yeast and lemon, a bit of mint. Really nice soft clean mouthfeel. Taste is lemony with smooth maltiness and a slightly sour yeasty finish. Very pleasant. And an extra point overall for the label with the very satisfied-looking guy patting his tummy.

Murky brown, very pretty head, lightly brown, creamy, good lacing.  Nose banana, toffee, caramel, mild spice.  Good malty flavor, nice caramel tones mixed with candy sugars and light spice.  Richly raisiny.  Is mildly metallic at the end.

Pours cloudy brown with a medium tan head that laces well.  Nose is fruity and banana.  Suprisingly dry with banana, clove (my buddy says nutmeg), yeast notes, slight smokiness and pronounced chocolate finish that is nevertheless clean and not at all bitter.  A refreshing winter weizen

Bottle.  Fruity yeasty aroma with vinous sour notes of dried fruits as well as bananas and cloves.  Slight musty-smoke notes in the nose as well.  A delight to smell.  Murky brownish color with ruby tints and a fine bubbly khaki colored head (does not look like beer in photo).  Astringent sourness to start, turning into an interesting middle and finish.  Roasted smoked notes turning sweet like molasses, then finishing with chocolate malts.  Mildly dry finish.  Astringency is a bit much to start.  Decent stuff.

Creamy and adherent foam. Much persistent one. Dark and intense color, cleaned up, not torbid brown. Intense scent you Weisse but at the same time much bitter. Strongly and with a body of good structure.

Caramel coloured with massive white head. Aroma distinctly of bananas and slight sourness. Tasted quite mild, a little hint of apples, oddly. Overall a nice enough hefe, perhaps a little light on in the flavour department, the addition of roast malt has not imparted much of the characteristic cara/choc/toff/coffee.

ahhhh.  Now I get it.  The menu at MacGreggors called this a Dunkel.  So I was wondering why it tasted so wheaty.  It was pretty good, but I was dissapointed cause I was really looking for a nice malty Dunkel.  Still decent though.
Poured dark, large head.Good wheat presence. and I also detect some sourness. Kind of flowery and perfumey, I guess this is a good beer. But I really did not like it, mabye this
One of my flavorite morning beers.  Yeasty aroma, lite on clove and bannana.  Hazy and very lively in the glass.  Slight sourness and caramel taste.  Full and creamy.  Fits the profile of this style.
Orange brown, beige tall head. Sourish yeasty aroma. Mild yeasty flavour. Roasted malts. Very watery palate.
Pours hazy brown-dark amber. Thick fluffy head. Good wheat-malt aroma. Hints of banana in aftertaste. Playing favorites might be reflected in my score. But still an all-time favorite.
poured a murky brown color thick tan head.  Mostly malts to this beer. A good wheat presence but lacked a hearty roasted aspect.
bottle at saucer:  trhe pour was a murkey reddish brown with a BIG fluffy head.  the aroma is of banana and cloves and caramel.  the taste is banana, cloves fruity, caramel with a lively mouth feel.

Pours a cloudy, muddy water brown, with a fluffy tan head.
Thin sheet of lacing. 
Aroma is dusty, clove, cooked bannana, toasted wheat. 
mouthfeel is creamy 
Flavor is clove, roasted grain, bannana bread.
Finish is crisp, with a dusting of grain.

Nice refreshing beer.
UPDATED: JAN 30, 2006 Better than norma Weize from Franziskaner, maybe because I like dark beers. BUt its superb.

Bottle.  Strong aroma of banana and slight clove -more than an average dunkel.  Light brown cloudy color.  Taste is rather light - banana and malt detectable but weak especially for a dunkel - way too light for a dunkel.
Dark muddy water appearance with a large white head.  Wheaty, yeasty nose.  Wheaty slightly earthy taste with a hint of orange.  A reasonable weissbier, a little tinny in taste.

16oz bottle: Aroma is classic hefe with a bit of chocolate and a hint of banana mixed in. An interesting combination. Pours orange-brown in the glass with a tan head. Decent mouth feel, reminds me of normal dark beers. Definately a hefe for dark beer lovers.

Cloudy orange-brown body, medium light tan head.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Flavor is mostly the same although tangy wheat, toast, and a hint of chocolate keep the yeast from totally dominating the palate.  Not as good as their regular Hefe-Weissbier but still not too shabby.

Dark brown-cloudy with lofty, protein-ladden head. Light malts for how dark but very smooth and neither dry nor sweet but very much mellow. Slight nanner tones and minimal apple. Mostly a weak apple sauce flavor. All in all, rather bland. But not bad.

Very large tan coloured head sat on top of a murky light brown body. The aroma was of lemon, cloves, yeast and maybe some cinnamon. Taste was slightly watery, smooth, a bit tart, soft spice and some pear. I was expecting more but at least it was a little different.

Sampled at the Ludwig's Garten Oktoberfest party.  Poured a cloudy reddish brown color with a large off white head and nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma was sweet with banana and clove esters.  Taste was roasty, yet at the same time sweet with more banana and clove.  An average dunkelweisse.

My first of this interesting style.    Very smoky.  Dark chocolatey color.   Huge frothy head that took a long time to dissipate.   Smells similiar to an Aventinus, but its taste is different.  Sweetness follows.  Smooth.  I can feel that this is related to their Hefeweisse, but I do enjoy that one more.
My first of this style. Very smooth and easy drinking. I didnt taste any of the characteristics of a hefe, but the roasted malt was still good.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2004 In the 0.5 L bottle. Massive beige head bursting above the weizen glass. Glorious murky brown yeasty cloudy color. Delicious aroma of esters. Tart and sweet in taste. Indeed, this is my favorite of the litter. Drink it outside on an almost fall Nebraska Friday afternoon. Life is good.
UPDATE: Now on tap at the Crescent Moon Alehouse (12/07/04).

Appearance: deep, murky, reddish brown color, with a huge, puffy, creamy head.
Aroma: sweet, spicy, yeasty, breadish, hints of raisins, cocoa, figs, vanilla, caramel...really complex stuff! Heady, potent, rich, sweet, sour, spectacular!
Lush, smooth mouthfeel. Big fruit and malt in the flavor. Soft, smooth, hoppy.
A delicious sweet fruitiness runs through the length of the brew, and rewards one in each and every sip. Yeast is a strong flavor component, giving an overall feel of sweet, fruity bread, all blended up and beery of course!
Dunkel weizen is an incredible style done right, and this is one of those!

The best I could do was to pour this into my Shneider Aventinus glass. Was it goint to acquire, by some Lamarckian magic, the qualities of such a fine beer? Quite possibly not but nevertheless it did look quite fine in the glass. the booming head as per the picture and a fine amber hue. The whiff of wheat combined with a rasin toast aroma of cinnamon and rasin is quite a welcome one. I found the body to be acceptable given the ABV of this beer and consider the complexity of flavours to be those of a good beer of this nature. Considering that in most cases I would turn right away from a beer that had wheat in it I am happy to call this a beer of good quality and pleasant disposition.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: On tap. Poured a hazy medium brown with a small head. Wheaty, roasty and light spicey aroma and tastes. Very watery and thin body (yuck). The body completely turned me off the tastes of this beer (I could not get beyond it).
Cloudy brown with a huge foamy white head. Aroma of cloves cinamon and spice. A sweeter beer with cloves and slight banana taste. Smooth with the bite you find at the end of a hefe.

Pours a brown/amber color, hazy with an off-white rocky head that died quite quickly. The lace was decent and the head maintained a light layer for most of the time. Aroma was of cloves, bananas ? fruity with some citrus hints. The taste was sweet and citrusy with bananas and a tart finish. The feel was smooth, effervescent, and a little bite at the end: medium bodied and well balanced.

It is an enjoyable beer with interesting characteristics of a hefe and a dunkel. Finish was a little dry and tart. Not as well balanced as some hefe-weizens.
HUGE frothy head, lasting.  Nice copper color.  Wheat, apples, and malt dominate the aroma.  Smooth, thin body.  Spicey, cinnamon, cider, malt taste to it, slightly watery.

Bottle.  Poured a cloudy brown. Big, fluffy, tannish head.  Smells like a Hefe.  Spices, yeast in flavor and aroma.  Malt is helped by the roasted grain addition.  Mouthfeel is light like a hefe.  Decent.

08.19.04  .5l bottle.  Pours a cloudy, cidery, rusty brown with a big ole tan head.  Aromas of the usual wheaty weizen, some sourness to be noted in aroma as well.  Flavor smacks with a sour wheat twist like fresh from the oven, eyasty bread.  Hints of banana and honey in flavor, but not very sweet.  A nice beer, balanced, but underwhelming.  Some of the acidity lingers unpleasantly as an aftereffect.

Bottle at yeomans Road Pub in Tampa. Maybe I dont like Dunkels, but this doesnt seem near as good to me as the Hefe from Spaten. Something metallic in the taste that lingers even after it warms up. Ive had a few so I can only assume it is inherent in the beer.
Pours a dark brown color. Very cloudy. Has a big off-white head. Aroma is strongly sweet and fruity. Smells a little like apple juice. Tastes very sweet. Really spicy kick. I am enjoying this beer.

(500 ml bottle, bought in Denmark). Cloudy brown colour, large lasting head. Aroma of brown bread and some spicy sweetness. Flavour is malty but not overly sweet, some spicy and subtly roasted edges. Smooth and mellow, nothing to blow your socks off, but still a beer it is a pleasure to drink. I had it on its own, must be good with a meal too.

Dark red color, white vanishing head. Sweet and roasted malty aroma. High carbonated and slightly bland flavor, nicely hopped. Carbonation is too strong and body too thin, aftertaste saves much with lasting sweet coffee taste.
Poured dark with rich head...sweet malty wheat aroma...spicy flavor...finishes too yeasty for me...good dunkel though...
Sweet aroma of wheat.  Cloudy and brown.  Flavor is sour wheat, thin and mild.  Not as sweet as the lighter version.  Im disappointed.
Dark brown color, aroma is yeast, light spicy taste, medium body, light smooth finish.

Bottle: Cloudy brown colour with a thick beige head. Has the distinct Hefe-Smell and Hefe-Taste. Eventhough I cannot see the benefits of the ´dunkel´ variant is still a pretty good beer. My recommendation: go with the original Hefe-Weissbier.
This is enjoyable; nice head, pretty hues in the murky body, and a subtle, somewhat thin taste.  A bit weak on aroma though, very faint and thin.  Not quite as hefe as most hefes.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2005 Bottle. Banana aroma. Slightly muddy brown colour, big head. Malty, roasted, wheaty flavour, hint of citrus. Slightly sour aftertaste.
On tap. Brown appearance with a small head.  Has a smooth brown sugar-like flavor and some spices.  The finish is a little weak though.

Brownish color with a large head.  Not a very enticing aroma: mild wheat, perhaps some malt.  The taste is equally bland, but there was an unforgiving aftertaste about 3 minutes later.  Its as if the wheat turns bad as it hits your digestive tract.
Dark Brown Coloring.  Big Head.  Pretty Smooth,  Non-Distinctive Beer.  Would Pick the Hefe-Weiss First.

Pours a nice dark cloudy brown with a huge white head that lasts forever. Aroma is mostly malt and some yeast. Flavor is a bit thin dominated by the roasted malt. Some sweetness like brown sugar as well, but not a whole lot. Finish is dry. Leaves a chocolate roasted malt taste in your mouth for awhile. Maybe Im having a bad day thus a string of low ratings, but this is a quite unremarkable hefe variation. Odd though because I like their regular Hefe alot.
Bottle. Pours a nice rusty brown colour with a good tan head. Aroma is yeast, bananas and cloves. Flavour is the same plus malt and caramel. Smooth with an excellent mouthfeel. A very good dunkel.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2004 This crap was horrible.  It smelled worse than a sack of assholes and tasted like muddy water with rancid donkey piiss mixed in.  I like hefeweizens but my opinon of dunkelweizens are that they suck ass.  I dont know why the slimy fuck on the bottle is smiling he must be a real jerk off.

Rusty amber color with a large, off-white head.  Aroma is darker yet less full than their Hefe-Weisse and slightly roasty.  Flavor is yeasty, spicy, and full.  As refreshing as the regular hefe but not as good overall.
Slight banana, citrus, wheat; spicy and acid flavor; a bit dry; a littel funky in flavor and not very appealing

Bottle into small plastic tasting cup, Humulus Lupus @ Jaks Tap (Chicago).  Smelled characteristic (wheaty and acidic).  Brown in the cup.  Tasted like a wheat beer, but with pleasant creamy malt weaved in.  Well balanced flavor.  Full bodied and smooth in the mouth.  Enjoyable.
Tap in Moscow.  This beer pours a beautiful dark color with a very large wheat beer head.  Smells of esters and yeasts.  Drinks very smooth and refreshing.  This is a great dunkel.

Pours a splendid, cloudy rust color with a massive tan head.  Aroma is very spicy and fruity, as is the flavor.  Bananas, clove, coriander, and cinnamon all present.  Flavor also displays a bit of rye-bread flavor, which was very good.  Ends grassy.  Very good.

poured orange brown with a big fluffy head. aroma yeast citrus caramel. flavoryeasty caramel fruity lighty sweet and lighty bitter.at 1st taste I didnt think I was going to like this beer but as it warmed the flavors got better.not to bad of a beer
Deep and dark in color with a nice tan head. Cloudy. Yeasty. Very malty. Caramel. Hoppy aroma. Spicey. Clove.  Banana. Decent beer. Smooth and clean tasting.

This beer did not impress me too much. Very bland and one dimensional. Nice pour. Giant head foamy and yeasty. Nice and spicy in the nose and uptake but all in all very one dimensional.
grat

Sampled draught at Bull & Bear Inn, Stockholm.
Muddy orange, creamy head. Lihtly phenolic nose. Sweet with clean mouthfeel and some toffee. Lightly bready. Overall decent, but too clean, and offering too little out of interest.

Indiana Ale Fest at Fort Wayne. Bottle. A medium sized off-white head with fine-small sized bubbles that fully diminished. Uncarbonated, semi-transparent and a brown hue. The hue was too light for this beer being a Dunkelweizen. The aroma was hoppy, spicy and clove. It had a malty, clove and fruity taste. The mouthfeel was smooth, watery and thin. Not impressed with this one.

Light brown, almost cola color, with a tan head which remains for  a while... pour this one slow.  Wheat beer aroma with some caramel, grass and smoky malts.  Taste is pretty good.  Banana stands out, as do cloves and some fruit, the maltiness and coffee notes add another dimension to an already fine beer.  Maybe a bit thin, but still, easy drinkin!

This bottled brew poured a large head of off-white colored mostly diminishing bubbles the diminished for a log while then suddenly stopped and stayed around for a long time.  The body was softly carbonated transparent and brown colored.  The mouth feel was smooth initially and mildly tingly in the finish.  The flavor contained notes of wheat and yeast.  It was not very Dunkelish IMHO.

Delicious.  Chewy and juicy body, lightened by the wheat.  Strong and distinct apple/clove aroma.  Nice spicy tart finish.  Very refreshing while being satisfying on the body side of things.  Interesting, one of my favorites.

Cloudy orange brown with a collapsing creamy off-white head. Sweet banana and wheat aroma. Banana sweetness up front then a bit of wheat then it falls flat on its face and all flavor dissapears. Body is medium-light with a dryish finish. Overall a dissapointment.

On tap.  Hazy brown coloring with a small off-white head.  The flavor was very complex, so much so that I couldnt really figure it out - I picked up on a lot of heavy spice, and maybe some toffee and cinnamon.  Went down very smooth.  This would be a very good beer for a summer night.

A bit of froth.  Very yellow color, and bold honey overtones.  A good afternoon beer, but I would be troubled to advise what food it should go along with.  All the same, a nice smooth beer to get you down your drinking road.

pours a dark hazy brown with a thick tan head that goes till the end of the glass.  smells of coffee.  tastes more like coffee.  a really good dunkelweizen.  my #3 of 3 of these beers.  i like this one alot

Great head, large bubbles with long retention time. Color is a swampy brown with minimal transmittance. Aroma is slightly nutty. Light bodied with a fair amount of carbonation. Nutty and dry. Only slightly bitter. Quite mild. A good drinking beer, but not anything that will jump out and grab you.
this was a very mediocre beer. a bit bland taste, and overly wheaty. there are better ones outthere
Draught. Typical cloudy wheat flavor with light bananna notes. Typical HW: wheat and bananna.

Sweet aroma with some sourness to it. Taste was spread a bit thin, but teasingly sweet with toffee (best flavor i can describe) or something along the lines of a more sour butterscotch. finished very dry.

Bottled
Hazy nut brown. Big creamy off-white head. Crisp banana aroma. Crisp carbonated mouthfeel, some sweet banana taste. Aftertaste a bit sour and roasted.

Nice cloudy brown color with a big ol rocky head on top! The aroma is caramel, banana, weak malt, yeast and some spicyness too. Although i find the flavor too thin. There is some yeast and spices, but it have could be a lot more in my opinion. Too thin!

Cloudy medium brown color with a massive off white fluffy head.  Aroma is appealing with wheat, banana, and a bit of spice.  Bit of maltiness to go with the wheat and banana.  I like the straight hefe better.
Bottle.  Brown, hazy appearance with large off-white head.  Aroma is slightly yeasty and spicy as is the flavor.  Has a little more of a malt flavor than the club-weiss bier.
Not as strongly flavored as I thought it was going to be. Seemed a little too similar to a regular hefeweizen to me, but was still a nice, easy to drink wheat beer.
(bottle) Medium brown with nice light tan head. Bready aroma. Warm flavors of malt, molasses, carmel with definate yeast notes. Slightly sweet
UPDATED: JUN 13, 2005 Smells a lot like bubble gum.  Thats a first.  Looks like a brown ale.  Taste rasiny sweet with molasses.  Smooth syrupy finish.  Not bad.
Pleasant. Surprised as I was the first time that this doesn't stand up as well as its lighter sibling. Same seems to hold for many dunkles in my opinion. Wonder why?
Deep copper in color with ruby highlights and a thick off-white head. Aroma od fruit,banana,yeast, and roasted malt. Flavor os sweet malt,caramel,fruit and mild banana.
(Bottle)  Pours a cloudy medium brown color with a descent sized head.  Has flavors of caramel, malt, and wheat with a brown sugar and banana aroma.

Pretty hazy colour with a big tan head. Initially sweet (caramel, brown sugar) followed by the "trademark" freshness/ acidity of Franziskaner. I also noted cloves. A very nice Dunkel Weissbier but I usually prefer the "normal" ones (fruitier and more refreshing).
Pours hazy brown with large tan head.  Nice banana aroma.  Flavor had a little caramel with a mild lemon tartness.  Not as flavorful as expected, but still nice.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2008 (Bottled) Hazy dark amber with a large, foamy-wobbly head. Dryish, quite banana-estery aroma with some breadiness and toffeeish, roasty malt. Bready-malty, dry-bananaish flavor with no bitterness and a smooth, mellow finish. Medium-bodied, high- but soft-carbonated palate. A balanced, very clean, very basic and true to the style Dunkelweizen. Not very complex or interesting, that is.

Brown with a slight red hue. Frothy off white head floats on top, eventually diminishes. Aroma is sweet and slightly smells of coffee and carmel aromas dominated by yeasty esters. Unique malty taste. Dry crisp finish as most wheats do. Nice lacework.

the beer poured a a hazey brownwith a big head that subsided quickly. the aromas are rather belgian like with fruit, bananas, clove, yeast and fresh bread. the flavor was of sweet malt, caromel, and orange. the beer becomes rather thin and watery for the finish. a little maly sweetness hangs on. A little dissapointing. I was expecting a little more wheatyness. I did notice who owns the brewery.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2004 Huge white head that would not go away. I think that this detracted a little from the overall experience. Notes of grass and earthy or musty smell that is as pleasant as it is subtle. Dark and cloudy like muddy pond water. Smooth malitness is the strongest character with a little grape sweetness. The first dunkel that I really liked.

The downfall of tjis beer is it's appearance. It looks like sewage!
Aroma is of yeast, wheat and fruit. Taste is sweet with a touch of bitterness. Palate is on the thin side.
Cloudy amber colour, frothy off-white head. Very smooth. Seems to lack some of the character of Spaten's normal Hefe-weisse although I find it more drinkable. Would def. choose this one. Pint bottle.

Classic hazy, rich brown color under an enormous wheat induced whip cream head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, and fruity banana. The same as the lighter version, but witha tad more maltiness in the aroma and palate. I'll take the Dunkel over the Helles anyday. A nice beer.

Has a clouded brown color woth moderate carbonation and an off-white head.  Smell is of malts/carmel.  Taste is lightly banana yeast/carmel and finishes with a dry fizz.  Overall not the best wheat, but not the worst...  Whatever that means...

Cloudy dark copper color with a creamy moderate head and good carbonation. Good plum and raisin aroma. Light to medium body, seemed a bit flat on the tongue, with a slightly toasty dried fruit and caramel flavor well accented with clove. Short finish. Ok, but it seemed a little tired. I like dark wheat beers and am going to mark this for a retry.

Dark brown hefe dunkel.  Nice head, but it fell flat almost immediately.

Nose is malty, yeasty, with roasted malt pervading.

The taste is hevier than I expected, with the yeast and malt being overborne by the roasted malt.  Maybe some astringency/acidity too.  The mouthfeel is moderately creamy, but acidic finish does me in.
Nice head, hazy brown body. Yeasty aroma with some fruit and citrus. Flavor is yeast, wheat malt and spices.
Dark and cloudy, moderate head and no lacing. Dry hefe flavor that's well balanced. Good, but not good like the Hefe I had at Sudwerks a week prior.

Didn't enjoy this as much as the standard Franziskaner hefeweizen.  Dark color, slightly cloudy.  Flavor was not very pronounced, but slightly malty, sour and toasty.  This one needs a little more oomph.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2007 Damn, I love beer.  This is a beautiful sight ... roasty brown with perhaps the stoutest head Ive ever seen.  Nice clovey aroma.  Smooth and crisp, roasty and yeasty without the bite that many weizen drinkers distaste.  Awesome.

Light brown colour, quite cloudy, great head retention.
Aroma is clovey (but more restrained than the Hefe) with some dark malt in the back.
Flavour is softly malty with a tiny bit of toasty dark malt and a very mild acidity which makes it nicely refreshing. Pretty good.

Now, this is beer! Germans should be proud for their skill in brewing one of the best beers in the whole world! Franziskaner is made out of wheat and thus is the cloudy consistency and unique flavor of this original beer. The Dunkel or Dark version is particular good. Much foamy and much clouder than the regular Franziskaner Weissbier.

I thought this would be to the hefe what a dopplebock is to a bock. Oopsie. That's what I get for only having German language skills enough to say "I too am a jelly donut." (bonus points if you get the reference < grin >)

This is like the regular hefe without the fruit, but maltier and with a bit of spice.

Nice head and scent. Tastes...good, with hints of fruit but more spice and malt flavor. Mouthfeel is good and foamy...

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2005 Medium head over cloudy brown drink.  Thin, notes of cider.  Good for price.
*10/5/05 Rerate*
same pint .9 bottle as last time.  This beer is good, good in that it has potential to be way better.  It is much better on tap, for instance, than in this tacky bottle.  Im new to dunkelweizens, but this lacks a little flava and lot of alcohol for its dank yeastyness.  Banana and very lite citrus.  I enjoyed this over all other weizen, just needs more malt and more alcohol.

Brown body, good off-white head. Malt, wheat and banana in the aroma. Tasted drier than I was expecting, and the finish was also rather weak IMO. Michael Jackson writes of "toffee, pepper and spices" in his review, but frankly I didn't detect those flavours in my bottle. With the "darker" flavours not fully developed, this one tastes much like its pale counterpart, the Franziskaner Weissbier - which may not be bad news, after all.

Bottle. Big wheat head, bubbling away, popping and gradually sinking. Dirty brown to mahogony colour depending on the light source. A thin murky colour whatever the light. Wheat nose - slight spice, clean, acceptable, not exciting. Thin, vanishing mouthfeel, initially wet, but slightly drier in the finish. Metallic all round. Slight wheat flavours coming through with the most vague, wimpy, lazy, couldn't be bothered dark malt flavours lurking around in the background - sometimes coming forward only to vanish away quickly. This is damn poor stuff. That it is wet is the best that can be said for it. Dreadful. Dreadful.

Spice dominates the malty aroma. Beautiful big pillowy head that dissipates steadily to reveal a dark copper coloured body leaving a nice lacing. Flavour is mild banana and some clove spiciness with a nice wheat base. Mouthfeel is medium-full. Perhaps not the best example of the style but a nice beer nonetheless. Bottle.
Out of the bottle, this brew looks nice. However, the flavor is a bit more watered-down than I expected. Aroma is sharp and spicy. Finish was better than expected.
Huge tan head that dissapears withing a minute or two. Sweet (banana?) flavours with hints of yeast. A bit dissapointing taste, very flat and not as interesting as the smell.
Huge head.  Maltish, dark chalk flavors, twigs.  Some nice sweet citrus flavors with some bitterness in the end.  Fairly sweet, short, and dry.
Cloudy brown color with a thick fluffy head. Malt and wheat on the nose. Crisp and refreshing. Nice lace.
I really enjoyed the slight hint of banana tones.  Dark red-brown color, lots of bubbly good stuff. I loved this Dunkel.  Almost as good as home.
Dark red-brown. Lasting head. Nice mixture of banana and caramel notes. Spicy. Very nice. One of the best Dunkel Weizen, if not the best.
Very nice hefeweizen, cloudy appearance, very smoooth and rich, but a bit overbearing on the spices.

I tend to go through periods where I find myself buying predominantly one style over all others and right now it's dunkelweisse! A nice fresh franny poured into my .5 liter dimpled mug, the head rising like some kind of wonderfully heady-type riser thingy! The flavor is softly malty without too much yeast flavor poking in as with other dunkels I've had. Roundly malty, nicely effervescent. Delicious!

Puffy cream coloured head.  Yeasty yogurt clove nose.  Hazy ruddy brown.  Interesting dark malt notes.  Very acidic, pleasant clove-banana notes.  Creamy light-footed body.  Finishing dry, lingering yeast and hop notes.

Hmmm...curious.  Spicy aroma, clove and somewhat meaty.  A very hazy chestnut color with a fluffy white foaming and clinging head.  The palate matches in its foaming quality, but it still somewhat underwhelming and flat.  Yeasty, mildly spicy flavor, some of the qualities of the hefeweizen, but not showing the promise that the addition of extra malt should have produced.  It really faded at the end.

A murky, swampy-looking brown beer, with barely a head at all. Coriander abounds, but the flavor is lacking in originality or even wheatiness.  Smells like a light molasses.  The finish is dry, but unbalanced.

High carbonation, huge head that disappears quickly, cloudy rust color - very yeasty aroma - thin bodied, mild flavor, watery, even - cloves dominate what flavor there is - finish is almost non-existant - easy drinking, but who cares?
Banana esters with a chocolatey background to it.  Apple cider brown with some cloudiness.  Nice brown head and some lacing.  A thicker flavor and very smooth.  I really enjoyed this one!

The head on this one exploded when I first poured it.  Almost went over the top.  Very nice.  It has a murky brown color to it.  Smells like yeast, tastes like yeast.  It has a slight chocolate flavor as well.  All-in-all not a bad beer.  Not something I would search for, however.
Light, sweet, aroma ... deep, murky appearance ... sweet start, lightly bitter finish.

Brown colour with a nice dense tan head. Strong aroma of corn, yeast and wheat. Medium-bodied; Flavour full of yeast, wheat and offensive corn. Aftertaste filled with malty tastes. Not a great beer, actually worse than average. Overall, this beer is worth passing up! I had this 23 ounce beer on draught at MacGregor's in Rochester, New York on 14-October-2003.

First off, I'm not the biggest fan of dunkels. This was a pretty good beer, however. It had a great look- fluffy, white head sitting on a cloudy dark brown body. Smells yeasty like gulden draak. Light, sparkly carbonation. Tasted like your average dunkel, however a distinct twist of lemon and nutmeg hit me at the finish.
Bottled(500ml). -hazy brown coloured, toffeeish malt aroma, creamy, grainy palate

One of the best Dunkel Weizens I've had. Chestnut brown and cloudy from sediment. Huge rocky head looking like the Swiss Alps. Big roasted malt aroma with significant clove and a bit of caramel. Smooth and full bodied with a slight crispness. Nice big spicy wheat flavor that is good till the very end. Great brewery and probably my favorite in Deutschland.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Hazy gold/brown color.Lively carbonation.I think these beers smell belgian(wonder why?yummy yeast)Nice slightly roasted yeasty bananna tasting brew w/ moderate hops in there.Good stuff.Mellow.

This beer looks like liquid caramel topped by a two-finger layer of light tan whipped cream. The aroma is very bready and yeasty with hints of coriander. The taste is lively, with a nice yeastiness to the tangy wheat character. Hints of chocolate covered bananas push through the crispness and are quickly whisked away by the carbonation and cleaned up by a very faint bitterness. A full bodied mouthfeel is floated on the proliferous carbonation, which expands in the mouth and makes this beer very refreshing.

Hazy brown color with great white head (not the shark). Aroma is very authentic with clove and banana esters. Yeast is present but not assertive with smooth flavors. This is a nice german hefe with a stronger body and a little less dry than the original franziskaner.
Pours a cloudy red-amber with large head that leaves quickly.  Yeast and malt in the nose.  Sweet malt, wheat and more yeast in the flavors. Tingly palate. Good hef.

Like drinking a loaf of bread, this beer was too yeasty and deep for my tastes. Bad bottle maybe? The malt was powerful and lingering with pale banana undertones. This was not a particularly refreshing beer.
This poured a dark brown color and was cloudy, but retained a nice white head.  The taste was spritzy, yet subdued compared to other dark wheat beers that I have tried.  Still a very good beer.

Darker, cola colored and less estery.  Massively sweet malts are the dominant presence.   Yeast is present, but much less assertive.  Some roasty dryness on the tongue to finish the sweet swallow.  Enjoyed this as a class "experiment".

Bottle:  cloudy and about the color of Newcastle, maybe a shade lighter.  Beautiful large white head of tiny bubbles.  Strong aroma and flavor of banana.  A tad sweet.  A nice beer, but I think I prefer the light version.

Hazy, honey-brown body and thick, lumpy white head. Pleasing aroma of fruit, yeasty baked bread, and hints of toffee and spice. Reminds me of peach cobbler. Malty profile with some fruity sourness, distinct esters, and considerable depth imparted by the yeast. A nice beer for late summer.

50 cL bottle, wheat glass, 48 degrees.  Creamy, frothy, off-white head is of normal monstrous wheat proportions.  Deep brown to garnet body is murky from dense, tiny particles.  Deep, robust nose.  Light caramel, heavy wheat bread malt; basically absent hops; doughy yeast; heavy banana ester with a touch of spiciness.  Moderately sweet, moderately acidic flavor becomes a lightly sweet, lightly bitter, moderately acidic finish.  Flavor is somewhat watered down.  Medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation.  Flavor is spicier and less rich than the aroma.  The body could stand to be a little thicker and slicker.  The bottom line is: a little bit of a let down from the appearance / aroma.

Pours cloudy brown with a very tall head.  Relatively standard wheat beer aroma - yeasty, banana.  Overall the flavor seems muted.  Just a little yeastiness, a touch of roast malt,  and a bit a blah banana.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2004 I peer intensively, but the billowing head never appears.  Not enough yeast left in the bottle to make this weisse appropriately cloudy.  Some wheaty taste evident, but with the addition of roasted malt, I'd expect more roasted flavor too.  But it's not here.  Once the beer warms, you can catch a hint of it, but not much.  Distinct lack of estery aroma.  It is neither refreshingly wheaty/yeasty nor satisfyingly malty.  Hmmmm.

Deep, rich amberish brown coloring, with a creamy head that stays on throughout, some light lacing with an aroma that is very arousing.  Yeasty doughy flavoring with some hints of fruity, with a powerful malty sweetness and that classic german wheat taste.  Very enjoyable.
A murky brown body with an off white creamy head. A yeasty aroma, bready and hints of banana and malt. The flavor is bready with banana, malt and spices. Very nice.
Amber brown and cloudy with nice looking thick head. Spicy and fruity aroma with hints of dark candi sugar. Interesting malty/caramelly/banana flavor. A bit strange rendition of the style.
Poured an orange-ish brown with a big head. Moderate banana aroma. Really a nice beer.
Cloudy auburn colour.  Banana in aroma.  Sweet banana flavours with hints of cloves in body dry to a crisp, almost tart finish.  An outstanding representation of the style.

Pours a great looking reddish brown with big head.  Malty nose, missing the nice yeasy character of the pale hefe.  Flavor is confused, not sure I like the roasted tastes in there.  Drinkable, but not as good as the pale version.
Thanks to filthmuppet for this one. This got a rye taste hold the mayo and the coffee dark malt thing clashes with the wheat base. I like the pale one way better. It's pretty murky in there.
Hazy ruby-brown with a white long-lasting head. Aroma of banana and some smoked sausage. Taste of sweetened meat(!), smoke and some yeasty banana flavours. Yeasty and slightly smokey finish.
