very hazy, light brown with an excellent frothy light tan head. aroma is about half sweet banana, and about half very tart. not really vinegary, some sort of sourness...i'm not sure i like it...hmmm...flavor is mostly sweet with a slightly sour finish...it's OK.

0.5 L brown bottle, with gold foil over the top of it. About the same beer as the Hefe-Weisse, but not quite the same. It is darker, but it still had the whipped, white meringue head on it. Aromas are slightly different, with a more pronounced roasted character to it.
Tasted more lactic to me the the light version, still no hop aroma or flavors to it. It's an ok wheat beer, but not one I would seek out again.

Large light brown head on a dark and very cloudy body; barely any light gets through the middle.  The nose has a very malty taste and slightly watery; very smooth and drinkable.  Lots of yeast in the aroma.
Pours a huge tan head atop a hazy copper body.  Aroma is lemon, wheat, caramel.  Underflavored  light sweet, wheat, some caramel, with a mild tart lemon.  Light watery body.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2005 Rerate Not quite as flavorful this time around, too yeasty for my taste now; solid standby though. thinnish mouthfeel. Original 3.9 Thick soapy eggshell-white head. Chestnut brown cloudy appearance. Has a pleasant malty, nutty aroma. The flavor is reminiscent of sweet toasted almonds. All around one of the best Dunkels I have had.
on tap - clear, light brown, decent head. A bit thin but decent aroma and flavors of malt, wheat and yeast. Pleasant.

Starts with a deep-brownish red color and lots of foam.  The head is creamy and rich.  The nose is full with scents of plum, molasses and brown sugar... it seems like it will have a sweet taste.  The taste is a bit surprising, rather flat and not as sweet as I anticipated.  The finish is bready and thick.  Good, but heavy dunkel.

NIce clouded amber color, with considerable, but excessive, light cream colored foam.  Spicy nose, remindes me of clove and cinnamon.  Flavor is not dissapointing really.  Nothing overpowering, but some wheat taste, with a little sweetness too.  Palate is a tad bit subdued, for the flavor of the beer unfortunately.
The aroma gives dark malt first, spices later. The body is light and so is the amount of flavor. The finish is dry spice. Disappointing.
Big, rocky head that hangs fer a little while. Hazey brown color. Bready, slight bananna nose. Medium body. Caramel, yeasty, fruity and some slight hop spiceyness also. Finishes malty and dry.

Cloudy brown color,nice tall mildly tan head,Sweet wheat smell with a slight spicey and fruity smell to it.Fruity taste,mildly wheaty with a very slight spice to it,and mildly sweet.The after taste is spicey and mildly fruity with an even milder hop presence you almost have to search for it to find it.Is it a bad brew,i don't think so,but it is nothing great ethier,but well worth the try.

Looked exactly like the picture and had a light aroma of wheat and malt.  The taste was a delight, light fruit, wheat, hints of caramel.  It should be noted that at first it tasted somewhat watery to me but gradually it climbed the scales and made my tastebuds happy.

Hazy brown color with a big head and excellent lacing, more body than standard hefeweizens. A caramel sweet nose with the hints of fruit and wheat. The fruit twang is well balanced by the sweet malts. Coffee hint in aftertaste, dry. I would rate this slighty higher than their basic hefe. Recommended weiss-dunkel.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2003 Cloudy brown color. Large, long-lasting, white head.  The flavor is a sweet wheaty-malt finished with a tangy citrus zing.  I also noticed a candy aftertaste.  Not too complex, but tastes pretty good and goes down  smooth.
Hazy medium brown body with a large white head. Yeasty aroma. Some wheat, spices, and malts come through. Nothing very complex
Thick coffeeish head, dark and cloudy. An average example of a dark hefeweissen. However, imo inferior to their normal hefeweissen.

Dark hazy brown with a puffy white-tan head. The aroma is a mix of yeast, malt and some spice. The taste increases the malt and yeast but adds some citrus fruits into it. Finishes well with a smooth slightly sweet taste in the mouth. Good beer.
dark brown clody with huge head. nice yeast wheat aroma. citrus tart yeast wheat taste. tipical dunkel hefe-weissen. creamy light pilsner-esque carbronation.
I was very confused,  reminded me of an abbey more then a dunkel or a wheat.  Had to ask the waitress a few times.  dark color, belgain citrus flavors... light but flavorful.

Pours a wonderful murky, muddy brown color with a thick, creamy head...it sat on top of the glass like whipped cream topping. This beer was not really that aromatic...some banana, spice, clove, sugar... very subtle. The flavor was far more substantial...sugary, banana, spicy maltiness. Refreshingly light palate.

Large thick full lasting head. Deep amber-brown cloudy color. Aroma is malty (wheat) with roasty notes. Flavor is malty too with some spicy notes, ending in a moderately fruity short finish. Medium bodied.

Oooh!  This one pours out a very murky brown, with a huuuge head - lasted forever.  Tastes just a little musty at first, but once it opens up it's nice.  Medium to full body, with a creamy texture.  The finish is short, and a little astringent.
Aroma of wheats, some spice, malts and citrus. Cloudy brown/orange coloured, lasting head. Spicy taste, bit malty. Refreshing palate.

Dark brown/grey cloudy color, lasting head. German wheat aroma, spicy, but this has more caramelly and less citrussy notes. Taste also spicy and caramelly malty added to the typical german wheat taste. Still quite refreshing.
Excellent! Caramel hint adds nice sweet note to typical estery flavor profile.  Banana, clove, caramel, hints of lemon.  Refreshing!
Not much aroma, sweet. Fine golden color, cloudy. Great head. Smoked malt? I couldn't find any smoked notes, only sweetness.

Dark, burnt orange color with an off-white head.  The aroma is quite nice, with notes of banana, clove and dry wheat.  The flavor is not quite as interesting, as most of the banana and clove seem to be missing.  There are nice malts, however, bringing out caramel and toffee notes.  Tasty but not too exciting.

Big off white head, dark orange/brown color. Malt and yeast aroma, a little citrus. Malt flavor, then some wheat and banana. Not too bitter, smooth, but lacking dimension and much flavor. I prefer the not-so-dunkel version. I think the monk on the label has had his share of hefe-weissebier.

1/4 draught: Dark amber colour with a huge beige head. Clovey-yeasty aroma with hints of banana and dark grains. Slight toasted flavour, nutty?, lovely taste, slightly tart.. Very well balanced. Once again a slight vanilla/banana aftertaste. Not as full in mouthfeel as the pale hefe though?

Yeasty, caramel hefe aroma, with only a small bit of wheat musk.  Gritty, persistant, off-white head.  Hazy caramel brew.  The monk on the label is a cross between Norman Rockwell and 1930's propaganda art.   Sweet, worty, toffeeish and mildly hopped.  A certain balanced vacancy between the initial taste and the finish.  Brown sugary initial finish which quickly fades to pepper. Solid mouthfeel.  A good weiss.
Good deal. Faint aroma, poured with large head, merky brownish color, malty, heavy on the yeast, some wheat, little hops. A good beer. Does it get any more German than this?
This is a very pleasant German Wheat.  Doesn't quite have the banana/clove taste I've become accustomed to but this beer has very good balance.
Nice malty aroma and taste. Pours a light copper with a mostly diminishing head.  Another good example of a German Wheat, but there are better ones out there.

Dark brown color, hazy. Large head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and bananas. A nice medium bodied dunkel weiss. Malts are slightly roasted chocolate malts. Slightly sweet. Citrus, chocolate and banana flavors. Slightly spicy. Light and refreshing. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Deep amber colour with a  huge, creamy head. Light aroma with fruity (citrus) traces. The taste is quite delicate, with roasted malt flavour, fruity traces (banana, citrus) and the typical yeast flavour of "hefe weissbier". Good, but not so different from the "regular" Franziskaner.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2009 Dark, hazy amber colour. The usual huge "German Wheat-Head"; looks great. Refreshing yeasty citrus aroma. The flavour is pretty much like the aroma with some toffee and roasted malt added.

Bottle.  A swampy brown color with a foamy tan head.  A citrus, banana, and typical but understated german wheat aroma.  A bit darker and maltier than a german wheat but maintains basically the same character.
UPDATED: OCT 12, 2004 Good rocky head, dark brown-gold color.  Banana aroma, slightly spicy.  Refreshing, light body, but retains some grainy wheat flavors among the slightly tart, spicy flavors.

I told myself I would never purchase this beer in the US because my last memories are drinking it during Oktoberfest in Munchen.  But...I caved, and it is just not the same.  Very stale, little wheat flavor and body.  Thin body and only musings of malt.  Disappointing.
A nice dunkel, and fairly inexpensive. A worthy purchase, though not exceptional.
Medium head on a dark amber body.  Head is creamy and sustained.  Malty aromas, with smooth and mild flavors of lemons.
Lemony and malty, a bit of fermenting fruit and a nice thick bready flavor and mouth feel, good cleaning the house brew.

Liked the look of this!
and it haves that "Something" that the Helles Hefe. dont got, some rosted malt and more deep
Good dunkel weiss, just not as good as the regular.  The darkness tames down the fruity flavors in a regular hefe.
A decent drinking beer, but nothing out of the ordinary. Had it on draught. It's a medium bodied brew, brown in color w/ a tan head & a  slightly wheaty taste.

Upon removing the cap, I was assailed by the rather enjoyable aroma of wheat grass. The beer pours a dark, opaque amber with a thick and impressive head. The beer is very smooth and goes down well, although the aftertaste does not last as long as the regular Franziskaner Hefe-Weissebier. Still, it is an excellent brew and well worth the money.

Great wheat aroma. Rich, soft slightly acidic. Huge thick head (normal for such beer), dark cloudy amber. Soft upfront with richer middle. Creamy but light, maybe a bit to light. A bit boring aftertaste, end is missing each riches, sadly. Great looking beer with great aroma, with slightly weak finish.
Wheat not really my favorite style.Absolutley High malt, dark and rich, better than expected hops, I like it

Cloudy, almost muddy brown color. Decent head but with no lacing. Flat but slightly thick on the palate. Weak wheaty malt flavor mirrored in the aroma. However, yeast is the most predominant aspect of this beer. Short finish with a minimal amount of hops.
They went a little crazy on the yeast I think, at least in my sample. I realize what a beer with less than adequate hops tastes like now.

I wish I could write extensive, descriptive comments about this beer, but I just taste malt, wheat and yeast with little hops. Huge piles of light, pillowy beige head. Mild undertones of spice, including coriander and nutmeg. Not bad.

This beer rocks.
Please refer to the commercial description as I took no notes while drinking it. However, if you enjoy other Dunkels that I have rated highly, this one should not disappoint.

A decent example of this style.
Without a doubt the most
commonly available dunkel-weisse 
in the US.  You can find better
examples on a Bavarian countryside tour.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2003 7/5/02: The head escaped my glass and came after me like a venomous snake! cloudy swampy/murky mysterious color, head finally settled dented, unsemetrical, and creepy...aroma was wheaty, spicy, yeasty...spicy, nutmeg/coriander flavor but remaining more full bodied than the usual wheat or witbeir, spicy but refreshing...Re-Rate 8/1/02: I don't like this style I really don't, I bought it thinking I hadn't had it, drank a sip, saw that I had already rated it and dumped the rest..just isn't my thang..
Usually this is quite nice. Sometimes it tastes like bandages. Caveat emptor, as they say.
Tastes almost like a regular hefe-weizen with a different color.  Could have a bit more malt, but still goes down smooth and represents its style well.
Bready clove. Cloudy brown. Full and fruity with a rye bread aftertaste.
Very similar to Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier but with a fuller taste and a larger head. Great overall.
Pours a murky brown color with a big head that easily lasts the whole way through. Flavor seemed to simply be a wheat base with some earthy malt tossed in. Not bad but not what I was expecting.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2003 beautiful dense head, aroma is pleasantly yeasty, malty sweet on finish.  really a nice, refreshing beer
yeasty, chewy and looks like mud in a glass

Bottled. Chestnut coloured but only marginaly darker than a Maisels Weisse. Good head and condition. Hints of raisins along with the typical phenols and bananas. Flavour seems muted for a dunkel with the phenol/banana notes being more apparent and  a dark malt dryness only really apparent in the finish.
murky dark; bigh head. good carbonation.  Tart, tangy, fruity.  Thinner, considering the darker color.  Some cocoa powder maltiness.  good stuff.
Nice fruity aroma, dark cloudy copper pour, big white head. Banana flavor with some good maltiness. A good German wheat.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2003 Update:  Fine caramel over the very nice basic wheat beer flavors.  This brewer presents the benchmark for Weizen.  Good stuff, though not as complex as their excellent basic Hefe-Weisse.

Old: I believe I've had better samples of this.  This one was an undifferentiated mass of dark wheat flavors which came across rather flat.  Possibly an old sample.

Had one of those pint+ bottles. Lovely fluffy head. Looks great in a glass - deep reddish brown, nearly opaque. Not very flavorful except for mild yeasty wheat aspect. Goes down smoothly and easily. Pretty much everything I could ask for in a high quality brew except for a memorable flavor, and thats kind of weird.
Nice look and smell in the glass, but not my kind of beer.  I really enjoy dunkels, but not as much the weisse bier, and when they are combined the weisse flavour wins out.
Nice dunkel, with a very rich flavor.  One of the better dunkels, and reasonably priced compared to the others.
i was expecting a bit more oomph than i got. the aroma and appearance really set you up for a decent nutty yeasty feast, but it was sort of thin and weak. not bad, but not spectacular.
Really not that impressive.  Sort of a lame taste, though it looked great in the glass.  Puffy head and thin body.
Chocolate brown, akin to a Snickers bar, with a thick and puffy tan head. Very bready and slightly cinnamony aromas. Very smooth palate wise but displaying a vinegary tone as well. Uneventful.

Hazy light chestnut color with a tall frothy light tan head. Aroma of wheat and caramel.  Flavors also tend to the caramel and light wheat flavor.  Finishes slight sweet with a slight malt sourness to cut through the sweetness.  at the bottom of the better dunkle weisses.
An unclear very dark brown beer with a good head and an aroma of yeast. It has a slightly acidic taste. An OK beer, but I rather drink Franzikaner Kristal.

Fresh clove and curry lurk beneath a golden brown murk. A wonderful white head sticks the side of the glass like a sheet of fat netting. Caramel and cloves, caramel and cloves, from my head to my toes. Deserving dunkel, but there are better. No extra points for the monk picture, but awesome nonetheless.

Medium beige head that dissipated quickly, nice copper red color.  Spicy/wheaty aroma with notes of alcohol.  Decent dunkel taste, but the finish was kind of gummy, didnt leave me with a great impression.

Nice foamy, beige head  -  a cloudy reddish brown brew. Surprisingly earthy, almost Belgian wheat smell. I tasted a chocolate-covered banana in there somewhere, and maybe a slice of green apple. Light bodied nonetheless, with a pretty weak finish.

With the head of a morangue and an amber brown body, this beer would make a nice ice cream cone.  The flavor of wheat is perceptible but a little hidden by the caramel malts.  I thought the flavor was a little flatter than the color might suggest.  Still, a nice beer to close out the summer with.

Nice head that lasted all the way through to the end. The permanent part was even a bit large for beers who do keep permanent heads. Full brown cloudy body was nice but not spectacular. Nose is slight esters with good wheaty aroma. Reminded me vaguely of brownies, but less chocolatey. Ester taste is present but a bit subdued. Nice maltiness. Would probably have rated this higher if I had tried it before having Schneider Aventinus in bottle and on tap.
Nice dark wheat beer. It reminds me pretty much of a German Bock. Again caramel in the aftertaste a little too thin head.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2003 Bottled: This is a nice dark brown cloudy beer. Looks very nice, but is a little tame in the aroma. The flavour is a little waterish, but still it has the normal 'wheat' taste. Has an accent of caramel in the aftertaste. Had expected a bit more after drinking the pale beer.
Malty. I like its color. Big head. Not a great beer in my opinion, but its good and not very expensive.
Cooked! Not much flavor. Very restrained. Lacking classic Bavarian wheat beer flavors.

A grainy, peppery nose and a chocolate-brown color with a light tan head. Dark malt and wheat taste with hints of banana. Kinda bready. Paper-like finish. Medium bodied and full-ish. Pretty good, but I liked the Paulaner counterpart to this better (see my rating).

Ripe bananas with yeast in my nose. Wonderful cloudy nut-brown body with a big frothy head. The banana and malt flavor is disappointingly weak and the finish very watery. Too weak in flavor so a underaverage Wheat!
Slightly lemon flavored malt. Spicy but a very thin finish.

Some banana aroma. Brown and murky, medium head. Not as sweet as I expected it would be. Basically this is just a Hefeweizen with a little more sweetness, but not nearly as much as some other dunkels. I get a little ripe apple flavor in the aftertaste. Kind of interesting.

Wheaty, more malty aroma that regular HW. Cloudy caramel in color with rocky head that shrank but laced. Smooth, light carb. Light body. Wheaty, malty flavor with a bit of citrus. Clean, sweet finish. Like the regular HW better, but the bottle may have been a little old.
Nice creamy head, great yeast flavor, bannana-clove. Great dark wheat.

Mahogany-reddish loks, dense beige foam. Roasted malt and raisin/prune aroma turns herbal and clove-like. Smooth palate is mildly yeasty with cloves, soft banana, apple, herbs, a touch of pepper surrounded by a light roastiness. Moderately dry in the finish. Pretty complex in the palate without ever dominating the tastebuds.
Spaten makes award winning beers that are world famous.   This beer may be one of them but it was too malty for me and I did not care for the aroma.
Quite an excellent Dunkel Weisse.  Pours a huge head (as if there was a German beer that didnt).  Malt is quite sweet and a decent finish.  Would definitely recommend

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2003 The beer as it sets in the glass a nicely Chill hazed brown, the head is gargantuan, texture is spumous, and as it erodes, it leaves a thick and sticky sheet to conceal the glass. Mostly malt in the nose, some yeast aromas, sweet brown sugar also comes to mind, start sweet and malt laden. Top is middling; the finish has a sneaky hop presence, the acidity mild, and the aftertaste dry and lingering. A pleasant drinking beer and Spaten-Franziskaner et al, occupy a reserved space in the old DBF, because it always taste good, no matter my mood or the temperature outdoors.

Nice amber-brown color, big foam that would be worthy of the seven-minute pour if I knew how to do it.  Smells like their regular hefe-weissebier, but the taste seems to have a lot more character to it.  Its pretty mellow in the beginning but sweetness and some fruitiness comes out in the middle, followed by a dry finish in which the banana flavor really comes out.    Definitely my favorite of the three Franziskaners that Ive had.  Not a bad #200!
Aroma has yeast and banana. Thin-bodied. Sweet, malty taste with yeast, banana and milk chocolate.

Aroma consists of cloves, bananas, oxidation, and toasted malts.  Flavor tries to start fruity before the onslaught of malt leaves it dead in its tracks.  Malt continue to dominate throughout the chewy finish.  Nice yeast film on roof of mouth.  Well made and very drinkable.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Nice supplement to the regular Weissbier

Rich malty aroma, dark brown color with a big fluffy head. A little maltier than I tend to like beers, but still quite good. Leaves a malty taste that I think would displease me if it didnt disperse so quickly. Overall a good solid beer.
Quite malty. Compared to the color, the taste could be stronger.
Malty and dark bouquet for a weissbier.
Very drinkable, but i would prefer the regular weissbier to this.  Obvious banana and clove flavor.
Not a lot of body, considering its dark color.
Find this a very good beer, it is refreshing, has a great head and a nice aftertaste, a little like coffee.
dark brown colour, giant creamy head, banana and corn aroma, sweet, quite flat, short finish with notes of peanuts - lacks of character

Slightly brownish, cloudy appearance with thick head. Not as malty as Edelsweiss dunkel-weiss, more like a regular hefe-weiss with the sour notes predominating and not much fruitiness. Still, a very refreshing beer.

Dark amber color with a thick creamy head that never completely dissipated.  Yeasty (cookie, banana) aroma and a faint toasted maltiness.  The aroma was almost Belgian in a way.  Taste is very acidic (citrusy), but behind the acidity is a faint toasty coffee taste as well as faint characteristic hefe flavors of banana and wheat as well as a hint of spiciness.  Overall, the acidity seems to overpower the other flavors.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2004 Head is initially huge, frothy, off-white, fully lasting. Body is hazy light brown, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted bread, burnt caramel), lightly yeasty (mold), with light notes of banana, vegetable matter, and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter, husky, unclean. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Foul stuff, this...I don't recall it being this bad years ago, but you never know what higher production can do to the final product.  Foul yeast and somewhat vegetative aroma, poor aftertaste. Looks great, but a complete drain pour.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2006 Bottle:  Cloudy brown orange with a good-sized diminishing white head, dark banana bread in the aroma, dry ending, starts and ends lightly sweet, medium bodied with a touch of sharp carbonation.
A slightly better than average wheat beer.  A good maltiness to it.
I quite enjoyed this when I had it in germany.  I didnt know what to expect from a Dunkelweiss but I was not disappointed!

for those of you who like dark beer and have yet to find a hefe you like...try this as I kind of understand the hefe lovers a little more now...and you Hefe drinkers should do the same...as true cross over beer.
This has a great aftertaste, similar to Duvel.
A nice beer to enjoy.  However, I like their regular hefe-weiss better as it has a stronger aroma and is a little more fruity than this one.
A we bit flat for my taste.  It could have been better if it werent served to me with lemon zest floating in the glass.  Much better naturally.  Good flavor and aftertaste.

big, proper head.  a little bit lighter than the other weisse-dunkels ive had.  pleasant aroma, grainy, banana and toffee, which continues on the palate.  great characteristic banana and honey, moving towards cloves and malty textures.  lively mouthfeel.  finish is a tad bit spicy, with cloves and maybe pepper?  this is head and shoulders over the erdinger weiss-dunkel i had recently.  franziskaner exceeded my expectations here.

Looks kinda like Coke, rather fizzy and with a big head--a little different, so I liked it.  Aroma surprisingly malty for a Weiss, sweet and pleasant but not remarkable; flavor echoes this, maltier and less wheaty than the Hefe (this might be the first Dunkel weiss Ive had, so perhaps this is typical), with light spiciness and lemon; good, but not spectacular.  Good body and finish; well worth trying.
Not the best dunkle Ive had but still very good. Lots of the classis hefe weizen crispness and hint of banana. The dunkle maltiness is a little hidden.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2003 Light and sweet, flavours of clove and banana dominate, not as good as i used to think, still very quaffable though.
Spaten exorts the only German beer I dont habitually find whiffy here in the states.  The also make sweeter stuff than I care for, but its quality brew.

A very nice dunkel. matches the high standard  set by their hefeweiss.
A pleasant mix of the yeasty clove-like taste that I associate with a good hefeweiss and some nice sweer maltiness.
I find this a touch overcarbonated otherwise this could rate as a classic.
Best of the dunkels in my book.
Not nearly as good as the regular hefe! Not bad, just not a great representative of the dunkel style.
A good, but not the best example of the style.
Great beer.
Normally I like the Dunkels better than the normal Hefeweisse. But this one was a little disappointing after the great normal Hefeweisse.
Yes, this lacks the crispness and yeast character of the other Franciscans but is certainly fine in its own right.
The flavor is quite acceptable, but this is a tad over-carbonated for my taste.
Pretty standard dunkel. Not too assertive, but I like mine with more balls.
plenty of flavour. a bit of coffe and a hint of socks
You know, I think im just not a big fan of weiss beers. This one had a great dark cloudy appreance with plenty of head. The flavor and aroma were just yeasty and boring however. Just not a big fan...

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2003 Copper-red, moderatley cloudy, huge, beautiful hefe head. Aroma filled with banana, wheat, spices and more. Light to medium bodied, very wheaty taste, subtle yeastiness and spicyness in the palate. Texture is a bit watery but lots of style and to get a beer of this quality for $1.59, your not going to hear me complain...infinitley drinkable

Nice dark aroma, almost chocolate-like.  Frothy head composed of large bubbles atop a cloudy-copper body.  I also noticed subtle, spicy notes. Finish is slightly alcoholic with chocolate notes again.  An undemanding yet interesting dunkel weisse.  Enjoy with pretzels.
Nice Aroma - a good dark beer - though a little bland to be my favourite! - still worth a try though
I rather enjoyed this dark wheat. Again, the affordability of this beer makes it even more attractive.
A very dark beer, but still fairly good. I cant say that I enjoyed more than some of the other FH beers, but it was still good.

Nice appearance and overall flavor but the HefeWeizen flavors are a bit masked by the dark malts. Its a nice caramelly sweet brew with a yeasty bite and thickness, but the typical Hefe flavors are thinner than expected. Still an awesome brew and treat to drink.
I enjoyed this a little more that their regular Hefe, and would like to get some more for the summer....... Working is the curse of the drinking class...- Anonymous

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2005 500ml bottle. Full, spicy, doughy yeast aroma, plenty of strong clove and banana with a hint of rich caramel, lemon and some nicely bready maltiness.  Thoroughly opaque medium amber-brown color with a fluffy, lasting, ivory head.  Flavor is mildly tart and fruity to start, becoming sweeter and maltier before the big yeast finish, more upfront spices and lingering, sweetish toffee combined with a tangy, citric presence and mild bitterness.  Lightly acidic and highly effervescent mouthfeel with a light-medium body.  Very flavorful and seemingly quite properly Old World.
First dunkel i have tried, and definitely one of the better beers i have ever tasted. Nice spicy taste like the regular hefe, but has an additional malty, caramel flavor. Loved it.
As this is the first dunkel I have sampled, I have none to compare it to.  But, this is easily as good as their regular hefe, with a slight carmel flavour.

A wonderful dunkel; the torrified wheat flavor combined with a dopple-esque toffee note and the spiciness of every German hefe make this at once very drinkable and very hearty.  Another triumph for Spaten.
Its okay - nothing great - had it at a bar on tap - they had both hefe and dunkel franziskaners - I had one of each and I actually wished I just got two of the hefe! Ill pass.
user_location: Palm Beach Gardens, FL, Florida, USA

text: Not as interesting as the pale ones, but smoothly drinkable.

I have to admit, the first time I had this I didnt like it.  I think it had something to do with the fact that i didnt know how to drink it.  I have since tried it again and found the stuff to be impressive. A good yeast-wheat beer.  very strong at first and fades to a slightly sour taste.
Bronze in color, weak aroma, properly hazy, rather weak initial and aftertaste.  For flavor and some more true to style I recommend the Franziskaner hefe-weisse (not dunkel)

Dark amber color, appopriately cloudy.
Sweet caramel-esque aroma.
Very dry, but becomes sweeter
and fruitier as you finish it.
